author: DOUG DIMMADOME
review: There's something wrong with the drivatar mechanics. They're able to accelerate faster than the players vehicle (even when In the same vehicle). I finished a race that had a large jump at the end and I was several car lengths ahead, after the jump I lost all momentum but the 3 AI behind me didn't and shot past me. I rewound several times and couldn't escape the momentum loss. IMO this is a major issue that needs to be addressed, because it will cause you to lose a race even if you're clearly in the lead.Edit: looks like the original issue was fixed in a patch...but as much as it hurts I have to keep the review as a "do not recommend."The game is constantly "trying to connect" to online servers. Its safe to say that they're broken at this point. Please stop spamming me with that message. Continuing, when connecting and disconnecting there's about a 10% chance that you lose all of your momentum. In free roam its mildly annoying, in a race it causes you to lose the race. I blame the bean-counters for the server issues. C'mon guys.Week later update: Servers seem to be fixed and the AI seem to be fixed. So I'm throwing it to a recommend now.

author: Walkman
review: This game is the copy paste from FH4 with a little bit better graphics but with ton of bugs which makes this game unplayable. There are new missions that were marketed as coop-missions but you can`t play them with friends. There is no new content in the game compared to FH4. Everything is basically the same with some improvements. Online has the same issues as FH4 had. You have to wait 10+ minutes to join the race.I`ve bought premium edition and the bonuses for VIP doesn`t work (or at least you can`t see it).On top of that there are a lot of bugs:- Lot`s of crashes- Constant disconnects from online- Unable to join friend's lobbies- Friends/Players vanishing in front of you- Sudden stops during race as if there is a wall in frony of youâ€¢ Buggy textures (yesterday all of the buidings for me kept vanishing when i was near them)I like it because i enjoyed FH4 (also new car sounds are incredible) but i expected a lot more for the 100 USD edition gameDon`t buy it right now. Wait until it`s in playable state.If the devs fix it in the future for FREE i will reconsider my reviewUpdate:It has been almost a month since the release and nothing has changed.The game has the same issues and there is no communication when the devs will fix the game.On top of the previous bugs now you can`t even do weekly challenges if you have completed expedition and story mode before.11.03.2023 nothing really changed. they add 4 cars every patch. some of them not even new but copy pasted from FH4. the dissapointing part this game is boring. i only play it because there is no casual open world racing game right now on the market

author: Volvith
review: After about 120 hours of playing, i feel like i'm finally at a point where i can definitively speak my mind.This game is fun, but i wouldn't call it a racing game so much as an arcade game.So, if i enjoyed it, why don't i recommend the game?...Well, as much as i love FH5, Most of it boils down to 2 things, the developers ignoring this community and our feedback almost entirely, and the AI in this game cheating.The AI cheats to the point of not adhering to the same laws of physics, them basically running along a train-track rather than driving on a road, and player-tethering where if an AI is close enough to the player, it will pretty much 1:1 match the performance of whatever car the player is driving.The latter is pretty blatant by itself, where if you get close enough to second place if driving in first, and then start charging as hard as you can, there will be a 10 second gap between 2nd place and 3rd, and maybe half a second between you and number 2.But worse is the physics problem.Cars drive (clip) through terrain in jumps, aren't affected by conventional slow-downs, have virtually infinite traction and are only affected by traction when the player bumps into them, and even then it feels like they have a literal ton of downforce front and back.The online games aren't much better, with cheaters running pretty much unchecked in this game.You'll have a battle-royale arcade section of the game, where you'll see players just speedhacking the game.Most of the leaderboards are populated by times that even Tool Assisted Runs couldn't replicate; Blatant cheating.So far there's been very little response by the devs, and seeing as it's been a long time, i don't see this changing.So both online and AI driving are pretty much broken to a point.Of course you can still decrease the offline difficulty to highly skilled or below (expert, pro and unbeatable are impossible to beat depending on the race type), so that's something at least...But we still got the story mode right?...There is an option to mute speech in this game, under the audio settings.If you decide to buy this game, disable all speech.This is by far the worst dialoge i have ever heard in a game, with the story missions and races being so loosely tied together, they barely even fit in the festival theme of Forza Horizon most of the time.The voice acting is somwhere between 'california karen' and 'what's up hip gamer guys'.This is a personal opinion, and you might have less problems with this than i did, so take this point with a grain of salt.Which brings me to the final point: Repetition.This game is a lot of fun, for about the first 20 hours.After that, it feels like an achievement grind with little to no reward.Many of the cars sound and perform the same, maybe with a little bit more torque here, and a slightly higher maximum speed there, but it'll start feeling like you're driving reskins pretty early on.And with 700 cars in the game, there's a lot of reskins.I could go on and on about this game.There's some things i love, the racing, the freedom, the scale and diversity of the map...But it just gets overshadowed by all the problems this game has.It's a grind in all the worst ways, with none of the reward.I can't in good conscience recommend Forza Horizon 5.When it isn't infuriating, this game can be fun, but it stopped being rewarding to play a long time ago for me.I want to love this game, but with all it's flaws, and with the developers' seeming lack of care, i can't.So my final verdict is to advice you to not buy this game.There's too many problems that will never get fixed, and more problems that are introduced from 'fixes'.And with the experience-ruining cheating of AI and online players alike... I want to love this game, but at every turn, at every corner and straight, it's trying it's hardest to make me hate it.If you're looking for a rewarding racing game, keep looking.This is the Skyrim of racing games, without any of the mod support that made Skyrim what it was.

author: Gallows
review: Forza Horizon 5 is the product of a developer who has absolutely mastered their craft.Every aspect of this game has been improved on from its predecessors. Graphics, handling, map size, customizations, car variety and more.Not only have they rehauled the graphics making it look even more impressive and gorgeous than ever before but the maps drastic size is something to really behold. Youâ€™re able to race in the dry desert, to ruins in the lost jungle, to the snowy mountains, to the beautiful coast and beaches and then all the way to an erupting volcano. They have you racing through hurricanes, sand storms, going through rivers and waterfalls. I mean, the experiences this game has are endless. Bomb soundtrack, a more casual than competitive multiplayer, and car tuning (as always) oh and donâ€™t forget anime liveries, tons and tons of anime liveries XD. All of these things will keep the longevity of this game alive for a while. The only small issue I have is they took away body kits that other cars had in the previous titles. They still have them for some cars but cars that had them before donâ€™t have them this time. Iâ€™ve been playing racing games for over 25 years and this is hands down one of the best simcade racers I have ever played. Completely stunning in every aspect. 10/10!!

author: Toreador
review: It's been 6 months and the game still has the memory leak issue that occurs after an extended play sessionNot to mention that this is exclusive to the Steam version as well as being absolutely cucked out of exclusive content like the Deluxe coupe Forza Edition (FH5 Controller exclusive) because you own the Steam version. As a bonus if you are not in to painting your nails as there is a collaboration between OPI and Forza to which you get a Ford GT with a fade pattern, nothing special right? wrong.These cars are tagged as "DLC" meaning you can not trade them, You can not buy them of the Auction house without already owning them prior but you can sell them on the Auction house for fellow owners to replace the ones they sold...The game also has Raytracing support....... In Forzavista onlySome of the vehicle models are ripped from the previous games as their License plates still use FH3/FH4's styleVehicle modifications have always been lacking even removing some isn't new like the 458 had a Liberty walk kit back in Horizon 3 but was removed most likely because of Ferrari not liking modifications being made to their cars but removing previous wide body kits from cars such as the '95 RX-7? That is right, in FH3  the RX-7 had the Rocket bunny kit as a widebody option, FH4 added "The Boss" variant to the list now in FH5 no more Rocket bunny but now we have the TCP Magic time attack body kits though are very nice widebody kits it doesn't change the fact that we still have 2 options for that carIn short. If you still want this game either get it on Xbox or buy it from the Microsoft store (Or Gamepass if you are one of them people)

author: Ansawie
review: There are a few things about this game that I would change. The AI is really not great, it feels like they're cheating and in general the balancing is horrible. With some missions it's the easiest to become first or get 3 stars and with others it seems impossible. It feels like they did not test some of the missions themselves because they're ridiculous to complete sometimes. The Horizon Arcade concept is horrible because most of the time you don't have anyone participating, making it impossible to complete it and then it starts off with "Drive 7km to the zone where the actual thing is happening." They really need to rework this system. Other than that I've been having so much fun with FH5. This is my first Forza Horizon so I can't really compare it to the others but I've been definitely enjoying making the missions, doing races with friends or just creating good cars and nice liveries.

If you liked Forza Horizon 4, you will like this too, as it takes the recipe and carries it just a little further.  Mexico part is fun, hot wheels is a bit silly but has fun moments.7.5/10

author: Jaxon_da_Bac
review: I adore this game but I can't recommend it for full price. It lacks too much to be worth the price. Big word vomit warning: I did not edit this very much it's all just a passionate word vomit. The gameplay gets pretty repetitive, all aspects of it are stumped in some way. Such as online events. The map while being big is also very boring in my opinion. There aren't any cities it's mostly just wilderness. While the wilderness looks good graphically, none of it wowed me aesthetically so the surroundings got boring after a while. The races in this game get very repetitive. There is very little variation in tracks they all kinda do the same thing. The only saving grace is the publicly posted races. I have so many nitpicks about poor game design I could write a list of 100. It's baffling. Like for instance half the road races are "street races" which is just another word for filler races. They just made half their races take place with ai traffic and pretended it was totally different when in reality all it does is give half the road races an extremely annoying "feature". This has me writing off half the road races as useless because of how frustrating it is to drive into the traffic and random crashes from the other ai cars. Also, half the races are dirt races which is okay but the vast majority of players play for road racing so it feels kind of a waste. All these factors make the races feel repetitive and unvaried. Which is a shame because the actual feel of the cars is really good. Another issue I have is that there is no form of progression in the game. It's basically just capitalism, grind for money, buy all the cars, that's it. That's the endgame. The "story" has you doing random events untill you unlock all the races after less than 20 hours of gameplay. It's really dumb. Truthfully some of the special events are fun and have you driving cool cars and even a parade float with a V8, but none of this stuff is very challenging. You just hold the accelerator and go forward until you achieve the scripted win. These special events are just made to be "eye-candy". Fun to look at and experience but shallow gameplay beyond that. Which brings me to the game in general. It was not made to be played for more than 50 hours, which is a shame given the insane price tag. It's all "eye-candy" for the mainstream audience. The game looks really good while maintaining very accessible performance. My system easily handles 120fps on high preset with an rx 6600 xt and i5-10400F (for anyone who knows what that means). For a game that realistically doesnt need more than 30fps this is very impressive. However I hardly call this a selling point, I wouldn't spend this much money on a dedicated impressive performance-graphics display. Along with this and the extremely repetitive gameplay that doesn't keep racing game and forza fans in mind, makes me feel left behind. Since the game makes for good "eye-candy" I spent most of my time listening to my own music or a podcast while I play just so that I can turn my brain off and listen. It's a good game for doing that, but again, not for the pricetag. The whole game was clearly made for people to waste money on, just to see the graphics and lots of cars and only play for like 20 hours. Plenty of my friends, forza fans btw, have bought the game, played it a bit to finish the story and get the cars they like, and then slowly got bored. The gameplay simply has no hook to keep people interested. It feels like another bloated racing game by a triple A company. For my final point, a subjective one, the Atmosphere is disappointing. The music for instance, is representative of my last point. It's not very good forza fans seem to agree. I've seen reviews from people who thought FH4's music was better, at least for the drum and bass music, which is a real shame because many people really love the drum and bass radio in FH4. My personal experience goes way back to FH1 which NAILS atmosphere to a tee. The music in that game makes the experience feel like a 2000's dance party. The whole thing has the proper energy it needed to stand out as a new racing game. Awesome music was essential because the Horizon Festival was a music/car festival with people visiting for cars and beats, and the hit soundtrack was representative of that. People who were fans of bass arena back in FH1 now find themselves disappointed in the new music, me especially. Go listen to the FH1 bass arena soundtrack yourself, it oozes with personality. Whereas the new soundtrack is filled with new pop hits, old rock scores, and lame "bass". Again very subjective but I think it kinda sucks lol. The atmosphere is lacking in general especially with the lack of a story. FH1 had funny memorable characters and a world you wished you lived in, while FH5 provides a cookie cutter world that simply exists to be the place you race in. Outside of the quirky mexican events the personality is lacking and I expect more from such a big publisher. The one good thing I need to mention before I'm done is that the gameplay is still 100 times better than NFS in my opinion even though I've been a big Need for Speed fan in the past, their gameplay is unrealistic and bizzare these days especially with their terrible "drifting". Eughhh... No don't get NFS they're too far gone. I got a PC just because all the racing games sucked on PlayStation. Except for the new Gran Turismo, but it's too late to go back now lol. Okay I'm done. Mid game overpriced. Go back to your roots playground games and turn 10. Wow me again like you did 10 years ago. Stop pumping out this cookie cutter open world racer nonesense.

author: coyotes
review: this game kind of sucks man!The biggest problem for me is the voice acting and writing is so terrible it pains me; and I can especially say this because no matter what I tried, I couldn't get the voice dialogue audio slider to work and this is a problem I've seen others complain about too (and most can fix it by just setting it to 1 instead of 0, but that still made no change for me, mine was 100 volume no matter what I did). For 140 hours, I have had to hear the Mexican characters in the game (the very few the game ACTUALLY has) speak 3 words of English then throw in a random Spanish word in every sentence. It is so damn corny it makes me believe everyone that was in charge of the writing and dialogue for this game only speaks 1 language because no bilingual person in existence speaks by throwing in words from a different language in the middle of their sentences. This alone has ruined the experience for me because of how unbelievably out of touch it feels and almost racist with some of the stereotypes that are thrown in at times. Now I wouldn't complain about this so much if the VOLUME SLIDER FOR THE VOICE LINES ACTUALLY WORKED LIKE IT WAS SUPPOSED TO- But I digressNow beyond the horrific dumpster fire that is the game's voice acting and writing; there are many other issues with the game that I never experienced once in Forza Horizon 4, which I have at least double the amount of time playing. Some other examples of issues I've experienced in only 140 hours of gameplay:- Online matchmaking very often would have issues pulling me in, I would sit around waiting for the queue and it would say that it's pulling me into a game and it was really a 50/50 on if I would actually end up in the session or not.- Multiple times have I completed a seasonal events / challenges and not received the rewards for it, such as super wheelspins, cars as rewards, etc. Because of this, I never tried to finish an entire series (4 seasons) or complete more than 2 seasons in their entirety.- There is 1 barn find in my game that is completely glitched and constantly resets its progress. Every other barn find was completed within 1-3 days, but the last barn find I have in the game has had its progress reset over and over, and after well over 3 months of playing the game, it has not progressed any further. Of course, I can pay to have the restoration completed for 45,000,000+ credits, but that is an unbelievable amount of in-game currency for something that I'm supposed to get for free. I was intending on trying to get 100% of the achievements in this game but because of this bug, I'll never be able to get the last barn find and get the achievement for completing all of them.- Speaking of achievements, there has been multiple times that i unlocked an achievement much before it was actually completed. as an example, i unlocked the achievement for driving all roads in the game when i still had about 10 more to complete.A lot of these issues are things that should've been noticed during original playtesting and never should've made it to the public. These are things I never once experienced in 4, and it really feels like this game could've used just another 6 months of polish before its release. Now if I wanted to be REALLY picky, here are some other issues I feel were overlooked that I've noticed in my playtime:- While you're in menus, you can't press up at the top of the menu to go to the very bottom, and vise versa. There are many, many instances in this game where you have to press down or up 20 times instead of pressing it once to end up on the opposite end of the menu (or you let go of your controller to use your mouse to click on something). This should never be a problem in any video game nowadays.- Every single leaderboard in the game is ENTIRELY FILLED with cheaters. The Forza devs will find time to fix and nerf legitimate methods people use for XP and credit farming, and will fix any fun glitches that people find, but they can't clear the leaderboards of people CHEATING and going 500,000 miles per hour. Also cheats that have existed since day 0 still work perfectly and it doesn't seem like anyone has ever been banned for cheating either. This makes where their priorities lie very transparent.- This one is very picky I will admit, but there's easily 100+ trees and objects I saw in-game that were floating off the ground. They use the same models copy and pasted throughout many parts of the map that don't work on the terrain that they're being placed on, so many times trees are just completely floating in the air, I've seen XP boards floating, I've seen plants and bushes floating, buildings, etc. I understand how crunched the devs probably were during the development of this game though so this is a very small thing but it really shows the lack of polish this game had before release.Even though I do have a lot of playtime in this game I don't believe it was worth the full $60 I paid for it- especially when it's on Xbox game pass and you can basically get all the enjoyment out of this game in a 1 month subscription (and get plenty of other games to enjoy once your interest in this game drops off like a cliff, as it did for me many months ago!)OVERALL: This game is a 3/10 when you're using your brain, a 6/10 if you have no brain inside your head and perform no critical thinking while you're playing it, and 9/10 when you're extremely drunk.

author: MrTenacious1906
review: Alright gotta say a few things first !!This to be honest the first of many like my first pre ordered game + this review is my first review in steam !!!Well this is the most gorgeous and a good looking game I have played in months !!There are tons of stuffs to keep you busy in this game !!!I would recommend as to all my dear friends to definitely get and play this game !!!

author: FIGHT MILKâ„¢
review: Update #3 (7/1/22): And then there was TAA, and all was right in the world. Well, almost. For my case, the game's foliage (you know, the stuff that fills 60-80% of your screen) now looks like it was meant to. To me, the game is no longer the eye sore it once was. TAA isn't perfect, but it fixes the most glaring issues and makes this game look amazing. I'll feel confident moving this to "recommended" once they fix the broken online experience as well as the broken weekly events. Update #2 (6/14/22): I can't believe this game is still in the state it's in. Regular crashes, buggy online code, almost non-existent AA, and foliage looks like it's rendered in 480p. What a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥-show.Update: A month in and I still say FH5 is a hard pass. Buggy and low-res textures are still commonplace on some screen ratios. The online experience is a tangled mess. Stutters, freezes, locks - it's all still there if not worse. Only thing keeping me in is to stay on top of the weekly rewards, but it's not easy. The left over code and assets from FH4 makes this feel like a bloated DLC, not a proper sequel. Development on this just feels lazy and more cracks are showing each day.The core game is fun (when it works), but I'd recommend holding off until they iron out the laundry list of bugs and broken graphics. No hyperbole: I've gone back to FH4 because it currently performs and looks significantly better than what's been launched with FH5.

author: pizza driver
review: Probably the best game I have ever played. (Premium Edition Customer)Starting from the breathtaking graphics - the game honestly looks super amazing! Especially with my RTX 3080 there is no other game that can even come close to this without mods.The performance is also really amazing, as always in Forza games. I have really good framerates playing on 1440p max. settings. And from what I've seen it is even possible to run this game on low end specs, just without the amazing graphics then of course!The next thing are the cars & their sounds - the models look better than ever, the details are just stunning! Also the amount of different cars is really awesome. There is a lot of variety especially as you can tune every car in many different ways! The sounds have been improved a LOT since Forza Horizon 4. Some cars are literally giving me an eargasm. Overall it feels very atmospheric, especially in the interiors aswell!The tuning - this has seen a not too crazy but yet still very good improvement from the last Horizon game. You can tune every car in multiple ways & really make it suit your personal driving style. Also visual tuning, with bodykits etc. aswell as the whole tuning menu have been revised and improved. The selection of rims is great, however many rims are not something I would ever put on a car myself. But there are enough for everybody to like. The fine tuning menu has stayed the same, you can put some time in there to really make your car feel better as always. It is great how it is!The map - oh the map! The size of it is just absolutely amazing! It really takes some time to go from one coast to the other. The variety with the map is purely awesome; you have a really big desert, a giant volcano, a huge jungle and a mysterious mountain area aswell as some fields. There are so many different vibes on this map that it takes ages to explore everything fully! There is a huge area of offroading space too! You can go whereever you feel like going. You want to be in a rainforest but are in the middle of a desert or on top of a gigantic volcano looking over the whole map and beyond? No problem! Just get on the long highway which is MUCH better and more fun than the last one and within a few kilometers you're in the middle of the jungle.The story, missions & exploration - is what is really fun about Forza. You can either just drive around and enjoy the vibe, or just do some PR stunts and try to beat your friends and make your way up the leaderboards. The whole progression system has been revised with category levels for street races etc. have been removed and you are collecting acolade points instead. You can fully decide what event you want to unlock next! There are multiple Horizon Events just like in Horizon 3 again which is great too! Also there are buyable player houses like introduced in Horizon 4 again. There is a lot to unlock and many story races aswell as Horizon Stories to complete. It's not too hard to 3 star them, but it also ain't the easiest thing to do. Overall you will have to take some time in order to complete every achievement etc.The ai has been improved a damn ton, as unbeatable ai really is unbeatable now. The highest I was able to beat so far is the 2nd highest one.Early connection issues and bugs - there are however a few issues and bugs with the game yet to be fixed. No game is perfect; especially not at release. We don't expect that and it is normal for issues to occure. At the early access release we had big connection issues, which were solved after around a day. Now with the release of the standard version they are back again. I expect them to be fully fixed again in 1-2 days tho. A few other bugs including abusing electric engines to gain massive amounts of hp & speeds can also be found.I don't think anybody read all of this but if you did, congratulations and now go and buy this game! There is a lot more to explore than I could fit into this review. Go & find out what it is!It's a great game, solo or with your friends! :)

author: Read_Only_
review: Game feels like a copy of FH4 with a different map, cars feel the same, customization is basicly the same, and now the DLC is the same. Buy the standard edition and mod if you want to have fun or drive with your friends but dont buy this thinking its a new game.

author: Sinon
review: Game is okay if you play below the top 3 skill levels. Past that, the CPU tends to cheat and give itself speed boosts past the fastest possible speed you can go and takes corners without breaking. I did a race and my time was top 500 at the time, and the CPU put a time that was 8 seconds faster than the #1 time. Not to mention the PVP is boring as all hell. People ram into rather than actually trying to race, even when it's a TEAM EVENT VS BOTS. At this point I'm using the game as a glorified drift sim

Very disappointing and the Dev's seem to ignore it :)..what come's around, goes around..  So here's my 2 cents and a thumbs down as long as it's not fixed.Edit: Thank you for the Fix! <3

author: The First Breed
review: Cant recommend this game for a few reasons. Maybe it is better on console?The same button for setting a group waypoint also sends you to a store page to buy a treasure map for $3.The game has texture and shader issues where grass and trees turn into rainbow squares for 30series gpus. The only fix is to roll back drivers.Racing against people is fine, but the ai racers are on rails. On higher tier cars they make turns and movements that are impossible.

author: Metsakurat
review: Sorry, I had a need for Speedy Gonzales, if you get my drift.Enough with the jokes though. Let's talk Horizon 5.First things first, if you enjoyed Forza Horizon 4 you will enjoy this title as well.Horizon 5 is easily the best racing game available on PC at the moment but it has its issues and it has a lot of them. Some are minor and some are pretty huge.I had my review ready when the game was released. I hold off posting this review because I wanted to give developers some time to fix some of the stuff. Nothing has been done so far. In fact, the number of issues has grown. It's absurd.  A full list of cross-platform and PC-only issues is at the end of the review. The list is HUGE. EDIT: The list is so big Steam says my review is 13, 264 characters too long so I will post a list of Steam related issues only.I got in four days early and put around 40+ hours into the game in four days. Now, a week later, I have only 67 hours of playtime. Why?Connectivity issues. I had this in my "early access" period as well but it wasn't as bad and I thought it would be addressed and fixed by the time the game was released. I was wrong. It has gotten so bad I have not been able to play online AT ALL. As soon as I start up the game I get disconnected. I might be able to stay connected for five seconds maximum and it has been like that for the past 7 days at least. It has been frustrating.EDIT: It has now been 17 days since I was able to connect to ForzaLife (online). I've tried around 10 different fixes, the game has patched itself 2-3 times and each time they have claimed to fix the connectivity issue but it's all just lies. Nothing works. Beware!Why am I giving this game a positive review? Because it's still fun to play solo and it has hundreds of hours of singleplayer content in it. Just be warned: As of now singleplayer might be the only thing you are able to do and that includes not being able to do seasonal objectives and unlocking cars in those seasons.Alright. That's out of the way so let's get to what I originally wrote about Forza Horizon 5:If you're new to the Forza franchise then Horizon is the more arcade-y spin-off of Forza Motorsport. Motorsport is a proper sim-cade/sim racer depending on how you want to play it.Horizon is an open-world arcade racer where you can do whatever you want and progress however you want. Now when I say it's an arcade racer, it is, but it's also important to knowthat you can turn off all the assists, turn on realistic damage, set the AI to the impossible difficulty, and enjoy a more sim-like experience.The Horizon series offers you everything you would want in a racing game: Car tuning, upgrading, and customization, a huge open-world map with different areas to free roam in, all kinds of different race types from drag and street racing to off-road dirt racing and user-made custom tracks. Oh, I should also mention there are quite a few different radio stations available to almost every kind of taste... Almost. The rock radio station is a bit lacking and plays more pop/pop-rock songs than actual rock tracks but it's still pretty decent.Car selection is bigger than ever as well. Forza Horizon 5 launched with 534 different cars with many more on the way. Yes, it's true Horizon 4 had over 700 cars in the end but that's with all the expansions and updates. Let me remind you that Forza Horizon 4 launched with just over 400-450 cars so give Horizon 5 a little bit more time and we will eventually have even more vehicles available than in the predecessor.Now let's talk about the online portion of the game a little bit.Forza Horizon 5 is a great singleplayer game with tons of content but there is also a huge load of co-op and multiplayer content on offer.Every race you see on your world map can be played in an online co-op with your friends but you can simply queue for player vs AI co-op races as well.On the competitive side we have the "Eliminator" which is a battle royale with cars, your usual casual and ranked street, dirt, and other races, and a playground in which two teams of players compete against each other in zombie modes, capture the flag and a few other modes.The open-world map also has "arcade" events in which players either have to drift or do other kinds of stunts to rack up scores together and earn Forzathon Points. Forzathon Points  can be spent on cars in an online Forzathon Shop. The shop is currently unavaible.Now talking of online, I actually have a couple of issues with it. Actually, one issue to be perfectly honest. You can choose to roam your map in solo mode or online mode, in which you see other players drive around and join the open-world arcade events that appear on the map from time to time. Now the issue with this is that I've had quite a lot of problems.The first 5 hours were hell for me. I got disconnected several times in a minute. In ONE MINUTE! The issue is not on my side. My internet connection is solid. It has gotten better but I'm still experiencing connectivity issues so beware of that.That's my only issue so far. Other than that the game is great. The performance? Absolutely brilliant? The game runs at a solid 100 frames per second with every setting maxed out and at 1440p. RTX 2080 super, i9-10900K, 32GB RAM, and with this hardware getting 100 fps at 1440p with every setting on extreme/ultra I can't complain. Runs better than I expected and the game is a real eye candy.I have experienced some graphical glitches here and there but nothing serious so they have not bothered me at all.Definitely worth the full price! Next season will have the DeLorean as one of the seasonal awards so hop on board, get driving, and enjoy the festival with crazy cars, crazier people, and even crazier stunts!STEAM Related Issues     Players may be experiencing performance degradation after extended time playing due to memory issues    There are flickering water reflections on low spec PC with AMD graphics card    Car dials have a "white-ish" texture and are blurred when car is moving on AMD card with integrated Radeon graphics    PC - While using 'Alt+Enter' combination the Title still reads 'Enter' button as an input    Upon changing hardware the game doesn't ask you if you want to re-run the graphics setup.    Clicking buttons with the mouse can trigger the wrong action    Capturing the video using Xbox Game Bar with Scaled display in Windows result in partially black recording    PC - UMA video memory is not supported    At first launch in game resolution does not match the Windows resolution    Game window is partially obscured when launching in full screen mode    Turning off screen effects in the menu does not turn off chromatic aberration    PC - Chromatic aberration get very extreme with ultra wide resolutions    PC - User is not messaged to download media pack on Windows N version (windows 10 and 11)    Tabbing out during launch will cause window to open cut off in bottom right of screen    Steam - Mouse Cursor is stuck on screen at all times    Some car elements have missing transparency on PC with AMD GPU    DRS on PC can cause GTAO depth issues at high resolution    Texture rendering issues on PC for terrain and vegetation when using Resolution Scaling On    Players my get an e:1047-0 Invalid Save error message    Players my get an e:1045-0 Invalid Save error message    Horizontal stripes on road when SSAO is enabled    Graphics artifacts on screen edge at 3440x1440 resolution (Ultrawide)

author: crazz
review: recycled game made for kids, not people who like cars.each update makes the game worse, be it more bugs, or dumb policy enforcement.for me, its feels like a majority of the content they are adding is just rehashed content from previous games.I'm still encountering bugs and performance issues that the game launched with. I regret paying 100 dollars for this, when I should've got in on gamepass or waited for a sale.

author: poomchud
review: I have mixed feelings about this game. First of all sometimes this game will crash randomly for no reason, my friends game crashed because he plugged in a steering wheel? Secondly the online aspect of this game is currently in a horrible state as it barley even works.  I can connect to my friends but not see each other. But the good things about this game are that it is stunningly beautiful and (when you do get online to work) it can be fun with you're friends . PLZ FIX ONLINE.

author: Angello Ortega
review: This is a great follow-up to Forza Horizon 4, Mexico is a big map, with a lot of sidetracks to discover, mountains to climb and weather conditions to test your driving skills in. A lot of the same cars make a come-back from FH4, but that doesn't make it repetitive. For sure, more (new) cars are needed, but overall with stunning visuals (if you can activate Ray-tracing) an excellent soundtrack, and the same good-old gameplay that made FH4 so adictive, Forza Horizon 5 is an easy recommendation for any casual arcade drivers, or anyone that want a close to life driving experience.

author: railD
review: I've given up on Forza Horizon 5. I'm completely burnt out and just bored with the game. It stopped being fun a while ago, but I continued to push on hoping for something that'll keep me going.Haven't touched the game in nearly a month, and I intend to keep it that way. I've put just a little over 200 hours into the game, and that's probably enough for me. I've already beat the four or five Horizon tours and some of the Horizon Stories but there's just no real drive to keep playing.And I'm not the only one- When it launched on Steam over 80,000 people played it. Now it averages about ~6,500 players not even 7 months later. Not to mention the litany of glitches and bugs that plagued the game at the beginning that scared off potentially new players.Honestly, the only thing this game makes me want to do is play older Forza titles. Because this just doesn't work for me anymore. Unless they manage to pull off something major that'll suck me back in, this'll remain uninstalled on my PC.

author: Aleph
review: I will reluctantly recommend this game, even though I dislike Turn 10 and Microsoft for the whole "liveries can get you banned" fiasco. Shame on them for that one and shame on me for still financially supporting them.Now that being said, Forza is still by far the best non-sim racing game and it's not close. The driving and physics in FH5 are great, the car selection is solid (although there's some MAJOR omissions from FH4, including the entirety of Lancia and Alfa Romeo and many Lotuses which was extremely disappointing). The map has good driving roads though I do not find it anywhere near as aesthetically pleasing as 2's or even 3's. What's absolutely dreadful about this game is the supporting cast/NPCs. They have the worst dialogue, maybe in all of gaming history. It's torture to listen to them.Overall if you like racing games you will like FH5. However I wouldn't recommend it over its predecessor since it doesn't change enough things and it has an inferior car list overall - or so I'd say but FH5 finally added the greatest car, the XJR-15...

author: DirtyEagle56
review: Definitely not what I would want from a racing game. You receive tons of cars for free including the best car within the first couple of hours of game play, you receive tons of free currency for again doing almost nothing. My ideal game model would be to earn everything you receive i. e. save up for a favorite car from grinding and winning tough races. Instead the races are very easy to win, the ai seem to be easy to beat and won't try hard to pass you up if you make a mistake. Overall there are some things I like (the open world, customization, amount of cars to buy) but those things are ruined by the structure of the game and how you are rewarded (from lottery wheel spins for existing).

review: I love this game. best racing game ever

author: lazerxxx
review: I was really hoping to be able to fix this game as I have been wanting it for a while now. It would not get past the splashscreen with the tachometer. I tried everything, verified file integrity 5 times, changed install directory....everything and no joy. Un-installed and getting refund.

author: Volatar
review: I have been in a racing mood lately. I fired up The Crew 1 first to continue that one's story. I played several missions and then hit one that was stupidly hard. I couldn't manage it after 10 attempts. I then decided to hit the open world and get a shiny new car. But then I looked, and saw how much pure grinding it would take to get the car I wanted, and uninstalled the game.So next I fired up Burnout Paradise. I had a blast in it's very arcadey world, smashing stuff, but eventually the lack of variety burned me out.But I was still in a racing mood, and saw a youtube video for this game. I bought it right away.Forza Horizon 5 is a blast. It has a great variety of activities to do. It has an awesome number of options for driving that let you play a very arcadey game or a very simulationist one. And the cars. Oh my goodness. There are so many cars in the game. 535 apparently. The game hands you cars left and right. And I love putting anime skins on them and rolling around honking at other players with a musical horn. And I can race with my buddies! I suck, but it's fun anyways.I am very happy with FH5 and recommend it to anyone in a racing mood.

author: â™¥ â™¥ â™¥ â™¥
review: I love this game. I spent 63 hours of my life playing this game.This is what forza support says verbatim on their support page:If you have lost your saved data, please fill out the Lost Saved Data Ticket, and one of our Support Agents will investigate the issue.Commonly reported issues:    My game started from scratch.    I picked the wrong saved game.    My cat sat on my controller and canceled my sync.***Unfortunately, we will NOT be able to return any Forzathon Points, Skill Points, Level, Experience, Tokens, or Progress.***Thank you forza, for being of no help to me, and for wasting 63 hours of my life. And no, their "support agents" were of zero help. and couldnt even get me my cars back.I was level 190 something.I hate this game, im going to play gran turismo.â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ you forza.

author: lucaro
review: dont get fooled by the playtime, at least half of these hours were spent using autodrive to grind wheelspins to get "hard-to-find" cars, and at least 10 hours were spent troubleshooting the games servers, graphics or general crashingunpolished game, another entry in the series that completely disregards everything that makes a racing game enjoyable- the class system is increadibly broken, you can have a car with a pi score of 700 thats somehow faster than a car with a score of 800, which completely ruins online racing- terrible car models that date back to the original forza motorsport game, terribly deformed cars which dont even remotely look like they should, have misplaced wheels, badly modelled custom parts that dont match up with the sides etc- insufferable voice acting with characters that treat you like youre a 5 year old- blatantly cheating AI- handling is a lot worse than horizon 2 and horizon 3, every car feels understeery and out of control- the tuning system is broken, brake bias is inverted, raising your car makes it handle better, locking your front diff makes your car handle better, nothing makes any sense- the worst loading times in any game i have ever played- graphics are broken months after release, first person view is increadibly bright, lines on the road etc- low streaming bandwith causing the entire world to dissapear, even on a top of the line pc (i7 11k, rtx 3080, 32 gb ram)- game will refuse to start if you use nvidia overlay, will crash if you try to stream it using discord, but mod menus and various hack tools work perfectly fine???and by far the worst of allthe game relies on having these stupid weekly playlists, giving you events with really stupid limitations to unlock barely interesting cars which are just reused from previous games in the series, there is almost never a new car, most of them use forza 1 - 4 models which look terrible, unlocking these cars also REQUIRES you to play public online lobbies, which never ends well considering how unbalanced this game is, and how bad the handling feelsi could go on and on about this games issues, i didnt even mention how broken things like the event creator is, or how horrible the vinyl editor is (which doesnt even mirror your vinyls properly), go ahead and look into this stuff yourself, its not hard to findthis isnt a good arcade racing game, neither is it a good simulation gameif you want a good simulation game opt for something like gran turismo, forzas physics just dont make any senseif you want a good forza game play horizon 2 or 3, those are the only ones i found enjoyablethe developers dont care about gameplay or cars, even the previews of this game focused more on the scenery and rocks rather than the outdated forza 1 cars or any sort of gameplay

author: Vitokonuk
review: Engine vroom vroomTurbo stutututuWheel vzzzzvzzzz

author: FIIZEEX
review: One word:Masterpiece â¤â¤Update:Even after 1 year the game still gets so many updates thanks to the devs. â¤

author: BittenEite
review: Finally a map with Long live  Mexico!

author: kdudcringe
review: Seems like a really fun game, however I have crashed 5 times in a row on the exact same point at the end of the initial introduction. Just wasted an hour trying to find a fix, but each time I get to the end of the intro, it crashes and I am stuck playing the intro over and over.It seems to be a good game as the game is fun during the intro, but I wouldn't recommend to buy yet, maybe once they fix issues that shouldn't have been in at launch, then it might be worth buying if you like arcade racers.

author: *salty german noises*
review: Its like playing an Alpha.1. Technical issues:When it came put, I had severe technical issues. Now it is playable.2. CoopThe coop isn't enjoyable. At all. Sometimes we need one whole hour until we can play the first race. One of us get's kicked out or we can't even start a race. The koop mechanic isn't balanced, doesn't make any sense and fun get's constantly ruined, because one driving error (or a NPC rams you off the street) results in driving way behind with no chance of making places again. Not to mention minor issues...3. WorldThe world ist extremely beautiful, even with low settings. And its gigantic and really divers. 4. InnovationsThe game adds some great features like drifting tires and transmissions, but its mostly the old game in a new world. Again there are a lot of cars to collect.5. Driving experienceThe cars feel good on every terrain. The difficulty on asphalt got a bit more difficult. The races are nice, the really long ones like the Goliath and Colossus are extremely fun and way better than in the old game.The tuning and customization are like in the old game.6. Racing experienceAfter you've seen everything, it becomes boring. The AI always acts the same. Either you carve through them at the beginning or they hold their lead no matter how good you drive or how you spec your car. Once you are in the lead, they fall back and they drive in one collumn behind you. They won't come back and won't fight with you. They don't seem to have any advantages or disadvantages. So if you spec your car for one specific perk, they will always match you in that regard and be better than you in the area, you have a drawback. So after the start you have to hurry and then you either loose after a boring race or you win after a boring race.7. FazitThe game would be really good, if it wouldn't have so many problems and become so boring.In singleplayer with a high end pc its great, with an a few years older PC its most of the time okay.In Coop it's not enjoyable.

author: JDumbz
review: Forza Horizon is back and now in Mexico!For quite some time I have been itching for a new racing game to get into. Fortunately, Forza is back for some time. I will say straight to the point if you like Forza Horizon 4, you will certainly enjoy 5. During my almost ten hours on early access, the game was engaging, more than most racing games that were released in the past few years. - As always, Forza has a neat selection of cars to pick from. At launch, we have the choice to pick over 500 Cars!- Bigger map, bigger exploration! I always admire Mexico, the culture, the atmosphere, I'm biased to say this is my favorite location in the Forza Series aside from Australia.- New Sounds, handling improvements, the handling model too feels different but in a good way.- Graphical Improvements, weather effects, smoke effects.- A new fair addition to customizations, however, still not meeting NFS quality. - Connection Issues. Understanding the game is just released with a day zero patch, this will be addressed soon.- Lack of story (as expected) but brace for the cringe dialogue.- Lack of progression. I do like rewarding progression more, so everything is handed to you like previous titles.- Texture issues, map disappearing. However, this has been noticed and will be addressed.- Crashes, mostly GPU issue overheating. If you have a RX 5700XT I do have a workaround that may be a ((fix)). Please read below:Playground games cause a lot of stress for this card, for the people who have Black screens or Shutdowns in minutes of playing. I encourage you to look for Fan Curve Speeds and change it to 50% before playing the game. I went from 87C+ down to 73C and was able to play for hours straight with no problem. In my theory, the card does not cool down fast enough with factory settings as the game puts your card on 100% load instantly. If this does work for you, let me know, please. I mentioned this to a few people to try and has fixed their problems. these are the settings I tried and have fixed my Shutdown problems while playing a few minutes.Overall if you're looking for a decent Arcade-Sim, Forza Horizon is a nice pick. Though, I would also encourage you to try the game out on Gamepass if you're unsure as a demo. You do get a discount too as well for buying premium with it.

author: Xavr0k
review: This is a buggy mess of a game. Plenty of accolades and daily challenges are broken and refuse to unlock. Leaderboards are filled with cheaters. Plenty of exploits to unlock all the cars and get stupid amounts of money. Frequent disconnects. Streets are empty and if you do occasionally find a car there is a good chance it will just fade out of existence right in front of you. AI blatantly cheats.If they had bothered to finish making the game before releasing it then it would have been a good game. Hopefully in a few months they'll have fixed the bugs. Until then the developers don't deserve your money.

The fast travel is literally the worst fast travel I have ever seen in over 20 years of playing video games. The menu's are HORRIBLE! The car selection is missing many cool cars they people would actually want to use. Every single car feels like its on ice unless you break so softly the brakes dont actually slow you down so you just go off the road, not due to bad driving but you tires are literally made of ice. Ive tuned cars to have some of the best grip you can possible have and at 30 mph you while slide 8 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ million feet into a house or a guardrail or a tree. AND TREES. Why are there so many trees put just next to the road so you tires made of ice can throw you into them. I understand that this is more of an arcade style car game, but â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. My cat can coe better physics then this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. I played more then 2 hours so I cant get a refund. DO NOT BUY THIS â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ GAME. I â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ HATE THIS GAME

author: RZ
review: I'll start this review by saying that I am a car enthusiast who spent a fair amount of time grinding ranked racing in FH4 with a group of friends. Most of my time in FH5 is spent racing online or grinding rivals.Pros: handling model is great, graphics are stunning, and the map design is generally pretty good. Also Hot Wheels is pretty fun.But besides the pros listed above, this is yet another soulless cookie-cutter open-world racer. The map looks great yet feels empty and lifeless. The 'missions' are purely a waste of time. Characters are forgettable if not annoying at times. The car list is largely unchanged from previous Forza titles; the cars themselves lack detailed modeling and animating, and blatant errors somehow make their way past QA, such as mirrored textures or leftover placeholder textures. Online racing is lackluster and the ranked mode from FH4 has been removed for no reason.Overall, this may be a fine racing game for someone who doesn't particularly care about cars or the genre. However, it is a disappointing one for car enthusiasts and long-time Forza players with many core issues that are hard to address with their monthly updates.

author: dismay
review: The performance is trash. There is a known memory leak on the PC version and the devs have been very hush about it. I have tried many fixes but even on window mode at lowest resolution and lowest graphic settings, with all the Reddit user "hotfixes" like allowing more virtual memory and disabling steam overlay, disable Nvidia and Xbox Game Bar. And yet, an I7 9700k, 32GB RAM and a 3080 series card gradually drops to 20fps with 2 second freezes. Horizon 4 had many issues as well so my spidey senses are telling me the issues will never be fixed. I hope that I'm wrong but the past speak louder than words.

author: ó ³â§â§ ó ³
review: First of all, Forza Horizon 5 is a MUST-BUY-GAME for Racing Fans and casual Gamers alike.I donâ€™t know how, but Playground Games has made gains over Horizon 4, that I really didnâ€™t think would be easily possible. The Visuals are really stunning, the sound is amazing, the Number of things to do is almost overwhelming and the gameplay feels refined, making it an amazing Open World Racing Game Experience. The freedom to go pretty much anywhere in the Mexican Landscape will eat up a lot of your Time. Sure, there have been some Network or GPU Issues (RTX3080 and RTX3080ti like mine), but these seem to be nearly disappearing, allowing for an almost flawless Experience. author: Starz
review: Currently FH5 is garbage, a joke towards the community behind it.Like a certain genre of racing? Be it street racing or anything else, have fun requeuing for 30 minutes because you can't filter in races you want to participate in. Let alone decide in which class you want to race.Custom races also have issues, like endurance races with friends? well tough luck, the game will disconnect you and your friends before the race event starts.They removed 2 out of 5 races for Online,leaving you with 3 misserable races to do per session. including the longest races they have.And forget about picking a car or tune for each race, you'll be forced to use the same car for all 3 (used to be 5) races.The last one I can understand somewhat understand but at this point.And even on a SSD you'll experience more loading times for a race than you'll be racing..Balance/Meta? 'you can put a car in almost any race!' yes, true but forget that you'll have a chance if you don't use certain cars or with certain tunes..And of course, at least half the playerbase must be mentally challenged in mutliple ways.Drive clean, leave them an entire road of space and they still will ram you out of checkpoints or rear-end you, smahing you into walls with a lovely slow-punishment on top of it.I'd almost call it the BF2042 of racing, an utter joke.

author: Tourist
review: Fun game, even if you don't really know about the cars, you can still enjoy the game. However there are like 1500+ different cars and for each car you can tune the cars according to your specifications which is great for car enthusiasts. But if you don't really know which tuning does what, you can use others tunings on your own car which is great. It's a great open-world racing game where you don't even need to just do races, you can do side challenges or just drive. Graphics are very good. However there is a memory leak issue where after about 1 hour, you start losing some fps, get some stuttering but after a restarting the game it all goes away. Besides this, haven't really encountered any bugs. It's story is kinda weak but its gameplay, graphics and easy-to-learn hard-to-master aspects are really good.Even if you're not a car enthusiast(which I am), you can still enjoy this game thoroughly.

author: Pseudo
review: A car collecting game masquerading as a racing game. Lots of cars to collect. Lots of things to unlock and races to do. After a certain point I just felt bored by it. Bored by the all or nothing race results where I take last place with no chance of competing or I easily leave my competitors in the dust based on which car I bring to the race, bored of the characters in the game constantly gushing about how cool I am, bored of collecting cars faster than I can actually try them out and get a feel for them. At first I thought it was excessive in a good way, but over time you just become numb to the game because it's more than I can care about. In the original Gran Turismo, I would begin the game by buying the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ car I could, upgrading it until it was competitive, and letting it carry me as far as it could take me. I got excited about and invested in my â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ starter car. Forza Horizon 5 is giving you a free car every couple races, some with EPIC or LEGENDARY rarity, and as a result I just become excited about and invested in none of them. And with the way the races are, that's all that could get me through the game.

author: Spitfire
review: BadOnline with friends is only possible once in a blue moon when all the planets and stars align, and staying together by the end of the race is a roll of the dice on its own. The freezing in place glitch still constantly happens, glad I got to spend 100 bucks to experience that for a whole week before everyone else. (The game fully launched and by the time of writing this, they still have yet to fix it). If they finally decide to patch that issue out and you are worrying about missing out on the experience of being stopped in the middle of what you are doing, don't fret, they made sure to program in long-winded exposition about how beautiful Mexico is. That's great, how about you shut up for 5 minutes and let me check it out instead of making sit through a minute of talking and music while staring at the Horizon Adventure after every other event.Half of my playtime so far is just sitting there and waiting to actually get to play the game, while I'm being told how fun it will be to play the game, loading to play the game, and then being frozen in place or crashing while trying to play the game. Maybe valve should implement a feature in the store for developers where they aren't allowed to release any sorts of patches or anything for the first few months, so these dipsh!t game companies have to take the time and actually try to make the game WORK before accepting money from everybody for something that is virtually unplayable. If it doesn't â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ work, don't sell it until it does.

author: King_of_Chaos
review: Recent Hot Wheels Update has completely broken the game for a large amount of users on PC. Extremely low FPS, low GPU utilization, constant frame drops and stuttering. Running an 5900X + RX6800, 32 Gigs DDR4 3600 ram, all drivers up to date on top of a fresh installation. Game is allowed through firewall, etc. This game has had massive issues on PC since the start. For a while there, I was able to enjoy it, but in its current state, this game is unacceptable from such a major publisher. It's fantastic when it works, but just be wary of your own personal hardware and see how it runs for you. I assume I'm having issues simply because I decided to build an AMD PC this time around, rather than going Intel/Nvidia. Either way, I don't think I'll be buying any more Forza games for PC following the awful issues this one is plagued with. I should also mention that they still haven't fixed the constant disconnecting issues. It's nearly impossible to play with friends, which is the most fun part of Forza. You can't even run up and down the highway with the same players in a straight line without disconnecting. Between the constant performance issues and server issues, I can't recommend this game to anyone on PC. Sorry guys. This one is a swing and a miss. It's clear that it was meant for consoles and that PC was an after-thought.

author: Wreckken

author: -XeVoN-
review: The best racing open world game ever made. Yeah it's similar to Forza Horizon 4 but it's not the same. The map it's huge and wonderful, 5 Horizon festival sites, over 500 cars and new songs. In over 40 hours in only 3 days I can say that the game is great and yes it has some bugs and glitches just like Forza Horizon 4 has(at least the Steam version).It has some disappointing features like the rendering stuff where everything I see on my screen which is far away instead of being rendered wonderfully, it looks garbage. Nothing even close to I dunno... Let's say Red Dead Redemption 2.Also the AI is way more difficult on higher difficulties than they were in Forza Horizon 4.On some high difficulties they use some "upgraded cars" which you can't even upgrade to those stats, for example the Ford Focus RS,I was only able to upgrade it up to S2950 and the AI had one at X999. The accolade feature is very similar to the progressing system we had in Forza Horizon 4 Lego DLC. It's not that much of a grind for 'em luckily tho. The PC port its good, not great but over time they will patch the game.For those wondering I used an RX 5700XT, a Ryzen 7 3700X 4.40GHz, 16GB DDR4 3000MHz RAM memory and I played in 1080P with MSAA off and beside that everything Maxed out. I also had the game installed on a HDD.I had in some points over  cities close to 60 and above, on the highway and other roads in the middle of nowhere 80fps and above. I didn't encountered any errors like game crashes or freezes but I did get a message saying that my 16GB RAM and 8GB of VRAM memory isn't enough. But that's all. And with that I said everything I can about the game and before I forget :Welcome to Mexico!

author: GHOSTanbul
review: Actually there is not much to say about Forza Horizon. Hands down it is the best arcade racing  game present. Playground Games did not risk to spoil the formula which brought success and cash to them in previous titles and without any serious rivals forcing them towards greater innovation they only added some new features to it . But this does not stop giving gamers the itch to play "one more race" in each playthrough.Here in FH5 you will be in Mexico which has a bigger and more colorful map with stunning vistas compared to FH4's "a bit too sterile" Britain . It is so huge and and there are overwhelming things to do, so many that the finish line of one race is likely quite close to the starting gate of another.  The map is positively littered with icons  -more than any Assassin's Creed game:)-  so filter will be your friend. -But still I can't help myself thinking Japan would be a better choice instead:)- Overall compared to FH4 the game looks better, sounds better. Apart from seasons now there are day/night changes, weather activites like sandstorms/tropical rain. You will not get bored easily since there will always be a lot of things to accomplish and game will steadily reward you for that forever.Keep in mind that this is an arcade racing game, it does not require a steep learning curve how to drive. If you want to exprerience a more serious racing sim you may go for Assetto Corsa or Project Cars instead. Yet still with lots of cars to unlock, nice setting and custimization options, fun activities and endless action FH5 is an open world racing dream for every player.Whether you are a racing fan or not you will like this game.Enjoy your ride..

author: baddog993
review: This game is Fun. I have yet to run into one bug. Big Edit: single player is still fine. Multiplayer is a mess right now. Connection issue that can only be fixed by entering the horizon festival garage and exiting again. Then it will connect. The latest patch seems to have removed the Ai on the open world map. Getting a multiplayer match started took me and my friend around 2 minutes to get one match going. Where before it took maybe 30 seconds to get one going. Ugh.  The graphics look great. My system is an  i5 6400 with 16 gigs of ram and a Nvidia GT 1650 not exactly a powerhouse system and I am getting 60fps at 1080P. I have even seen it run on a graphics card as low as the GT 1030 via youtube that is a very low powered graphics card. Amazing. I am using a controller. The sounds are awesome and Mexico looks great. The solo races I did were all fun. I am sure they are some issues but I have yet to encounter a single one since playing. Its smooth like butter. I have had no crashes the game starts and plays amazing. I have nothing but praise for the game.

author: FueltheScar
review: I love FH4. Poured hundreds of hours into that game. Tuning, Racing, Drifting, Off-roading. I'd come on and complete every weekly competition to get the cars. It was amazing. This feels like a complete reversal of what FH4 was and still is. It honestly feels like a complete downgrade except newer cars, better sounds and graphics. That is where the only positives for this game are.To start off with, you are physically forced to do off-road and cross country races to progress. You can't just ignore them if you don't like them, you have to do it. Another thing, when you complete the acolade stage, you are forced to pick an acolade and goto where that is (a showcase race or new event area).Back in FH4, I honestly didn't mind the off-road and cross country races. They are not my favourite what so ever, but I did have fun with them when I did them. Not this game, what so ever. The tracks are complete ass, sharp corners then immediate jumps. Jumps that are so large, no matter what you do, your car bogs down however the AI is just fine. And to top it off with these races, the AI are absolutely insane with them. They can race around cross country races as if they are an F1 car on a race track! They don't worry about grip, traction, balance NOTHING; all while you are wrestling with your car to get around the corners and not go off the course. You do all this effort just for the AI to slam their break, turn in and pass you as if you are standing still. This isn't to do with difficulty, I play the entire game on expert/pro, yet when it comes to cross-country (due to the race being apart of the forzathon playlists to get a new car), the difficulty is Highly Skilled (around 1-2 difficulty notches down) and it feels like I am playing unbeatable drivatars (the top difficulty level). I have had to retry, rewind and redo each race numerous times. It just completely sucks the fun out of it.I mention all of this to not even cross onto the fact that this was all to unlock a 911 GT3RS, A FACTORY MADE TRACK RACING CAR. Why the hell should you do cross-country races for a car that is purely for track use! It' s completely irrelevant. All this does is force me to play races that I don't like and have tried my hardest to avoid just so I can unlock a car that is better for the races I DO LIKE.That was just the actual races and physics! I haven't even gone on about the numerous bugs, irritations and down-right rage-quitting issues!I will keep this one short as it is already long as it is.First: the on-screen narrator. No matter what I do, within Windows, within the game, the onscreen narrator will always start speaking whats on screen for the entire menu until you get into the game. There is no way to stop this, believe me, I have tried. It makes me immediately want to shut down the game, because the voice and the fact that it won't shut up is highly aggravating.Next: Force feedback on the wheel. It is a luck of the draw whether it decides to work or not. You can boot up the game, load in and wait all that time just to realise you can' t feel what the car is doing because the FFB doesn't exist (bearing in mind without it, the car feels like a weightless feather on ice). All of this leads to you restarting the game, multiple times, until it finally starts to work again. And as soon as you tab-out, there is a high likely-hood that the FFB will stop working again.After that: The constant resetting of my wheel setup. I don't have a clutch pedal, but I like using the clutch so I can drift. So to do so, I bind it to one of the buttons on my wheel, meaning I have to use a custom wheel profile. This is completely okay, I did that in FH4 and it was never an issue. The issue is that FH5 resets it back to default, every. damn. time. Every time I open the game, I have to go back into settings and set the mapping to Customer Wheel Controller #1. Finally: Something that is still not fixed, however not too bad, the fact that there are still graphical issues within the game. That being the glitching road textures. You could just be driving normally and then all of a sudden you pass through a stretch of road that is filled with rainbow colours. Not the car, not the grass, just the road. You could reboot the game, go back to the exact road and it will be gone. This isn't an issue with my graphics card or installation as i have checked both of these, however it is still jarring and does break any immersion or enjoyment.This is all just to say that with the numerous amount of bugs, I spend most of my time restarting, rebooting and remapping FH5 so that I can play it. This just leads to me not actually wanting to play the game anymore. It is the reason I have not played it as much as I have wanted to do. The hassle and faff just outweighs the fun that could be had.

author: BraunauBanani
review: I have almost 1000 hours in Forza Horizon 4. Half of it with controller and the other with a G29 Sim Racing Wheel. So obviously I love that game. But after that much time you need a different experience and that is where Forza Horizon 5 falls short. Because Forza Horizon 5 IS Forza Horizon 4. Itâ€™s the same game. Im playing the same game again. The differences are like a FIFA game. Now for a Forza Horizon that doesnâ€™t have to be necessarily a bad thing. Forza Horizon 4 was after all an almost 10/10 game. The only things that it had to improve was its sense of speed, proper spots for dirt rally on the map a GOOD CITY maybe some better mountains for more offroad fun, Hill and Downhill races. It also had a lot off small things like the shifting stile being a difficulty setting (very annoying with a wheel) and its rater suboptimal class system. But Forza 5 changes none of that.Actual significant changes Pros:Better sense of speed thangs to ssdMore realistic car feel (better weight feel)Better Force Feedback (Sim Wheels)Much better car soundsCons:Terrible and uncreative map when compared to Forza 4No seriously it ruins the gameA lot less cars than Forza 4 (for now at least)More bugs than cyberpunk (mostly coop related)Conclusion: When you play with a controller just play Forza Horizon 4. The Force Feedback doesnâ€™t affect you and the weight feel doesnâ€™t do all that much. The map is worth it. When you play with a wheel and you canâ€™t get enough off Forza or never played 4 before than the Force Feedback might be worth it or you just play assetto corsa.

author: cow
review: Just get gamepass and play it there. You can play a $60 game for $1. For an actual review, Forza Horizon 5, once again, breaks it's own barriers. With an gigantic map that is full of twisting biomes and roads, it encapsulates a great and mesmerizing atmosphere of Mexico. Coming from past Forza games, the latest entry to the Horizon series is the best that Playground Games has churned out. The monumental changes to the lighting and particle effects are wonderful, the increased graphical fidelity and saturation of the world is great, and the new changes to how vehicles both handle and respond to the environment are perfect. The only "but" I would say is that, as of both pre-launch and after, the game has issues with crashing randomly when in a menu or trying to interact with the UI. I've also gotten into issues where I would get stuck into an endless online match search where I wouldn't be able to interact with the menu, but as far as I know, that issue has been resolved. These are minor in comparison to the solid and polished recipe for the king of arcade open world driving games.9/10

author: Stavinsky
review: I bought the game last year in November, and got through the whole story and unlocked almost all cars that were accessible by January 2022. The pro :- Nice visuals- Enjoyable driving experience when alone on the roads- Love the designing tool (compared to The crew 2)- Love to be able to fine tune my car to my preference.The Cons- Grindy as hell- Nerf after nerf of the various ways to earn money- Some of the challenges are painfull, especially when having to compete against cheating AI.All in all, when played with friends (and the game keep in sync) it's nice and fun. Enough that I got 300 hours sunk into the game. So why the thumbs down ? Here is why :I did a 6 months break from the game, and decided I just wanted to take one of my car for a spin 2 days ago.I had the game using 100GB on my hard drive for the last 6 months, got the updates and all. But when I started it, reached the login to my Microsoft Xbox account, and then started the game, I got the nasty surprise to be presented with the Driver creation option and not being sent in my previous game.So here I am, 300 hours down the drain and having lost every singles of my achievements.After a bit of searching, I found out it's a common issue both on PC and console. A lot of players get corrupted save or error codes. In my situation I got nothing of such, no warning, no error code, just a complete reset of the user data save file.Now, after contacting the support I have to replay the Tutorial and reach the point that let a player go online. The very part I hate in every game who Gate the access to your friends through "Tutorials" and other mandatory things before you can join your friends online and can enjoy playing with them.Hate to have to do it a first time, or every single time a game decide you lost your datas (GTA 5, Dying Light, Forza Horizon 4 and 5). So, having lost everything, and not even sure I can get the rewards for the various Skins I made for a lot of car and shared online, I can't in good faith put anything else than a thumb down.

author: Bilbo Swagg3nz
review: Not worth 50-60$, just get it on game pass for 1$ a month. You can continuously get game pass for 1$ a month if you cancel your subscription before renewing it.If you and your friends can all get forza for 1$ on game pass, it's a really fun game to play with them. I find it most fun to do private races with either slow, or moderately fast cars. I've personally found most S1+ class cars are too quick to even keep on the road, unless you like braking more than accelerating. I've found super slow cars like the 1926 Bugatti Type 35, and the 2010  Ford Crown Victoria are both super fun slow cars to race with. They're so slow you need to practice carrying as much speed around corners as possible. I feel it's a very fun change of pace from the hypercars you will see people driving normally. But if you don't like slow cars, I've found the 1988 Lamborghini Countache strikes a happy medium between fast and slow cars. It's moderately fast, and it has good handling. although it can sometimes suffer from understeer. It's honestly a blast to race it with your friends. I personally don't like the online racing with randoms. I feel it's nearly impossible to consistently do well unless you conform to the meta. Ontop of that, I've just found it's super sweaty and not super fun.TL;DR conclusion:it's a fun game to play with friends on xbone gaypass, but not worth it for full or sale price.

You want to create your own crazy wacky races? go for it. Love this game and I highly recommend it.
