review: Bought the Limited Edition controller, turns out you cannot get the DLC that comes with the controller on Steam even if you activated it on the same Microsoft/Xbox account that you use in-game. It's not possible to get it working on the Steam version of the game, they have never even clarified this would be the case.I wonder why did the publisher forget to mention this...

author: Kira Von Black
review: i had such high hopes for this one. such high hopes. but with the bugs this has, it is simply IMPOSSIBLE to recommend this to anyone.the specs are an Intel I7 8700, a Nvidia RTX 2070, and 16 GB of RAM (Game is running from a HDD Toshiba 4TB external Hard Drive)honestly... what is happening with this game?! what is happening with this game?!Races that don't load, roads that don't load, cars that floats in the air, AI that Rubberbands so bad, it misses curves and divebombs you (and even appears ahead of you in some instances without ever overtaking).and the worst thing of it all: the bad implementation of the Event Lab. a freature that was the thing that made me buy this game. place an object near the finish line? GONE. place an object that the game deems unnecessary (even when it is crucial to the event)? GONE. place an extended ramp?! Bottom part GONE, with the higher part Hilariously floating in the air complete, while the bottom is missing.the ammount of stuff that simply dissapears when you place it is amazing. if the game looks your track the wrong angle, it will delete stuff from it. it's amazing the incompetence displayed there.  just incredible.and then there is the cars: the things that should be done the best in this game. Brands Missing, cars being added after the initial release, a Unimog that if you turn slightly harder than it should on a cross crountry circuit incline, starts breakdancing... not to mention being yeeted into the void bellow the track if a car lands on top of me. but then there is the things that work: Photomode looks more realistic than ever. the decal editor has some much needed QOL improvements (but is not as superior as the GT Sport one), and the cars sound much better now... not to mention the tunning here is better than ever, with more options of number of gears and finer tunning (wich can make or break a car. but honestly, some cars that had more options on 4 should have them back on 5. i'm talking about the Class X BAC mono wich now cannot reach it).in a nutshell: The game state is in Pre-Alpha. or even earlier than that. for a game that costs BRL 400 for the full version, this is a disgracefull shame. it's borderline unplayable IF you try Player Generated Content. and i'll be taking 3 to 4 Points form the final score on the final review already.

author: Jared
review: I'm very much enjoying this game. FH4 grabbed me a little harder, but 5 is still a treat in all the ways you might expect from the series. There are some weird / unexpected bugs that weren't present in FH4 (all traffic disappearing when connected online), and I would have expected more cars (a lot of new releases aren't present, where typically in the past they've gotten a bunch of near future / newly released cars in). The awkward story parts of the game start to make a lot more sense if you set your name to "Fellow Human" . Highly recommended.

review: It's like a beta version. FPS drop from 120 fps to 30 fps after one hour or half an hour of playing the game. Bad convoy connection, some arcade missions can't be done with 10 players. Offline gameplay almost fine but accolades getting reset which is a major problem. Looking forward to change my review when all the problems will get fixed.

author: DeadMoose
review: Took everything from FH4 and somehow made it less fun.The entire game map is quite boring, feels small and devoid of content but at the same time feels like a chore to drive across.Seasons add nothing, Every season is summer but X thing to make it unique.Despite Mexico being "rugged" hardly any races are actually off-road or cross country.The entire game honestly feels incomplete and I regret buying it.

author: OldManScribs
review: Month ago would have given 5 stars , last patch they took the spins off car purchases, lowered the spins down so much a NEW player can NEVER get any decent cars, Beautiful game wrecked by the developer...Would give it 2 stars in condition its in.And funny  because i gave them a bad review the banned me !!!   Steer away...

author: Rusty
review: TLDR: Refunded - disappointing gameplay and performance on Steamdeck.In my search for finding the best racing game for Steamdeck, I was baited by the nice graphics to try FH5, but you won't really get that, instead you get to enjoy all these issues:- frequent drops in framerate, even on lowest settings- noticable input latency- long loading screens- the game crashed within the first hour of play, during an annoying cutscene which I then had to rewatch- bad navigation and mission system- cars have poor handling- cringe story, unskippable cutscenes and characters who will not shut up and let you drive in peaceThere are lots of "diversity" options in the character creation settings, but you are forced to play a character with an arrogant sounding British accent... in a game that's taking place in Mexico. Why is everyone so talkative? I couldn't care less what they are saying.During my 90 minutes of playtime, it felt like the game was deliberately wasting my time, overexplaining the relatively simple game mechanics (maybe to try and bridge the time possible to refund?). At least during my playtime, I couldn't fast travel to missions, always needed to drive around the map.The clunky handling of cars reminded me of Excite Truck on the Wii, but less fun.Race courses are mostly straight lines with few turns. But when a rare turn shows up that requires braking, it's surprisingly difficult to tell, where the track is and react in time, without playing with "race lines" turned on or staring at the minimap the whole time.Here's a list of better racing games that I'd rather play on Steamdeck:- Wreckfest- Dirt Rally 1 + 2- Trackmania- World Racing 2- Road Redemption- Sonic All-Stars Racing- F-Zero GX (on Dolphin Emulator)- NFS Most wanted or Carbon (original PC version)- Burnout- Racing in JC3, GTA IV/V, Sleeping DogsOn windows:- Assetto Corsa- Rfactor- iRacingConsole:- Forza 3 on Xbox 360- Gran Tourismo on PS- Mario Kart 8 on SwitchThe few good things:Maybe if you care mostly about nice graphics and have a top-tier gpu, this game is worth it, but otherwise it's not. The multiplayer features might be able to redeem FH5, it seems fun to drive around the map with other players, but I couldn't fully explore the multiplayer features without running out of time to refund the game.One feature that is certainly impressive is the wide selection of new cars.

If I have to work everyday so do you Microsoft. Get your â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ asses in gear and fix the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ game. I am fed up with modern gaming.EDIT-I am back many months later. author: BlackIce
review: See its a good game but I feel as if it misses some vital parts for a 100$ game, See they added more customisation for cars but it still feels as if its lacking. Its got a good multiplayer but its not like what you would expect, there arn't really "car meets" and the community is a bit lacking but you can find good convoys out their. if you are looking for a solo racing game this is it 100%, multiplayer is doable but gets a bit rough at times and I feel as though you earn credits to easily in the game, you get to many cars to quickly and it doesn't really feel like you're working on them, you just click and install the highest power part then tune it. I love forza, I have since FM6 but for such a big company they really need to refine the engine sounds. (I still love the game)

author: SombreSire
review: The game is great when it works. I love it.But making it working is a pain, the game crashes at launch; since the last update I can't play it anymore.I always have 'Windows cannot access the file  for one of the following reasons: there is a problem with the network connection, the disk that the file is stored on, or the storage drivers installed on this computer; or the disk is missing. Windows closed the program ForzaHorizon5.exe because of this error.Program: ForzaHorizon5.exe'I have already reinstalled the game 3 times (and downloading 105GB on a small dsl line is a pain), tried reinstalling on a different drive, no success. Disabled all the running program in the background, no success. Updated all the installed software (VC++, videocard drivers ..)For that price it is a shame to have all of these problems.

author: Zenny :D
review: I have never played a Forza game. In fact the last proper racing game I remember playing is Need For Speed Hot Pursuit 2. I haven't given it much time, and it's a great looking game and I do love to just drive around in a game from time to time.But my god, the obvious fake "players" driving around, and then it starts using my friend list as the player names like I can't see right through that immediately, and any time anyone talks it's so cringey, and some of the car packs saying "FREE" and then you go to the page and it costs 5 bucks. Give me a break. Somehow this game managed to hurt my soul in a way no other game ever has. And so quickly too. Ugh.

author: NubTheFatMan
review: I bought this for my Steam Deck so I'd have a portable racing game to play on the go. I had the graphic settings on the lowest they could go and the game had a mostly solid 60 FPS. However the problem comes when you do your first expedition. I chose the cross country one. Up until this point, I've only had 2 crashes, but now it's crashing at roughly the same time every time I try. With the publisher behind this and how many Forza games there are now, this is unacceptable performance. It's not just a crash either, it completely freeze up my Steam Deck. The game drops to 1 FPS for some unknown reason, my bluetooth audio gets super choppy, and the steam buttons stop responding to my input. The only way to get out of the freeze is to hold the power button until my device turns off.The game was decent for the first 100 minutes that I've played, but now that I can't progress, I'm just not into the game anymore. Now I haven't tried looking at possible fixes, I just expected the game to work fine without much tinkering. But from how publishers are releasing games  in poor states these days, those expectations are just too high I suppose. But I'm sticking to those expectations.

author: s3govesus
review: Drivatar AI is broken if you play on any difficulty other than the easiest. One or two cars always pulls out way ahead of the pack and it's nearly impossible to catch up with them. When upgrading and tuning your car, the speed/handling/acceleration/etc preview numbers don't actually mean anything, as the effectiveness of the upgrades can vary significantly from what is suggested by those values. author: golira
review: Am I looking at the window in real life? No I am driving a car in a video game. The video game is Forza Horizon 5. In this game you can drive  1000 kilometers per hour in a car or way slower on a bike. Just kidding there or no bikes in the game and you canâ€™t go that fast.

author: DustinEden
review: I'm now done with all the main singleplayer content (races, PR stunts, exploration, etc.) and I can confidently say - as an avid racing game nerd - this is probably the best racing game of the last 10 years.The amount of sheer content and it's quality is staggering. Horizon 5 has so many facets and each of them feels fleshed out. No matter if you're a competitive racer, love freeroaming and relaxing or want to get creative, there is so much good stuff to get into for everyone. This phrase gets used a lot, but there really is more than enough for everyone here.Considering this game has constant stream of content updates and an alive, diverse multiplayer along with a really solid and lengthy base game makes this one of the few racing games recommending at full price. A shame this game had to release with unfortunate launch and connectivity issues - 'Mostly Positive' does not do this game justice.Horizon 5 has turned my girlfriend, who has barely ever played a racing game, into a racing game fan. Not many games can warm people up to a whole new genres, but when they do, it shows they are among greatest of their craft.

author: Nekorva LaVey
review: Best Crap i ever played

author: hubbazoot
review: If you're looking for a driving SIMULATOR, this is not it.The short, but incredibly frequent, mandatory cutscenes were my main complaint. This meant that the first hour of play only gave me one race, and that was heavily scripted. The plot felt incredibly forced and really , and is my only game-specific criticism. The best way I can describe is it feels like your parents joined you and your friends and just keep yelling "LOOK AT HOW FUN THIS IS" the whole time.Driving is very arcade-y, but that's not necessarily bad. Even "realistic" is quite forgiving. The 160mph in the Bronco and Wrangler was doubtful, and a head-on only crinkled the hood and cracked the windshield. However, the scenery is stunning, and the cars are modeled well inside and out. The map is huge, I doubt I've seen 10% of it in ~90 minutes of play. This is a solid choice for some fun arcade racing, especially if the game is on a pretty big sale.

author: Anorax
review: - Impeccable landscapes- Smooth high framerate- Pumping soundtrack- Superb car and sfx sounds- Intricately detailed car graphics- Does not work with a Logitech G923XB forcefeedback steering wheelYup you read that correctly. One of the most popular recent racing wheels on the market - the G923 - does not work correctly in a AAA racing game and keeps disconnecting with a "controller disconnected" message. I can get it to steer the car but the FF is completely inactive and as soon as I press my accelerator pedal the disconnect message pops up again. Did they even test the steering wheels properly? And yet the Xbox One controller works perfectly.EDIT: They have fixed the steering wheel disconnect messages.

author: Xexen
review: I bought this game thinking this would be a great Racing sim, but i was so mistaken. In order to start the game you are forced to sit through the intro where you have to play through an interactive introduction video. The game feels childish pretty much guiding you where to position your vehicle on the road but thats not the worst part...This game is so woke it made me sick.. while making your character in the beginning the game forces you to choose your identity He/him She/Her They/Them i shuddered so bad through this Cringe moment and chose and a couple minutes later into the next race with a car against 2 motorbikes i realised how gross i felt playing this colourful mess i ALT+F4'd so hard and requested my refund and i am just going to say i am so GRATEFUL to the steam team for granting me that refund i will now try and forget that i bought this train wreck game... yuck

author: supplysquid4544

author: MeTeC
review: Due to the size of this review, I couldn't type all I wanted to say in the default review tab, so if you want to view more, please read the comments.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Forza Horizon 5 is a great sandbox racing game to play with friends, designed for everyone in mind like every Forza Horizon so far, however if you want more than that you will be disappointed.This review is not based on actual server connectivity issues, crash or performances issues. I will pretend it's not there and everything is working as expected.âœ”ï¸âž¤ Stunning environnements, they improved alot from FH4 which was already splendid at the release.Draw distance have been improved, as well as foliages, very few texture pop-in noticeable. âž¤ The game can be downgraded to make it looks like a xbox 360 game and run on Intel Integrated Graphic Card however there is alot of performances issues on PC for some configurations.âœ”ï¸âž¤ Big improvement from FH4, there is alot of verticality, 11 biomes to explore and the disparity between asphalt road and dirt road is perfect.âœ”ï¸âž¤ Same as previous FH games, this is a simu-arcade game and it's perfect like that. Peoples who says this is an arcade game are clueless, the physic have nothing to do with a Need for Speed or The Crew game, you have that simulation feeling from Motorsport but with much less exigency, keep in mind this is a Horizon game so yes they allowed many behaviors that are not possible from Motorsport, like going in the fields at fullspeed or jumping crazy distances however you can't do anything with a car and you will be punished for any mistake if you have removed the aids.âž¤ For casual players that don't really know what they should set in the Difficulty tab. I would suggest this.Drivatars Difficulty: AnyBraking: ABS ONSteering: SimulationTraction control: ONStability control: OFFShifting : Automatic or Shifting (Shifting will make you faster in the end)Driving Line : Brakes Line onlyDamage : CosmeticsRewind : OnThis will grant you a nice experience and you will feel the behavior of your cars, most important is Steering to not feel like you are stick on a track and Traction control if you have a high power car to avoid losing control when you accelerate without playing with the throttle.âœ”ï¸âž¤ 534 at launch and more to come, I find this number staggering considering the modelization quality and sound improvements they got granted for this gameâŒâž¤ There is really nothing exciting about the campaign in all of the Forza Horizon games I played, the fact that you have the possibility to change the AI difficulty to "Tourist" and complete the races and earn all rewards / accolades is just pathetic, just to be clear, I'm not doing that at all, I played all the races at Expert difficulty.It can be seen as a fantastic feature because adusting the game at your own skill seems great for most casuals but I'm just from the oldschool side where you have to beat the content at a fixed difficulty to earn your rewards and continue your campaign progression.If only there were a system where completing every race at a fixed difficulty would give you different exclusive rewards that are not obtainable anywhere else in the game I would be totally ok with that system.Actually there is no point to go for the Unbeatable difficulty because you earn a few extra % of credits at the end of races which is totally useless because the majority of credits you earn are coming from Wheelspins and selling your duplicate cars.âž¤ The campaign (again) desperately need a structure to it, there is no "driving line", you unlock too many things at once, you barely do 2 races that you already have unlocked a new part of a festival, in the end you have so many things to do that you don't know what to do anymore. I mostly use filters but still ... Classic Forza Horizon experience unfortunately.I miss the times of Need for Speed games where you had to climb the rankings and at each stage you had to beat a boss.âž¤ The "Stories" are really a waste of development time in my opinion, I though the developpers understood that almost all of the playerbase didn't cared about them but instead they increased x3 times the numbers of them since FH4.You just complete them once and you are done with it forever, they are not even interesting like the "Expeditions" (which are not even that great too), they throw you some really bad tuned cars that have no power whatsoever, it feels like playing Forza Motorsport but we are in freacking Horizon, this is all about having fun at high speed and making fun things and they throw you these boring stories.âŒâž¤ This is a PEGI 3 ultra casual game, so as expected the whole story line and vibes of the game is really cringe. Even if you crash multiples times into a race and finish last, the narrator will tell you that you are the "Superstar". I become tired of this trend, that was already the case in FH4 and especially in The Crew 2 where they had that facebook follower scenario which was already 10-years old outdated at the release.âŒâž¤ The multiplayer in this game (even without any connectivity issues which is currently happening) is really lacking.I bought this game to mainly play multiplayer in the long term, unfortunately like FH4, I will leave the game as soon as I unlock every achievement and complete the whole campaign.Why ? I just want to races against other people, what a surprise for a racing game right ? but the only way to do that is to participate in their "Horizon Open" this is the only option to matchmake against other player and this is terrible.Firstly you can't choose what type of races and category of performance you are gonna play, so if you just tuned your nicely S1 900 Aston Martin specced for Road Races you will have 1/10 chance to have that kind of races in the multiplayer, instead the matchmaking will mostly throw you in a Cross Country C700 and you can go â™¥â™¥â™¥ yourself for the next 5 races.Secondly, the WAITING TIMES, thanks to the greedy editor this game is still cross-gen between Xbox older gens and new gens, so if you have 1 player out of 12 in your game who have an old gen console, you will wait more in the loading screen than to actually play the game, it's even worse if there a PC user with a 5400 rpm HDD, they didn't even implemented a skip rule if the loading is longer than 1 minute or so, why should we all wait because one person don't even bother to upgrade his rig.Thirdly, outside of loading time which are already killing my enthusiasm to do any random races, I WANT TO PLAY THE GAME AND DO RACES WITH PEOPLE FOR THE MAJORITY OF MY PLAYTIME, I don't want to see unnecessary scoreboard at the beginning of the races which have no point and no ones cares about them, I don't want to see stupid fortnite emotes, just start the races as soon as everyone have loaded it for god sake !âž¤ They removed ranking ... So instead of reworking and improving the ranking of FH4, they decided to remove it from the game, it's much simpler to fix indeed, what a shame really. They literally trippled the numbers of stories but removed this gamemode that could be a really great element of retention in terms of players in the game. Now you have literally no reasons to bother playing multiplayer in this game. âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£âž£â–¼â–¼â–¼

author: Jamedog
review: Good, but not great just yet. Forza Horizon 5 feels the same as its predecessor with some parts, with a multitude of bugs and connection issues. Don't get me wrong, it looks better, arguably has more launch content, and features a larger world, but if you told me this was a standalone expansion, it would make sense to me. The post-launch content updates and DLC will be telling.It's better than 4, yes, but not by some overwhelming margin. Having said that, there's a reason I put in 20 hours before the game even officially released though. At its core, you just want to keep driving.

author: Alex CEU
review: I own an awful lot of racing games. The reason I have so many is because I have always been searching for the perfect blend of fun, difficulty, speed, vehicles, track variety and the feeling of actually driving on the open road. Sure plenty of driving games offer one, two or maybe even three of these traits however Forza Horizon 5 has ticked every single one of those boxes and then added some boxes on top. This game is an absolute phenomenon.

author: Krzair
review: I got 2 supercars at the start of the game, get way too much money way too easily. What's the point in playing this again? There feels like almost nothing to actually work towards as you get everything way too quickly. All the updates are just giving us cars from the last game with almost nothing new to them. Yeah it looks good, but that doesn't save a game that feels brutally hollow, lacking a lot of the content from the past games.This game just feels like another boring racing game that doesn't challenge you in anyway shape or form. Post Launch Content has been pretty bad aside from the hot wheel dlc. Go play Horizon 4, better in almost every single way

Two first cars gets some king of boost and that is how unbeatable Drivatars works)- A lot of textures just hanging in mid airOverall despite having some improvements like better RWD experience and toggleable features on cars game feels like downgrade of Forza Horizon 4.

author: Lovely_Uncle
review: It's absolutely mind boggling that this game has been out for almost a year and still has so many issues. The online in this is so broken that I just don't even bother trying to play with friends anymore since they haven't fixed bugs that have been breaking the entire experience since day 1. The only thing this has going for it is that it has a lot of cars, but most of them are just not interesting. You're gonna find a lot of super cars and variations of the same thing, and not many real life attainable tuners or sleeper hits. That might not be a big deal for some, but the novelty wore off really quick and everything just started to feel the same to me. I like Porsche but I don't need 30+ of them, and especially not when the other manufacturer selections are so sparse that you end up in situations where you're looking for something new and fun, and your choices are picking between 3 Acuras or a single (1) Datsun.  I also distinctly remember them advertising this game as having a better street scene than 4 and having a focus on cars from actual Mexican car culture which is just a straight up lie. There's 1 story line mission where you can unlock a beetle and that is the extent of that gimmick they marketed this game on. The characters are so terrible that I turned off dialogue so I would not have to hear them, and the story its self is just completely unneeded in my opinion. If you like time trials this game has almost none. The event creator is super bare bones and unfun to use. You can't invite people to your convoy through the game its self anymore, you have to use the xbox app instead which is just completely worthless. As far as I'm aware the only new races they've added since launch are from the hotwheels expansion which costs 20 dollars on top of this already unfinished 60 dollar game. The performance is terrible even on lower settings and anything under high looks like a late 360 game. Everything about it just feels soulless. This games biggest crime is being the only choice of open world racing game at the moment. Really hope something replaces it soon.

author: Ezure
review: As someone thatâ€™s been a fan of the Horizon Franchise since 2016, I can say that I am disappointed in this new Forza horizon title.First of all this game is Incredibly dry, with barely any content (except for Horizon hot wheels) thereâ€™s no story to the game at all, and the progression system is terrible.Unfortunately the progression system has been pretty bad since Horizon 4 although some argue horizon 3 was also the same which I have to disagree on.But enough battering the game for a moment, let me name the positives.1. Improved graphics, The graphics in this title are fantastic and running this game at high - ultra settings is smooth as butter (you still need a fairly good computer to run it)2. Car sounds, The car sounds are a step up from horizon 4 however some car sounds have been reused and thrown into Horizon 5Thatâ€™s literally it. I cannot think of anything else thatâ€™s a positive about this game, the online system is incredibly buggy, players randomly disappear off the face of the earth, you randomly disconnect sometimes during events or even free roam, and itâ€™s been a problem for a long time since game release and the developers havenâ€™t done much to fix it, sure they did try to make some stability improvements and fix some of its performance issues for online but itâ€™s still buggy and itâ€™s far from fixed.Speaking of performance issues, Horizon 5 (Especially on steam) is an absolute nightmare to start up, if you have a antivirus or malware enabled on your pc, your game will likely crash and not start up, and the only way to counter this is to turn off your antivirus/malware but even then your still at risk.Itâ€™s really hard for me to recommend this game as itâ€™s got so many issues that I canâ€™t even say all of it in 1 review thatâ€™s how much there is.Overall, the game is fun for a little while but gets boring after you get fed â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ super cars at the beginning of the game and maybe some from wheel spins.Aside from all of that, this game has a lot of issues especially the steam version and it makes the game unenjoyable to play and ruins the experience.I wouldnâ€™t say the game is a dumpster fire but itâ€™s definitely not in a good state.If you have Xbox game pass you might as well play it seeing as its free on the Microsoft store.Save your money and DO NOT buy Forza horizon 5 on steam.

review: and here we have it ladies and gentelman..... another new Forza game which is by far in my opinion amazing and way better in any way then the rest of the Horizon series....Forza Horizon 5 in other words is the most amazing/beautiful racing game ever made....i also mentioned that in forza horizon 4 but still.....its located in Mexico and has a lot to give....like even better and gorgeous areas to view and also take pictures in them plus you can listin to even better soundtracks then forza horizon 4 has by far...As usual my most favorite radio station is "Hospital Records" and the song i like by far is "Zaichik by Subwave x Bop"....wow man this gives me goosebumps writing this review and yeah...in other words "You Better Save some Money and seriously BUY THIS GAME! author: BloodRedSkies
review: Boring as hell! Wow, as a huge NFS fan this was my first Forza game and I came with high expectations, considering everyone seems to rave about this game as superior to NFS, but that is far from the truth! I could not find myself enjoying this at all, it was so boring and dull, even in intense races, and it's missing everything NFS had that made it great with the initial growth factor from the bottom and the extra fun elements of cop chases and spamming nitrous. The graphics and visuals are great, but that's all this game had for me. Even the soundtrack wasn't good, nor did I enjoy the outdoorsy theme and off-road races. Utterly disappointing and boring, returned it.

author: Alchimedes
review: Its not a bad game, just feels so boring and dull after a short time.With Need for Speed you have this over the top customisation an a actual story.With The Crew 2 you get a huge open world and many difftent types of vehicels.And Forza just has beatifull graphics, many cars and 'realistic' driving. Sadly the worst part of the game is however its progression, like cool i had 200 cars after 20 hours of gameply but i wont ever drive most of them simply because there is no point. In the other titels i mentiond have you saving money for a car you want and when you can buy it youre happy and want to earn your next car with the one you just bought. This results in good gameplay-loop which is completly missing from forza.DLC's btw not really worth it, if you like hot-whells cars tha go for it its a bit of fun at least and for the upcomming rally expension i've sadly lost hope the it will be be any good simply because it has preatty much no actuall rally-cars ???All in All i do hope the next game will be a reboot, otherwise the series will probably fail.

author: Fred_Mackay
review: Extremely pretty, incredible list of cars which is surely going to grow, an amazing landscape which has some awesome driving roads. I'd recommend to people who only casually like racing games for most of it, and to people who love a challenge there's the Rivals series.I'm not a professional reviewer, and no doubt if people are reading this now, most of the bugs are either being fixed or already fixed and the network issues are being ironed out. Great job Playground Games!

author: MrMonsterHunter
review: This game is a downgrade from 4. Horizon arcade is almost impossible with the difficulty scaling, the new menu ui is just god awful (why would they change it??), there is a plethora of network issues, the forzathon challenges are buggy to the point of not even working at all, and the hand holding constantly disrupts your gameplay at the start-middle of the game. Wait a few months for the patches to come out, I regret buying this at launch.

author: Killaa*NL*
review: First of all i would like to say i played a lot of FH games and i loved all of them! This one looks like a amazing game too, looks fantastic and another country to discover. so i got it early acces for 100 euros in the hope to play early with friends. When i first launched the game i got a crash right at the playground games logo, and that is all i have seen from this game myself, im honestly impressed the game looked soo good! such a nice (still earrape) intro that has not changed exept for it to be the only thing i have seen... I was so hyped for the game but no i am no longer hyped for it and gonna ask a refund for this, i tried all the steps to get it to run without any succes no antivirus nothing running etc etc.. Even if without antivirus installed it would run i would still not play the game, since i will never run my pc for longer periods without a anti virus. As of for my friends who came further than the playground games intro they had their fair play of bugs and crashes too, 1 of them did not go further than the home screen before it crashing to desktop, the other could not play online and the last one said he had never ever seen the windows reboot screen that much as the days he was playing the game and trying to launch it after a crash, he had to reboot his pc before being able to launch it. So for now i will give a negative review and gonna refund the game. I will probably get the game again in the future but i am not paying this much money for a earrape and that is all i will get for the game. And as last here a friendly message to Xbox game studios and playground games:TEST YOUR GAME BEFORE RELEASING SOMETHING! This honestly looks like a game without it actually being tested.

Playground rather fix the money and exp exploits but don't bother fixing the bugs, will update my review once they address the tons of issues lying within this game.

author: Mech Madness
review: The offline content, engine sounds, map, graphics are all brilliant but come on. Online is completely awful. The online is a complete downgrade from fh4 with all the same issues of not being able to pick seasons and ridiculously long loading screens making you spend more time waiting than playing. And then the removed features from fh4 being no more custom matchmaking and ranked. The only way to play say S2 road is to sit there for half an hour cycling open racing. Its just ridiculous! And then there is also no ranked at all of which was even in fh4 at launch! The game has so much potential but the buggy and awful online makes it so bad and removes so much replay-ability. Come on, Fix the game and add features that where even in fh4!, let alone actually improve beyond fh4!

author: ManChicken
review: +Game is optimized really well, plays fine with a gtx1060 3gb and 2600k@4.9ghz. There are also great graphical settings+Accolades are fun to do+Lot of things to do, and the map is fun to drive in+Looks amazing, cars and the map is well detailed+-Still not a good driving simulator, both under/oversteer are unrealistic and the cars overall feel is not that good. It is more fun than realistic-Unbeatable mode is useless, and the accolades take days to do. Unbeatable means that even if you drive perfectly, you will lose since your opponents can go in corners 3x faster than you. (against the laws of physics)-Story mode is pretty boring, a lot worse compared to FH4-The Eliminator mode: Laggy when playing, sometimes cannot see enemies, horrible rubberbanding when in duel mode-Wheel settings do not save when restarting the game-Gets pretty boring after completing everything. The weekly missions are the only reason I even come back to this game-Many accolades are too difficult or sometimes even almost impossible to do if you are just an average player-Car sounds are sometimes completely off---Playing with a friend is really â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ annoying, took literally over an hour for 2 IT-students to get to play together

review: A great mixture of simulation and arcade style racing/free roam driving game from Microsoft.Forza Horizon 5 is nothing short of the previous entry and it has improved significantly.The freedom of driving around in free roam is what makes this game so good. If you are into car/racing games and you like simulation but don't mind a bit of arcade style, then best time to grab Forza Horizon 5 would be during a sale!Note: Make sure you grab yourself a controller and play the game using it. I wouldn't really recommend playing with a keyboard.

author: shadowspartan58
review: If you want a game to just run in, play with some fast cars, then leave? This is perfect for you then. But if you're looking for the classic Forza and Forza Horizon experience of starting with a little hatchback and fighting your way all the way up to a Lambo or F1 car, then this game won't feel very challenging. This game starts by handing you three legendary cars, and you can easily upgrade them to the max in a couple hours. Fun, but ultimately unsatisfying.

author: Neð•usMað•us
review: Long story short, it's Forza Horizon. If you've played Horizon 3 and 4, then you'll know exactly what to expect. That means a well-crafted open-world with a vast car roster (that will get bigger like in H4) and plenty of things to do. It's a typical Horizon recipe that has led to success with the last two games and it's not difficult to see that it will do the same for Horizon 5.So why the thumbs-down? It's because as potentially great the game is, it's marred by a fair number of significant issues that should be patched in the months to come. These include;- LODs not working as they should on settings below Extreme. Even on Ultra, even textures a few feet in front of you load an extremely low, almost-PS1-like texture.- MSAA seemingly not doing much even when set to 8x.- Constant disconnects from Horizon Life.- Some jarring effects like your car suddenly coming to a halt and traffic/player cars disappearing suddenly due to the constant reconnecting with Horizon Life.- Some significant bugs including some Accolades being unachievable.I've not experienced any crashing so far, but I've seen reports of some people being unfortunate to experience them.Overall, good game, but definitely not worth the money especially for the top-specced Premium version as of right now. Once many of these issues are sorted, then I can comfortably recommend it. Until then, it's best to get it on Game Pass first to see how it feels for you.

review: If you enjoyed Forza Horizon 4, you will enjoy this game although there are currently issues with the online component of the game which causes some annoyance and frustration especially with Forza Horizon Arcade. This is a personal preference but I prefer the music in Forza Horizon 4 than Forza Horizon 5 but this is up to your own music preferences.Pros- Great Graphics- Great selection of Cars- Map terrain is fun especially in the Mountains and Sand DunesCons- Online component is unstable. Makes doing some of the activities on the Season Playlist frustrating due to it not being stable.- Forza Horizon Arcade is brutally difficult due to issues with finding people to play with. From reading online currently there seems to be online issues causing people to disconnect from these events. Hopefully this is fixed in the future.- Performance issues after playing the game after about a hour and a half. Fixed by restarting the game.I recommend this game but best to wait until they get the online issues fixed.

author: Admiral Hog
review: forza 5 is a very typical microsoft piece of software, it would be nice if it worked properly.my initial experience of it was crashes on boot, taking forever to load, refusing to recognise game pads (including their own) and absolute insistence on Ruining the experience so they can leach as much personal information as they can so they can sell it to 3rd parties. crashing on exit, causing steam to crash, causing pc to crash forcing me to reboot because i cant launch steam anymore. finally booting but refusing to recognise wheel inputs, giving button numbers insted of symbols on screen for whee linputs.then crashing steam and my pc againbecause i have to exit to try and get the wheel working again. ive had to give it a dedicated SSD and migrating game has been an absolute nightmare.since it is 135GB in size. thats been my experience of forza 5 for the last 3 days. its the only game that causes these issues. honestly microsoft, i know you haven't finished a OS since xp but after all these years you must have learned SOMETHING? even on their own console the game takes ages to load and then kicks you out of the game to apply an unwanted update when your in the middle of a race.... disgraceful. im glad i didn't buy their console and i never will now. there is simply no excuse for this level of incompetence from one of the biggest companies on the planet. and there is absolutely no need to force people to sign in to a microsoft account to play a game! its come to a point where the thought of going through all that stress is to off putting to try again, i would rather play something else.

author: dwhit999
review: Fun game with a huge selection of cars and upgrades. Overall it is a beautiful looking game with a few minor issues with wheels clipping through fenders or the occasional light pole floating two feet above the ground. Driving physics is not meant to be a simulation but does provide a learning curve. The auction house has never been a viable system since there appears to be little to no effort to deter cheaters.Which brings me to one of my complaints, any of the online racing is almost assuredly a waste of time. Just about every race I've been in seems to either have a level 25 999 player (which would take over a thousand years to achieve without cheating) or level 2 player racing some low end car that ends up magically going around hairpin turns at full speed and winning by 30 seconds or more. If you don't have any interest in winning the online races, the only other caveat is the Eliminator, which is just arbitrary chance. Skill is meaningless; you just need to have the right car drop randomly next to you. This could be one of the all-time great racing games if Microsoft would actually do something about the rampant cheating and also eliminate the Eliminator.

author: Eimilian
review: Note: This is coming from a long time GT fan and his first "Forza Horizon" video game. The review isn't one sided; the reason why I don't recommend it in its current state is because the cons outweights the pros. I might change this in the future if the cons are fixed. I've got to say that the RWD, FWD and AWD in this game just feels right. Understeering and oversteering are factors for all type of drivetrains which in some games aren't entirely existant. The only downside to physics is that jumping for thousand of feet in the air doesn't kill the car's suspension or better yet, doesn't bring your driver to the hospital! Lots of customization for both liveries and tuning. I was very happy to see that parts for the car like engines and drivetrains can be completely changed. This also changes the sound the car makes which is a nice addition. As for livery, I am aware that players are getting banned for some really stupid reasons. So be very aware of what liveries you share! Super7, eventlabs, etc. Community made content is what makes both a game good and bad. In this case, I'd say it's average for this game. Some of the community content are garbage and have thousands of likes. I mean, as an example, Super7 probably have hundreds of cards which hold the same jumps, highway runs and let's not forget go down that one huge mountain WITHOUT CHEATING! But yes, I'll leave this as a pro for now because I still enjoy it overall. Probably one of the best thing out there when it works. Playing with friends is what makes a game better if not best. It's sad to see that the servers have been struggling a lot and sometimes if not most of the time one of your friends will drop out due to something stupid like the servers not responding. To save up some ressources, I've decided to play the game in High settings. The game looks gorgeous! With photo mode you can take pictures that looks very semi-realistic. You could show it to a co-worker or a friend and they would totally believe it's your car! The game servers are struggling a lot. I still don't understand why a high budget game can't learn from others and actually put a bit more money into the servers. Some people claims it's bad netcoding which I entirely would believe. But not being able to play online pretty much breaks most of the features of the game which also includes playing with friends. I've been mostly playing on Highly Skilled as I felt like it was the somewhat less BS difficulty. And I mean less because the rubber banding in this game is way too obvious. The rubber banding is also only one sided. You make a mistake and you will not be able to catch up the AI. This can be clearly seen in single lap races when you have the best lap but end up coming in second place with an AI that has 3 seconds of lap time behind you. I do admit racing can't do AI right, even Gran Turismo has AI flaws. This is also one of the worse things I've seen in a game. Playing with randoms. It wouldn't be bad if you didn't need to do any of those, but the game forces you to do those races in order to win prices in a weekly "seasonal" event. Even in team races, the Forza community will still fight for first place. Some will push you, others will ram you out of the checkpoints. It's a bit of a frustrating experience so to say. Rarely you will get players who race "clean" but this is probably most likely due to the AI of the game forcing you to constantly play aggressively. I'm sure there isn't entirely a solution to this problem, but at least if there was a better collision detector it would probably at least make this less of a con. This game feels like a beta of an alpha version of a game. Things are VERY, VERY game breaking. Horizon Super7 cards crashing your game. The game teleporting you to areas you are not even suppose to be in. The game constantly pausing itself to show you progress while you're in the middle of something. Some car have non-working spoilers which is funny. This is just to name a few things I've gotten through in the 60 hours of gameplay I have.

author: zyvod
review: ok, so when you're racing, this is the best racing game out there. but the interface is a disaster, the unlock system is a nightmare, and worst of all, even if you have the steam release, it makes you tie in to XBox Live. and in the years since the last time I used something on Live, it has become a major disaster. by default every random harasser can see everything you do, and you cannot stop harassers from following you. the best you can do is login to an interface on their website and limit what they can view to only friends, which they've reset to not be the default even if you had it set that way in the past.this would be a top recommendation if it wasn't for all the microsoft and xbox garbage, but I cannot recommend it as is. I'm spending way more time dealing with microsoft's garbage than actually playing the game. avoid this and all other xbox games co-released on steam, since it's a fake steam release and they will punish you for it.

author: Levi
review: After playing 34 hours of this game, i gotta admit i'm still addicted and i won't stop playing for a while. This game did what no game did for me for 3 years, it brought me back to gaming. This is not a review comparing it to Forza 4, because i haven't played that game, but from a new player's point of view, this is amazing. I still get shocked by the amazing graphics this game has to offer, and the unlimited content the creators added is shocking, I really recommend it if you're into car games. A lot of people said that is nothing without a steering wheel, but i play it on an xbox controller only and i gotta say it's still amazing, but i would love to try it with a wheel as well! However, i really enjoy this game and i think it deserves a 10/10 :)

author: POOL'S KLAUSED
review: I've played my fair share of racing games, arcades, sims, and sci-fi and others. Now this here, it looks beautiful, it has a broad car selection, and it has a nice and pretty open world, but that's about it.You drive a brick on wheels while the AI, especially on higher difficulties, is flying oiled-up X-Wings. On lower difficulties you are basically handed the victories. Drifting sucks, period. Unlocks are grindy. Visual car customization is close to non-existent. Radio stations are mind-numbingly boring and repetitive. And don't get me started on the cringe fiesta that is the storyline. Racing games usually have cringe storylines, but this one is just obnoxious while also being non-connected and simply just there for something to be there.Too late to refund this, so I guess I'll just be playing out of spite.Avoid. Even indie racers have superior gameplay.Sterilized corporate product / 10

author: SKA_Tani
review: Before I get to the negatives, I want to point out that this game is good and has plenty of fun but it has some problems! And these are the following issues at the time of writing:-Major Bugs and problems are still happening. Some of them are following: Horizon Arcade is completely broken and barely playable with other playersEleminator has problems with disappearing players and ability to challenge others to a head to head duel as well as hackers and cheaters.The AI is completely broken to the point where you have a deathwish if you are going higher than Above Average on S2 and X class races...-Slow hotfixes that doesn't fix much: Right now we have had ONE hotfix and that fixed the networking SLIGHTLY and nerfed two farming methods for wheelspins and rewards.-Overzealous banning and punishments over liveries: The past week and a half people have been banned or scared to pull back multiple liveries after reports that they received permabans or ban of 8000  LITERAL years for liveries that were considered offensive, some where "Haha N-word!!" The word "FREE" is completely forbidden on Vans and Pickups vehicle category and others were just a motive for a anime character with no sexual additions what so ever. What has happened is that there is very little variation when you look for character liveries because people are scared â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ of getting a ban from either algothrims or totalitarian mods. And no, YOU CANNOT APPEAL THE BANS.If you think this is too much, I want to suggest to wait until they actually fix these issues in a couple of months or buy the game on a sale.If you think you can deal with the issues, then I highly recommend the game. Just.. don't put any liveries on! No joke!

author: Silent Bob
review: Great Game. A bit buggy atm on Steam. Got 3 crashes in 11 hrs. A was playing for a month using X-Box Game Pass and the game didn't crash once there after around 35 hrs of play. Maybe patches are a little delayed on Steam (?).

author: DannyðŸ”±
review: I haven't played the previous Horizon games, so it was all completely new to me - no "reskin/new map" feeling.I'm not hugely into cars, but in a way you can play this game as an RPG, collecting stuff, grinding this and that, completing accolades, creating designs, etc.200 hours in  and  I'm having loads of fun and there are still TONS of things to do!Pros that personally matter to me:- The game is beautiful, you can take some really amazing photos!- So many things to do! If you like finding secrets, you can do that. Want to race? Dozens of them! Story-driven mini series? Sure thing! Want to spend 2 days on a vinyl group? Good luck! Just riding around, doing crazy stuts? Hell yeah!- I actually like the progression - which is kinda non-existent. I don't mind being able to get all the cars quickly - this means I can just drive whatever I want and most of the cars are indeed usable with proper tuning, so it's not like you'll use nothing but supercars.- I like the weekly seasonal challenges. They make you use cars you wouldn't normally use and do races/tournaments you also wouldn't do. They are fun!What I don't like:- The game is in need of a nice beefy patch. My PC is decent and I'm not really experiencing crashes or performance issues, but many of the online features are just broken.- It's probably just me, but I would really like some attractive character models. Sure, not everyone needs to be beautiful, but some nice babes to choose from would be nice as an option, thought they were somewhat part of the street racing scene.- There are tens of thousands of people in game, yet Horizon Arcade is dead. Convoy barely works. People are disappearing. The leaderboard has many cheaters and so far they haven't really done anything about them.- They could also do some QoL improvements and I'm sure some will come in the future, but they really need to get this patch done ASAP.Besides the online stuff, I have no issue with the game, it's definitely one of my favorites this year, highly recomennded.9/10

author: Thunder Thighs
review: The game is mediocre at best, Car handling is a joke, Engine sounds are so generic that almost all the cars sound the same(Except Lexus LFA default engine). Cheaters are everywhere in the multiplayer parts. Wheel support is basically non existent as in my separate wheel and shifter combo I have to redo the controls every single time I turn on the game. Otherwise I lose the ability to shift my gears. Playing wheel VS Gamepad/keyboard is really unfair, because the gamepad and keyboard cannot oversteer and cause the front wheels to lose traction. Lets not even talk about automatic vs manual clutched shifting which is basically completely broken as the manual takes 10 times longer to go into gear than the same installed transmission except with automatic.  Force feedback on wheels is an absolute joke. The most that you can feel is the car constantly trying to self-center and the stupid unrealistic constant shaking of the wheel when driving offroad(anyone who has driven a car fast on a dirt road will know how inaccurate it feels). You cannot feel when you lose traction either.EDIT at 96 hours and a few months later. My opinion still stands. There has been barely anything new added to the game and unlike the previous titles this one is now extremely grindy. The game is pretty, but not adding any new content for so long is making the game stale quite early on.

author: playeverything
review: tl;drStop being fine with low end mediocrityAsk for moreAnd don't buy this game if you don't have a group of dedicated car fans to play it withThis game is a prime example of modern game devs giving players the bare minimum and players being happy with that, not realizing how much more these games could and should be, and how uninspired game design has become nowadaysFunny thing is, it's still among the best arcade racing games right now...because there are literally no good arcade racing games right nowI should really be giving this game a thumbs-up, considering I play it weekly and have spent several hundred hours on it at this point right?Well, as much as the Horizon gameplay, at its core, has been fun for so long now, the game becomes more and more dissapointing with just about every update it receives. Not because it gets worse or anything, but rather because this game could and should be so much more than it currently is.This is the Horizon 5 gameplay loop:Come back once a week, spend about 20 minutes on getting a new car, and then that's it for the week.Once a month, look at the "new" stuff they added, usually at best 4 cars that are often extremely uninteresting, be disappointed, play NFS Hot Pursuit or Burnout Paradise instead.If it wasn't for me having a biological requirement to own every car in every car game I own, I would've put this one away quite some time ago...There is just something so uninspiring about this game.Take for example the 10th anniversary celebration event that is currently going on. I got all hyped up because I thought "Hey, they surely put a lot of effort into this right? They even recreated all the original title screens inside the new map."NoAll we get is a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ story, that involves going from A to B in a reasonable amount of time in order to get 3 stars. Just like literally every other story in the game, alongside a car that is already in the game, but as an "anniversary edition".Nothing in this game feels like a breath of fresh air for the series. The seasons are just tacked on in order to sell their weekly content and serve absolutely no other purpose, everything you see here you've already seen since Horizon 3, in fact, you could probably swap the Horizon 3 and 5 UI and fool people into believing they're the same game.It's sad, since this could be the ultimate open world racing experience, but the devs seem to have absolutely no interest in doing anything besides the bare minimum to keep the ball rolling. They do their bugfixes, try (and often fail) to keep competitive racing fair-ish, add some random cars into the game that no one's really interested in (yay, a new electric audi, truly what all my car fantasies have always been about) etc etc.But where's the new stuffWhy no tuner events?Why no drift events?In general, why is the only thing you guys every think of "Win a race" and "Go from A to B"? And don't come at me with your dumb weekly "just for fun" modes that are multiplayer only and also completely deserted about halfway through a week, I want something that is fun when played solo, because that's where good ideas come from.Why is AWD still op?Why did you waste time on developing a global ranking system where the only thing determining your rank is how much time you spent doing chores to gain accolades with zero skill involved?Why do engines, despite sounding somewhat better than last game, still sound so weak with zero punch behind them?Why did I finish the game itself within like 3-5 hours?Why are showdown races so hideously easy, but at the same time ai difficulty hideously unbalanced?Why is the map, besides being on the surface level very beautiful, still lacking the things the community has been asking for for years (e.g. a proper racetrack, a proper airfield, a proper drag strip with lights LIKE WE HAD IN HORIZON 4)If you want to play a game for what it gives you, rather than what you have to scrape from the bottom of the barrel, there is literally nothing to do here after like 10 hours of playtime.That would be fine if this was Minecraft. But in Minecraft, you go into it expecting to build your own adventure. Unlike Minecraft, this game doesn't keep generating new places to explore and things to do, and it doesn't give you the freedom to do whatever you want either. It just keeps regurgitating the same stuff over and over again.We should expect more, and we should ask for more, as the past has shown us that, with much less, other games have been able to give us much more.It is 2022, there are literally no technical boundaries to what these games could be giving us, why are we fine with receiving the bare minimum for more money than we used to pay for even the most revolutionary of games?Edit: Completely failed to mention the abundance of (often gamebreaking) bugs, the absolute desertedness of online lobbies due to their stupid zoning system, and the characters, which have absolutely no personalities besides *insert one of three mexican stereotypes here*, and genuinely made me altf4 the game a few times because I hated them so much.With like 3 lines of dialogue, they manage to make the characters more hateable than most movie villains...Also visual tuning on cars sucksAlso the map, despite being beautiful, also feels dead and sterile because they didn't dare to put some grime into it to make it look more like the real Mexico

author: TheHottShott
review: As a long time fan of Forza, this game just feels, well, boring and forced, like many action movies nowadays. It's fine if you prefer a casual guided experience, though. Here's my top 4 gripes about the game:1. Forced Action. Don't get me wrong, action can be fun, but in moderation. It influences just about everything in the game, from narrative elements to track design. Tracks are frustrating, predictable, and repetitive, particularly on off-road tracks, which will frequently have massive jumps where you can't see anything outside of 3P view with frequently unpredictable corners afterwards making you reliant on the rewind function in order to be facing the right direction half the time. The narrative elements I feel are too frequent, too extravagant, with cringe dialogue. It doesn't let you just do your thing without in-your-face notifications and mandatory decision menus that entirely disregard whatever you were doing. Can't seem to enjoy freeroam much because of it.2. Economy. It takes AGES to get any sort of money in this game, and that comes from an an Elite: Dangerous player. Unless you're placing podium, you're making peanuts, maybe a couple thousand credits per race. You can increase the difficulty to earn more, but that has its own issues which I'll get to next. Once you actually begin to get money, though, you'll realize just how little you're making. For instance, you are more likely to get a vehicle that costs >2,000,000 credits in a randomized wheelspin than affording it full price before you've reached at least 10 hours of playtime on a strict no-spending budget, and it makes absolutely no sense why some things cost so much. Things that are similar in price in real life can be millions of credits apart in the game. Half of the classics are over 1,500,000 credits, and other with arguably better performance and attraction are 40,000. Absolutely no sense whatsoever. You CAN try your hand at the auction house (which, by the way, is the only way to get money for getting rid of a vehicle), where it is possible to afford a vehicle for less than it's autoshow retail price. The main issue is that it's a massive bidding war in the last 1 minute of sale, and by 1 minute, it actually means 1 minute and "ending soon," which will inevitably last just long enough to allow someone else to outbid you without allowing you the same courtesy. You can also earn credits from creating tracks, car designs or tunes, but they offer so little money unless you drop the hottest new design for the most popular car out there. It's just a constant grind to do anything.3. AI Drivatars are either cheaters or grandmas, no in between. As mentioned prior, unless you're placing podium, you're making peanuts. You can increase your final payout by increasing the difficulty, such as skill of the Drivatars, or turning off assists. Turning off assists is fine, unless you're a diehard sim racer, most are going to stay on, and thus the only way to increase your payout is the Drivatar skill. Problem is, pretty much anything after "highly skilled" results in X amount of opponents possessing privileged grid position and ridiculously overpowered upgraded vehicles. You can tell them because there is a significant gap between them and the rest of the pack. You always start near the rear, and have to fight your way through the Sunday drivers to even get to the actual challenge, and unless you manage to get right behind these cheating AI within the first 20ish seconds of the race to be able to draft them, they will almost always pull away from you and defy physics, like pulling 2 lateral Gs going 130mph in a 1930s skinny tire Bentley. They're just broken.4. Numerous bugs and visual issues that make the game quite meh. The biggest ones involve various things missing at night, such as head/tail lights. One that's been bugging me lately is any interior 1P view is significantly darker than 3P views, like you're wearing the darkest shade of sunglasses you can find, 24/7. It's particularly bad during rain or dawn/dusk, where you have to turn the brightness up on the game just to be able to see the road, and other racers (who again, don't have any sort of lights). It's annoying, but truth be told, asides from the graphical bugs, the game is very pretty.There you have it. Play it how you want, but it's definitely not for a more hardcore experience. Wait for Forza Motorsport 8 if it ever comes out.

review: Forza has never failed to be one of the best racing sims (IMO) on any console - I love that im able to push my rig to its fullest with the amazing graphics and detailed vehicles.The sound design in this game is a major step up from Horizon 4 - If you're a car nerd like me you really appreciate the work they put into making the engine sounds as accurate to each type of build as possible - from the sound of a tuned exhaust - to a different intake and turbo - its on another level.The only issues ive encountered is random crashes when customizing cars but its only minor and seems to only happen with very specific cars - which i hope gets fixed in the future.All in all its a great game and i have high hopes for the DLC and the rest of the Horizon titles in the future!10/10

author: HATTORI HANZO!
review: Forza Horizon 5 is yet another step up for the series and arguably the best racing game ever made. Offering a host of content across a fantastic representation of Mexico, its varied terrain and scenery, there's so much to explore and race. A massive roster of cars will perform all of these, each feeling different from the others, with a variety of upgrade and tuning options almost matching those of simulation titles. Although there are a few minor bugs here and there, they are almost so small that they hardly deserve a mention. All in all, it's impossible not to recommend this for anybody, regardless of them being a fan of racing games or not, as this is that good.Pros:1. Fascinating gameplay.2. A huge amount of content that is constantly increasing with each new update.3. Beautifully detailed, fully explorable open world in a vibrant and colorful Mexican setting.4. Good car physics (of course, given that this is an arcade game), which makes the behavior of almost every car unique.5. Realistic weather conditions that directly affect the gameplay.6. Excellent soundtrack (Hospital Records & Horizon Mixtape - 1 <3), perfectly complementing what is happening on the screen.Minuses:1. Lack of licenses for cars of the brands Abarth, Alfa-Romeo, Fiat, KIA and Lancia.2. Minor technical issues.Verdict:"10 skill points out of 10"

author: rhyte67
review: Is Forza Horizon 5 a fun game? Yes. Is it possibly the best arcade racing game on the PC right now? Probably yes. Hundreds of cars, a really fun map, tuning and a lot of challenges - what's not to love?Well, the technical aspect, that's what. Playing with others is either totally painless and fun or a nightmare. Some of the challenges are terribly designed. Sometimes the game crashes, sometimes it registers button presses while the controller sits on my lap. While some things have been patched, most haven't and that is, for such a big game studio, simply unacceptable, especially because Horizon 3 and 4 had some of the same issues so they should've fixed them a LONG time ago.I don't regret buying or playing the game but sometimes it feels like it's been created by a much smaller developer and that just sucks.

author: HotLeafJuice
review: I'm not sure who this review is really for. I don't play modern racing games yet I grew up with racing games like Need for Speed Underground 2, Midnight Club 3, Burnout 3, Burnout Paradise and even Mario Kart. Yet for some reason the Forza Horizon franchise (since Forza Horizon 2) has always called out to me and I have been playing it quite seriously since Forza Horizon 3; Unbeatable Drivatars, all assists off, manual w/ clutch, no rewind. The long and short of this review is that Forza Horizon 5 is a fantastic game and there's really no reason not to recommend it to anyone who doesn't already have an interest in Forza or racing games in general, but regardless, let's start off with the good points.The graphics and general detail have improved; one simple addition here is tyre smoke that adds a satisfying feel to drifting, and even racing in general. The UI has been cleaned up nicely and in general it feels like there is a lot less clutter on screen and in the menus. If you can't see it in front of you, it likely isn't important. Mexico is a wonderful setting for the franchise and hearing that Playground Games actually worked with a team in Mexico to avoid things like cultural appropriation really makes me feel that they did their best to make sure the game was treated with authenticity.All the features that were added into Forza Horizon 4 post release have been baked into 5 in a way that feels natural yet exciting. Features like the Festival Playlist and Eliminator return in 5 with renewed vigour and in general Forza Horizon 5 absolutely loads you with things to do while simultaneously showing you there is no rush to do them. Anything you do will likely result in XP or earning some sort of accolade, and this feels pretty good. This is also an improvement on the more linear aspect of previous entries. You're still required to attain X amount of accolade points to progress, but how you acquire those points (story missions, road racing, dirt, cross country, PR stunts, etc.) is entirely up to you, as is the reward you unlock for completing these. It gives a sense of freedom that the Forza Horizon series has always been about.The story missions are perhaps the best the franchise has ever seen, mixing Mexican culture, photography, racing, PR stunts. The story in Forza Horizon 5 won't blow you away but I appreciate that there is at least some continuity from previous entries with characters like Jaimin reappearing for the street scene (which has surprisingly engaging story missions tied to it). Having our avatars now fully voice acted is a nice touch too, and I especially enjoyed the quips about our protagonist being eerily silent back in the UK.Other significant improvements have been made to engine sounds, with most cars sounding a lot more unique than Forza Horizon 4 and general handling of cars. More than ever it now feels like you have to pick your car carefully for each track rather than using a "one tune fits all" approach.So why does something feel...off about this release? Despite my love for the franchise, why is this the least excited I have ever felt about Forza Horizon? Well, one might say the devil is in the details, and the lack of nuance and polish in some areas has left the game feeling less like Forza Horizon 5 and more like Forza Horizon 4.5. These points are aimed towards the more hardcore audience and I wouldn't actually expect the majority of people to feel affected by these.Let's start with the Drivatar AI, which frankly is the worst it's ever been. In the post game of Forza Horizon 3, I changed my difficulty settings to Unbeatable Drivatars, manual w/ clutch, assists off and never looked back. It was tough at first but eventually I got to a point where with the right car, clean driving, good downshifting and proper throttle control, I was able to beat Unbeatable Drivatars by a narrow margin. This continued in Forza Horizon 4, although I noticed instances where the Drivtars would "cheat". In Forza Horizon 5 I still beat Unbeatable Drivatars the majority of the time but it just isn't fun anymore. I understand the game will always have rubber banding to keep Drivatars competitive and I don't mind this, but some races are frankly unwinnable without ramming the Drivatar in front of you and playing dirty. More than ever Drivatars seem unaffected by weather conditions or even corners, which they'll often take without dropping speed or losing any grip.A common argument I hear from people is "well they're called Unbeatable for a reason!" Perhaps, then Playground Games should consider changing the name to something else, like "Extreme" or "Insane" because there are accolades and achievements for beating Unbeatable Drivatars and having them cheat to keep them Unbeatable just is not fun.Secondly, the music is disappointing. While this point is undoubtedly subjective, I've seen multiple reviews expressing the same sentiment. Forza Horizon 2, 3 and even 4 had outstanding soundtracks. I'll always keep coming back to Horizon XS but I found I could enjoy music from every station. 5 has slim pickings and I often find myself switching off the radio entirely.Unfortunately, the most significant point in all of this is the buggy state of the game. We've got it all here. Crashes to desktop, graphical glitches appearing as lines in the road, lack of detail in foliage, tearing on terrain, stuttering entering in and out of events, a horrible overexposed sky box which frequently takes away from the beauty of the game by overexposing brightness and blinding you. I know no game is perfect but visuals are a big part of Forza Horizon and all of these take away from what should be a mouthwateringly gorgeous game. Furthermore, if you care about being competitive there is literally no point trying to set any kind of time on any leaderboard because they're all been taken over by cheaters. It seems no matter how much this is reported to Playground Games, the issue still persists. This segues into my final point. The competitivity of Horizon feels like it's died with this franchise. In Forza Horizon 3 you could choose whatever kind or racing you liked, be that road, dirt, cross country, street. In Forza Horizon 4 this was inexplicably removed instead cycling between the 4 types at random with the dreaded "freeroam rush" mode which had you charging across the UK taking whichever route you liked to a destination. However, at least you still had a ranked system which allowed for more serious racing.This has now been removed.It seems that, instead of building upon the ranked system in place, or even implementing a system that prioritises clean racing above all, encouraging players not to shunt each other into walls, Playground Games sought it fit to just remove the system entirely. As a competitive player, there is now zero reason to play online, and even less of a reason to attempt to race properly when there are no consequences for driving badly. This, coupled with the fact that smaller features like launch control and gears grinding when you don't shift properly really makes me feel like they want this to be a purely casual game, whereas previous entries felt like there was something for everyone.Overall, I still love Forza Horizon 5 and this game is an easy recommendation, yet I can't shake the fact that this is the least exciting and least polished entry in the franchise and many decisions have been made that don't feel healthy for the franchise as a whole. Perhaps it's time I finally look toward a proper sim racer but I would still like Forza Horizon to flourish competitively.

author: ShadowTear
review: This is a good driving game. It's not a true sim, but it's not really an arcade game either. It's a game where you can be casual and take things at your own pace. The story does reference the earlier games, so if this is your first horizon game that may be a bit off putting. The difficulty of the AI is adjustable. You can also control the level of assists and type of transmission you drive with. Mexico is a great setting and the scenery is breathtaking. Photo mode allows you to take action shots or park for a glamour shoot. I do feel that the lack of Team Adventures from the last game is a bit of a miss opportunity.From what I aware of there is still an issue with memory leaks on the PC version of the game, so it needs to be restarted occasionally. DLC 1 is coming soon and from what we've seen looks to be Hot Wheels themed. So it's an exciting time to get in to the game.I personally have felt a little burned out with this game in the past, after doing almost everything that's available at this time. What brought me back to the game recently is painting and racing with my team. I do wish there were a bit more of the obscure vehicles in this game. Unlike FH4 this game is missing Abarth, Alpha Romeo, Fiat, Lancia, and a few other manufacturers. I assume this is due to licensing issues, hopefully those cars can be added later as things get hammered out.Overall I'm very pleased with this game and have even gifted a copy to a friend.
