author: Yankel my Wankel
review: Yet another AAA title that appears to have been done in 1 month with half their team. Like all they do is copy / paste the last game they copy / pasted, that was a copy / paste of the game before that but apparently everyone just ran out of f***s to give real quick.Beautiful new map in places, pretty bland and "FH1" feeling at times.The skys look neat with all their real sky photos with real sunrise and sunsets when you're not moving, but once you are it looks flat and fake so arguably a step backSounds are meaty, but everything just has rasp turned up to 11/10 once you modify it.Meaty shift sounds.Brainless banter over co-op races is about the only "original" thing to do.It runs well, even at 3440x1440 on high preset on a GTX 1060They got rid of the stupid championship races, that you had to do on every single event to fully complete them. Now you can do each one 1 time, get the win and completion. Rather than do it once for event completion, then do a championship off the same event and have to do 3 more races to get full completion.No one. Not a single soul so far in my ~100 hours, has ever gone into / competed in the Horizon Arcade stuff.It's quick to drop in / drop out if you want to play something for a little bit with no hassles.Lighting is real nice. The foliage looks a little PS2 at times, but when you crank the settings up for photos and such, it can look amazing.The playground games are good if you have friends to chat with at the same time. And IF the servers don't just freeze half the cars so invisible ghosts are going around.When I finally figured out the davinci code to make my T300 work. It was pretty fun to drive cars I like around with an H pattern. Even if they corner a bit too well at high speed. Ripping an E60 M5 or an SRT-10 Viper with a wheel and shifter was great.Your character talks in such a condescending way it makes the voice and cut scenes almost comical. Like they give as much of a f*** about what's going on as the devs did making it.It's actually hard to think of stuff now :|Felt like they had 1 month to make it with most the assets from the previous games.A number of cars just half-assedly done. Suspension at 0,0,0 under the cars, lights work on 1 side and not the other, gauges spin backwards, the Delorean was listed as a Citroen, brake calipers poking out through wheels, some wheels with borked vertices so it looks like you have vanta black boudica spiked wheels.Cars have no weight some times, so if you get hit you either get yeeted, or just slip past who ever hit you and they get yeeted. If you're real lucky the ghosting might kick in and save you.Somehow the usual clunky Forza driving dynamics feel even more clunky.You know how something like a popular FPS game is pretty fluid, CoD, CS GO, etc etc, but then you try Arma and it's so clunky like your character cant remember how to move. Thats the driving in this. At speed it's normal Forza, but mid speed their speed sensitive steering values take out what feels like 50% of your steering input so you can't make 90 degree turns without slowing way down, or cutting them. The cars are not close to understeering, they just don't turn. This might also be due to me being used to being able to steer in as much as I'd like from sims.Seemingly for most the cars, if you brake anywhere other than going straight you tend to go into a 4 wheel slide, which tend to have to slow down to stop. Once you break traction, it seems to want to keep sliding, and usually the rear end kicks out like some half implemented tap to drift mode. Being used to trail braking in sims, this to me feels real weird, so I'm trying to get used to that.Servers even after the "Fixes" are useless, constant disconnects, every minute or so everyone just disappears, traffic just disappears, some times you just get reset in place like you've hopped a server, losing speed and usually skill chainSame messy UI with unrelated pictures on the tiles, for what the tiles actually take you to.Pretty boring really, If you played FH1, it's the SAME game, which is the same as FH2, and FH3 and FH4. Copy Paste the base and give it a new map.The story seems to be following 1 family where every story mission is just helping them do some task while they usually just self doubt their decisions while you talk them up, like you're telling a child that even though they made a mess, it's easy to clean up to stop them from crying.Every time you unlock a new adventure thing, it stops you and takes you in to the damn menu so you either have to pick a new thing, or exit it.Everyone's always ghosted in free mode unless you're in a convoy, so you may as well just be in solo mode because there's virtually 0 interaction with 99% of people. Very, very rarely do you get people that hang around and drive with you, even drifters are like a 70/30 split to just ignore you and do their own thing now.I'd have refunded it just from the boring cliche intro if it hadn't been such a broken mess it put me over the 2hr refund limit and I had a couple friends to play it with once I got into online .. 2hrs of trash to even do the first 15 mins of the game ..Drivatars are cracked out more than the previously cracked out drivatars of previous games. FH4 it wasn't too difficult in my opinion to get wins on unbeatable so long as you didn't miss a braking point, or crash into a car. Now, expert difficulty is a 50/50 of either, you win by like 5+ seconds even if you crash, or 1 drivatar just hoons off 5+ seconds ahead of you for no reason while everyone else matches your speed.FFB with my T300 didn't work at all, except for the centering spring setting. I had to load the T300 preset, drive for a second, pull the power plug while "parked" in game, reconnect the power plug once the wheel finally disconnected, go in an re-load and re-bind my controls and then it worked.And shockingly, it's not too bad actually. Not great, but unlike whatever they set up for FH4 you can actually drive well with a wheel, and even on sim steering (Which iirc T10 said was completely broken in FH4) it's totally fine.Class racing is still broken. Don't build a logical "real world" A or B class, just build it to RWD or FWD, with the best speed, handling and acceleration stats you can. I built up and tuned probably 50 cars now for A and B, and my stock FD RX7 with a massive wing and basically no other mods is the one of the best cars I've come across. If you take a low class car and build it up with good mods, you seem to just end up with either a car with good speed but nothing else, or good handling and nothing else etc regardless of what it's stats say.Soften the rear to minimise everything rwd wanting to drift.If you're jaded with AAA games being dumpster fires, don't bother at full price, don't be sucked in by the same crappy "buy now to get this exclusive trash you wont even use anyway" cash grab sales. I downloaded the Witcher 3 while I played this and I'm way more keen to finally try that, than fire this up when everyone's offline.

author: Lazy
review: I Basically 99%ed Forza Horizon 4 and played a lot in its first year. Great game enjoyed it a lot. Congratulations to the dev team for bringing out this Game to great reception, but...Starting offPros:- more Horizon 4- overhauled physics(FH4 fans rocks are not deadly to a lifted truck anymore!)- a lot of polished and quality racing content- a lot of collectables - !!!!!!!not the boring UK anymore!!!!!!!Ehh:- Drivatars changed to be more aggressive. In higher difficulties they also have more grip at launch and in corners as well as more power. It def feels harder than FH4.- Gameplay pacing during first 10 hours bad imo. When you collect enough ill call it XP/ progress you get pulled out of what you are doing and have to choose what to do next. Its abrupt and annoying. Turning off speech doesnâ€™t stop them from talking to you. Takes you out of the flow state of mind when youâ€™re just driving races and blushing around in the beginning. disliked it a lot.Cons:- Story-- The story it has is in the way of gameplay and just annoying. low quality (sorry devs) story that take you out of what you are doing and basically force you to do it. not very "we want the players to have the freedom to do what they want in the game" - Rough Launch-- Stutters on high end systems-- Servers being servers on any online service at launch nowadays(your skill score/combo will most likely end when disconnected from the server, bc there is a chance your car resets in some way and you lose all momentum)-- Game locking up in upgrade menu- Multiplayer overhauled-- Removed comp queue / combined all the basic racing into one queue--- Canâ€™t queue for one race type.- Horizon Solo Drivatars(the AI bots that drive around) will annoy the hell out of you in solo sessions. They spawn in front of you and will most definitely ruin your skill chains.Probably going to add more to the review as I continue playing.Specs R5 5600x RX 6800XT 32GB 3200MHz Ram on Ultra now at a stable 144fpsEdit:Going to uninstall and wait for a month or two. Just had a Drivatar ruin my 400k X 10 score during skill song, don't feel like playing anymore â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ this game.

author: Leviaix
review: Forza Horizon 5 is a great game, but just expect not too many changes. The main things I noticed in this game vs. FH4 is graphics, cars, and mechanics; ill dive more deeply into each of these three things below, but to keep it short if you liked FH4 or even older titles; you'll like FH5 and see it as a direct improvement.Graphics:Mexico is beautiful, with a mix of great environments to the beautiful weather system the game looks very pretty and believable.Cars:While majority of the cars are old models from previous games; a lot of them have seemingly been redesigned whether through sounds or higher fidelity models, they look great and sound amazing! Also the physics of driving seems to have been redone and is much better and more accurate; especially RWD vehicles.P.S. I'm a big Mustang fan and im really sad that the 2020 GT 500 STILL has some inaccuracies with its model; the biggest one to me is the fact it's using the 2015-2017 Mustang tail lights when in reality it uses the 2018 - present tail lights, I know it may seem small, but it always bothers me. Another thing is the gauge cluster is incorrect as it doesn't have the Shelby speedo, instead it once again has a Mustang GT speedo. Again SUPER minor, but really annoying if you are like me and appreciate these cars like art.

author: EmmyPynk
review: This game has day one bugs, issues, and crashes 15 MONTHS later. And now, some of those problems are worse since the last update. Again. Once again, this game is broken. *Again*. 15 months of the game being in my possession, and it's still broken. 15 months. At this point, an indie dev team of 10 people could do better than this. If I was Microsoft, I'd be sending an exec down to PGG to see what the heck is going on, and anyone who even slightly failed to impress would be sent home immediately. Forza is one of Microsoft's staple series, and PGG clearly doesn't respect that anymore. Idk if PGG has suddenly just fallen out of love with this series or if they simply don't care in general about game dev and their community anymore, but it's got to be one of those two. Something is clearly catastrophically wrong with how PGG operates at this point. Between PGG pretending like the issues don't exist (ignoring their community completely in the process), and their honestly kind of impressive ability to break things further while supposedly trying to fix things over and over again, I have been more than patient over the past 15 months. But at this point, I have to stop giving PGG a benefit of a doubt, and they have to earn all of our trust back. PGG doesn't deserve this series, this community, or anymore time to come up with BS excuses. FH4 has been totally unplayable for months, and now this game has had it's 15 MONTH OLD broken problems that are now somehow even worse. It's pathetic. I hate leaving reviews like this. I hate coming across like a whiner, and I hate bashing on dev companies. But most devs have a good reason. They're a small team, budget issues, deadlines, something, anything. But PGG is out of excuses, and I'm done believing their lies at this point. We're over a year past release, and things are still as bad as day one. Now worse, since the last update. If you're team is too small, hire more people, you can more than afford it. Budget issues? BS, there's almost 30,000,000 players on this game, do the math. You have the budget. Deadlines? It's been 15 months. I doubt any deadline that's held up dev and polishing of this game held it up so much that we still have day one issues over a year later. No more excuses. At this point, this review is the final one. I keep updating it, back and forth back and forth. But at this point, no. Just, no. Y'all earned the negative review permanently. I'm not updating this one again. And I hope other's get on board with this. PGG needs to be a heck of a lot better, because unless they start getting their heads out of their backsides, shape up and act like somebody, then I won't be purchasing anything else in the future. I've been more than patient. WE ALL have been more than patient. We're done.

review: practically unplayable difficulty levelling is a joke cars are all the same class and speed cant never catch up makes no sense at all. connection drops every ten minuets or so makes it next to impossible to play the online part of the game. friends can never join the session and the obscene amount of hackers makes setting records not possible with people going through speed traps at 400+ mph untill some major fixes are put in this game id deffo stay away.

author: Justice
review: Game loads super fast, press play, Bronco off the plane, beautiful smooth graphics, no stuttering or apparent loading. Cutscene, land the C8 and drive into dust storm. Game closes to desktop without any error message or crash report. Rinse and repeat about 5 times. (closes/crashes before I can get through the intro so have to start over every time)Turned off Win10 game mode, everything set to run as admin, drivers up to date, disabled Win10 antivirus. Game again gives up at the exact same point.Thought maybe settings were too high despite the smoothness so ran benchmark mode to adjust settings automatically. Game closes to desktop during benchmark mode.Intel 10700K, 32gb ram, RX580, temps stay relatively cool.Update : So it appears I was missing 17 files from fresh install. Everything is perfect now, no crashes in over 4 hours of play! Hoonin' on.

author: D-Zasta
review: The game itself is very cool, graphics, car variety, car handling, the map is very good, BUT...It feels like the game is made from 2 guys in a garage, like in game dev tycoon. Its full of bugs and it crashes all the time. I don't know whether it comes from steam, because I had the previous versions of this game (FH3, FH4) on windows store and never experienced any problems like this. I play 20-30 minutes and the game just freezes. I go to the tuning shop and the game crashes completely to the desktop with 0 info about what went wrong and caused the game to crash. Nothing. I suggest you don't buy the game at this stage because you better play NFS Underground 2... I will change my review when this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is over. DISAPPOINTED

author: Eternal Wanderer
review: Looks absolutely pretty and plays great as always. Some people are complaining about how similar this game is to FH4 and how there are some issues.It is true that the launch was just slightly rocky with mostly connection problems -which still need to be ironed out- and that the experience is similar to what you get in FH4.There is no doubt that the issues will be ironed out in time. As for the experience, all I can say is that this is a refreshing reiteration of a proven formula. That's not something bad at all. I really don't get what people were looking for. This game gives you a large and entirely new landscape to roam to your heart's content with a lot of gameplay tweaks and eye candy. In my personal opinion, I got exactly what I was looking forward to. In fact, I would be immensely dissappointed if they had changed the formula more than necessary.In conclusion, it doesn't seem possible to me that someone who liked FH4 would dislike FH5. It's a product that delivered. My only complaint is about regional pricing, which could have used a bit of work. But that's in the past now. A whole lot of people are waiting for a huge sale, and I almost joined them. Just saying.

author: ZYLENXX
review: Setup used : AMD FX-8800 @ 2.9 GHZ max speed, 2.8GHZ min speed ingameNvidia GTX 750TI @ 2gb VRAM , MSA Afterburner Max boost Clock of 1337MHZ (Mem: 3.1GHZ (+0.4), Clock: 1.1GHZ (+0.173))Ram: 8gb DDR4Result at minimum graphics, shadows enabled and 60 fps cap:ACTUALLY PLAYABLE! Well - For the actual gameplay side of parts. The GPU and CPU are slower than minimum recommended spec, so of course alot of loading time increase. But it can be abused in races, giving you the ability to catch up and especially cheese drag races! All in all, this game can run on such a setup pretty decently so for all you low spec people out there - you may aswell give it a try? Its definetly worth the money anyways due to its HEAVY RANGE OF CARS. If youre a car guy? Heck yes. Go for it.On the performance side of things, the game actually doesnt put my pc to freezes at all, only an occasional softlock because im exceeding VRAM. Aside from that however, the loading times can stretch themselves up to multiple minutes if youre loading a polygon-heavy setup like racing in trucks. Ofc im running the whole thing at only 48% of min spec recommendation, ram excluded, but if that much can already play the game at 30-40FPS, at a minimum of 25 and a very very tiny amount of stutter (maybe twice per hour) , its done quite well. Only that i would love for it to load more onto ram than onto VRAM (because this game litterally only uses up to 2GB pure RAM; you couldve given it more storage on ram, for crying out loud.)But ey, i look forward to this one! Im gonna see how much they can patch up. On that note, this review will get updates.

author: Rob
review: Its just a buggy mess at the moment.I could probably rant for an hour here but if you want to deep dive into that game I don't recommend it right now. Probably wait 6 month or more... as we already know the dev's aint that fast in fixing issues.There were bugs in FH4 which wasn't fixed in 3 years - so give that game time.Except from that bugs it's a great game but FH4 had a bit more flair.No go's:Horizon Aracade or multiplayer in free roam - full bugged since start of the game.There are little challenges called accolades - do this, do that. 20% of them are bugged and when there will a fix for that... we don't know. FH4 flashbacks kicking in with "The magnate" which wasnt fixed over years.Competetive players have a hard time here. Leaderboards are full of hacked results.Also they removed the ranked online mode - which was optional in FH4... yea thanks for that.Btw dont you think they wanna purge those hacked leaderboard results - they didnt do that in FH4 so they won't do that here.04.12.2021 Update:- Today there was a big patch - fixed a ton of bugs and making Arcade finally playable but the free roam multiplayer is still bugged. You still see most of the players vanishing in front of you.- There are still bugged accolades - but at least they fixed/removed 90% of the faulty ones.- Convoy is still or even more bugged as before.- Removed goldstatus from Series 1 but 2 daylies wasnt possible to finish.Lets see what the future will show us. Right now i'd would recommend it neutral. If you are solo player and dont give a f* on others you can have your fun in it. If you wanna hang out with your friends in convoys and do some free roam cruising - nope.The fact that this patch was 2-3 weeks too late i don't wanna forget to mention.Edit 07.12.21The constant freezes/CTD getting more. so whatever they did in the background, they made it worse.Now I'm feeling back to FH4 Steam release where also the game was broken AF.Edit: 09.12.21Series 2 started. They messed up the points on Season1 so you can't achieve gold status.On of the Season Challenges to obtain an achievement is hard bugged again.Honestly i have never seen such a dev team like PG. They are not able to provide a solid game w/o bugs.Edit: 28.12.21Situation is better now, they fixed the online part but there are still major bugs. On that game you also focus on completing the Series/Seasons but there are still full bugged challenges which you cant finish. Still bugged  accolades and really bad/wrongly translations. Like the latest daily challenge "Destroy 25 bikes" was translated in german to "destroy 25 motorbikes" but the actuall challenge was destroy bycicles...Update 27.01.22What a surprice - no update/bug fixes till that current point. Still bugged accolades, still one of the worst enemy AI in a racing game. All they do is drip feeding useless cars which you can get via wheelspins.All the time you can see statements, PGG wanna change this and that and overhaul for the better but bla - maybe in 2-3 years you have a good game.Update 27.02.23Hackers are filled up on every single leaderboard which exists.They continue drip feeding the playerbase and forcing you to do unnecessary stuff on daily quests - like Eliminator, if you dont do that you are lacking points on the end of the Season and maybe dont get the reward.There are still no ranked matches... On FH4 its bugged and they couldnt fixed it and since that game is most likely a copy paste of code from FH4 we will probably never get the ranked matches.The new implemented stories are boring and Donut story is literally a joke - 2 quests out of 5 could be done in 30 seconds. Rest is around 1 1/2 min. Hotwheels DLC:The Storychapter is literally a blatant advertisement for Hotwheels, its just lacking a directlink to the Hotwheels shop so you can buy some.The world/track building is super boring - no skill requiredThe UI is a huge mess - you will get a y/x hud right in the middle of the screen and huge AF so you cant even see whats in front of you - sure you can turn it off but who came up with that design decission to have it active and right in your face?German translations are still a messy.. with wrong quests/challenges - well that DLC is out for a while and those aint fixed yet?Its just a sad - so much potential but devs have clearly no clue about that spaghetti code and how to fix stuff or improve it.Ive heard they had big menu lagging which took 2 month to fix.You can fool the press agency which only scatch on the surface but as soon as you dig a little deeper you will see the mess and wrong design decissions.

author: itsdevdom
review: Without a doubt, Forza Horizon 5 is the single best arcade racing game out there right now!The scenery - this time around Mexico - is huge and beautiful, various biomes like beaches, mountains and jungles can be explored. The is a day-night cycle plus dynamic weather effects, creating an incredible atmosphere - the stormy jungle simply looks insane! Music selection is (as always) top notch, earworms incoming. Of course there's tons of stuff to, like the many many races of different types (like road, dirt, cross country, ...), story missions, stunts, collectables, multiplayer, daily & weekly challenges - and the literally hundreds of cars to collect, tune, and paint. The progression system is heavily focused on what I would describe as "fun and chill", meaning you will earn lots of money, XP and cars early on and along the way - a different type of grind that, interestingly, works very well!Things I'd like to see improved is better anti aliasing options, and an improved / extended multiplayer experience. Rarely smaller bugs still occur (e.g. a glitched weekly challenge or a random crash), but overall both game stability and game quality have been improved a lot since release.Edit: In a move I did not expect, they have added TAA as an anti aliasing option, and ray-tracing that can be used across the whole game. Yay!

author: heems
review: I am a fan of the Forza series (been playing since Forza Motorsport 3). FH4 is probably one of my favorite games ever, so it really pains me to write this review. Sometimes I feel like I'm not playing the same game as others.  While I notice not everyone is dealing with issues, there is no excuse for the game to be released in its current form to others. Horrific textures, major pop-in, connection problems, the whole gambit.  The cars look incredible but everything that surrounds them just look like they could be found in an XB360 release. As someone who bought the premium edition of this game, I am and remain disappointed to say the least. Those who played Cyberpunk on release will get major PTSD. I have faith that PG Games will fix this but unfortunately I would wait to roll the dice on this game until after some patching. (2060, Ryzen 9, 16gb)

author: Edvo
review: -- Kinda boring now, but got 120+ hours out of it so, not a problem --The game doesn't disappoint necessarily, lots of cool cars to collect, but its just kinda dull man. And it isn't just a "you've played the game too much" issue, It's been like that from the start. No meaningful story, progression or difficulty.Multiplayer is still annoying with the load times, but can still provide some enjoyment. The playlist and objectives feel meaningless, I get the cool "new" car or whatever and I never touch it again, the story was so forgettable, I even put off completing it for quite a while. There is no actual difficulty its just like Pokemon Go but for racing. I'd still recommend the game though its not terrible, it can be really fun if you need some hours to burn.

Have to also say the racing feels better with controller than with keyboard.

The open world feels a lot better designed this time around and I'm overall just having a blast doing my own thing which is what the FH series does best. It didn't have a good launch, but this game has caught up in the corners and is one of my favorite games this year!

review: The AI is crap. Every race is the same - start 9th on grid, pass cars that are way slower, then try to catch the leader who is inexplicably quick (and obviously cheats). Do this 200 times. There, that's your singleplayer experience.Game is unstable, has a memory leak on PC, the online is non-functional at this stage. Travesty of a release, literally just keep playing because there is no other game with the cars i like. That's it. It's a lack of competition, not because this ones actually good.

author: obie
review: I don't know why you would play this game over Horizon 4. The only major change is the map, which is a massive downgrade over the previous release due to being so empty and desolate. I'm going to continue playing 4 like this game doesn't exist.

author: Gordon P. Howitzer
review: I don't have a simulator set-up, so this is kinda the only option I have for racing games that tickle my itch for driving a vast array of autos.  I've put a lot of hours into this game because I love cars and the environment is gorgeous.  Aside from that, the game is truly garbage.  The way racing is organized is you start from the back and you have to work your way up every race.  The online experience is 10 x's worse than a bi-hourly colonoscopy, at minimum, and sometimes is like getting your glans impaled by a cactus.  The monthly/weekly challenges are tiresome and repetitive and likely only exist to keep you addicted for FOMO on new cars, which aren't new anyway.  I'd like to go into more detail, but I am tired of thinking about this game.  Save the money, go outside, learn to knit or go for a bike ride, I promise you it will be more rewarding than anything this game has to offer.  Just read a book, or throw 50-60 dollars in the toilet and if you squint at the correct angle, you might even have a psychedelic experience and unlock some secrets of existence.

Map is better than I anticipated. All of these positives lay under the pile of bugs that seem to make up the majority of this game. Triple A games at their finest.

author: Colonel Rob
review: Unfortunately at this time I've got to say Forza Horizon 5 has absolutely god-awful steering wheel support and they haven't made any efforts to improve on it at all. The game is good on keyboard and mouse or on a controller, but if you plan to play on a steering wheel then know that the cars will under-steer and over-steer wildly in comparison to other inputs, the force feedback is overwhelming in almost every case, even when tuning it down, it's just grossly exaggerated and totally unrealistic, and will literally attempt to yank the steering wheel out of your hands and attempt to veer you off in a sideways direction even when driving in a straight line, to the point that most players that want an even semi-positive experience have completely turned off force feedback and vibration. And if you want to drift, absolutely forget about it. You cannot hold drift lines like you can in any other game with halfway decent wheel support, the car always oversteers and pulls itself out of the line you're driving no matter what you do, and will quite often spin out entirely on it's own. If you dramatically change every single setting to their extreme settings, you can almost get a passable (as in graded as a D-) drifting experience, but it's still horrible, and then doing any other kind of driving at all is completely undoable without reverting those settings entirely. Until they do a massive rework on their steering wheel input and fix the automatic oversteering that the game ai does on it's own when a wheel is being used, I'll have to advise people to hard pass on this, unless you only plan to play on a keyboard and mouse or a controller, at which point it'll just be an average game like any of the other dozens of racing games that are out at the moment that also do not have steering wheel support.

author: Neros
review: Cutscene simulator!Never seen a game to intrerupt me this much from playing. So much pointless cheesy chat between characters that add no value to the game. And of course theres no way to skip that.Progression is also very weird, starting the game with some supercars and getting more and more cars for no reason at all.

author: IWolfHeit
review: If this game were a sandwich recipe I would be buying a lot of bread.This game takes everything good about the previous Horizon games, and makes them better. 40 Hours in and I still am not bored, even Minecraft I can't bring myself to grind that long over.The only bad part is this game won't see it's full potential until every GPU Scalper is convicted of treason and sentenced to 20 years hard labor in the mines.Pros: Looks amazing (if you have the hardware)Physics Improvement over the last Horizon, I don't feel like I'm driving on Ice 24/7.Better tire smoke, cause the little things count.Story is entertainingMap is massiveCar go fastThere is a large selection of cars Tuning is very detailed.Cons:Re-used assets from Horizon 4 existVery demandingStory is a bit shortSpeedhackers galoreWhen I'm playing I could probably turn off my heat and let my PC keep the room warm.All in all, the game is very fun, worth base price, don't buy the ultimate edition. Unless you nitrogen cool your PC this game will probably make your PC contribute to global warming. Very fun game. Would rate 8/10.

review: Its basically impossible to play with other friends. You need a xbox account. It only 'somehwat' works with steam. Its nearly impossible to start a convoi and 'just play' with each other. author: w_wooden
review: Forza 4 is still my favorite Forza game, but for many Forza Horizon 5 is better hands down. I think for me it did have the better graphics and scenery out of the two, but the driving physics were better with 4 (in my opinion), however the real reason 5 didn't make the top choice for me was the sheer number of cheaters in Eliminator. They are allowed to blatantly cheat, (cars appear out of nowhere, disappear as a level 1 bug, then reappear a second later as a level 9 to challenge you, hyperspeed to the point where they had to start turning the speed down because when they would go over a hill they would fly through the air for miles at a time and we all thought they had flying cars! LOL, ability to make a level 2 car go 200+ MPH beating all the level 10 cars you may have struggled to get legit, etc.) If any developer or mod ever played they would see what is happennig because it happens every single game.  The cheaters usually go down to a hidden area of the map and turn off challenge (you can't challenge them till they turn it back on) mode and just drive in cirles. (I've seen up to ten cars doing this at once). Oh, and don't get me started on the hall of fame records, where you might jump 1 or 2 thousand feet and think you did good, only to see you needed to jump across the map to place. LOLThat aside this game could easily have been in the running for one of the best games of all time, so sadly you will still enjoy other aspects of the game, you'll just have to live with it being an incomplete game due to cheaters/script kiddies using wemod, or tables to cheat. If  you are into cars (I am) this game (like the others) has an absolute stunning number of beautifully detailed cars, super cars, hyper cars, rally cars, muscle cars, and on, and on. The graphics on them is about as perfect as I've seen on any game and to be honest it's getting hard to determine if you're looking at a video game vehice, or one in real life.This game is in my top ten favorites of all time still, but it makes me mad because I know it could easily be top 3, or perhaps even #1I will most likely keep picking up future releases in the hopes that they start to ban cheaters (permanently losing your Steam account would make them think twice! LOLIt says I've played it 60+ hours the last two weeks, and over 628 hours total so I know what I'm talking about.See you on the track! Say hello, and keep an eye out for those barn gifts because I'm sure one of them will be from me. I try to gift out cars (even 20 million dollar epic ones) to new users, and have probably given away more cars than I own! :) Cheers and have fun!!!

author: OverlyRedundant
review: tl;dr solo play is fine, playing with friends is terrible After sinking many hours into FH3 and FH4, I was excited for all the new things in FH5. Iâ€™ll say the core gameplay experience is great, much the same as the previous titles, but only if youâ€™re playing solo.Trying to play the game with friends is a nightmare. There were similar issues  in FH4, and I was hoping the latest installment (especially a year after release) would have resolved them. Unfortunately thatâ€™s not the case. Hereâ€™s the short version:1. You go to invite someone to your convoy, this kicks off a pop up from the Xbox app to pick friends to invite2. Friend doesnâ€™t receive any in-game notification of an invite. They must alt-tab and open the Xbox app to see/accept it3. Youâ€™re now in a convoy, but youâ€™re not in the same online instance. I guess start a race to join up with your friend?4. You do a race together, race finishes, maybe youâ€™re in the same instance,  maybe youâ€™re still in a convoy, itâ€™s a dice roll5. The Xbox app (installed via Microsoft store) also requires two separate apps to be installed in order to function6. At some arbitrary point, neither person receives invites from the other person. One person restarting the game seems to fix it.7. If at any point something goes wrong, you get to go through the entire convoluted process of trying to group up againAll of the above, coupled with the 3-5 minutes of staring at your car from 1 million different angles before you can even start racing with a friend.But Iâ€™m sure glad thereâ€™s all the Hot Wheels things in the game. Canâ€™t wait for Lego to make a reappearance. Oh and I canâ€™t forget the blessing that is the character creator. The third option in I get to choose prosthetics for my character. And the next page I can choose a hearing aid. Oh and I can choose my pronouns?! Amazing. Iâ€™m so glad a racing game has these options! I can stare at my Hot Wheels prosthetic-armed, hearing aid equipped, gender inclusive human for 5 minutes before every race and feel fuzzy inside.For such big developers and being backed by Microsoft, along with previous titles being largely the same thing, one would think that playing with friends would be a straightforward and functioning process. Alas, I guess Iâ€™ll be waiting for FH6. Refunded after 5 hours of â€œplaytimeâ€

author: Aerodil
review: Recommended only if you don't already have Forza Horizon 4.If you do or if you think about buying FH4, don't get this one.I don't know if it's the UK map that somehow feels more atmospheric and cosy, the missions and the crazy stunts that seemed more exciting or selection of cars that seemed to be more varied, but FH4 just feels better than this.I kinda liked the FH4's story as well. This one though, the characters are so annoying and never shut up that I kinda hate all of them, especially the technician guy. And yes, I know this isn't a narrative driven game but come on! This is one of the worst dialogues I've ever had the displeasure of sitting through in a game.The game is by no means bad. If this is going to be your first foray into the Forza Horizon series I say go for it. But just know that FH4 is outright better.And for those who think going back to an older game might mean sacrificing the new and improved graphics of this one; you don't need to worry. The game looks practically the same since FH3.

author: Mall Ninja
review: Pros:Great selection of 600+ cars of all makes and shapes. Upgradeable, paintable, tunable.Driving feels really good, even offroad. Arcade well done.Large map, many biomes (city, desert, mountain, beach, jungle, hilly plain).HotWheels expansion - incredibly fun and packs a lot of content.Cons:Becomes completely pointless after a while. The game bombards you with prizes and free stuff in the beginning, to hook you - then you enter the normal game loop of mindless grinding and auction sniping to get expensive or hard to find cars. Out of my 100+ hours, about first 40% was OK, then grinding and gifting and auctioning and wheelspinning to complete my collection, Still didn't, but i don't really care anymore.Basically, after a while you end up with a large car collection and nothing to do with them.Not recommended.

author: Kimiko
review: Everything about this game is gorgeous. We've really perfected the art of realistic cars. Lighting and weather effects are majorly impressive.But the game is only just fun enough to keep you invested. The singleplayer story events range from boringly easy to annoying rather than properly difficult The returning British cast of Horizon 4 are all ear-grating - it has nothing to do with the accents, the way their dialogue is written is gag-worthy. There is no real progression. Most races are just too easy. The only real overarching story that isn't one of the self-contained episode event sets is over within two hours. The game throws cars at you endlessly that I can't find myself caring about any of them aside from the ones that I know are competitive in the multiplayer. There's so many cars and so many different versions of cars, but none of them have any real identity or customization, and so they all merge together into relentlessly given-out car vomit.The seasonal content updates that happen every four weeks are largely copy-pasted content from the older games that was for some reason missing from the game's launch. Most of the events in these updates are just versions of existing races in the game, with the majority of new maps and races being community-sourced (and seldom focused on).Forza Horizon 5 tries its best to be the most approachable racing game for regular people, and in doing so just ends up being boring. I enjoy and play some sim racers, but aside from the new Need for Speed, there aren't many purely arcade racers being made anymore. I am tired.

author: sergeyjkuehn
review: Originally bought FH5 because my 10 year old son wanted it. He played it for a while he convinced me to give it a try after learning that my real life daily drive was in the game (Fiesta ST). Since then, I've totally fallen in love with the game. We currently have 227 hours and I (dad) probably have more of those than he does. It's been a great father/son bonding activity. Part of what keeps it fun is that the developers are continually adding fresh new content to keep the game from getting dull. There's always something new to do. Possibly best of all, as an open world you can play the game any way you'd like. Like street races in supercars? Like off roading on ATVs? Like painting cars and designing custom looks? Just want to chill and go for a casual drive cross country? Like the challenge of PvP or prefer to keep it strictly offline with AI? It's totally up to you. The only critiques I have are minor and are likely the result of it being a console port. We live in an era where things are regularly released with game-breaking bugs in the knowledge that the public will pay the developer to do their beta testing for them. If interface annoyances are the worst thing to complain about in a title, that's probably a good thing!The FH5 user interface and keyboard shortcuts are all over the place and make zero sense. Some menus you have to randomly hit some special key to continue and no mouse click will do it. One time it might be "push 7 to confirm" then another time it's the enter key or the space bar. Sometimes you can mouse click the confirmation, other times not. There's no consistency. To start the game you have to tell it 3 separate times that you're really sure you want to play the game. First, run it in steam. Once that loads you get a splash screen where you tell it yeah I really want to start now. Then it does more loading until yet another splash where you have to hit continue for it to finish loading into the actual game. I've customized the buttons on our steering wheel. I have to go into settings and manually change it from default Logitech binding group to my "custom 1" binding group EVERY SINGLE GAME. All of these are minor annoyances that you get used to eventually. I'm 44 now and have enjoyed PC gaming since the Commodore 64. I have fond memories of Half-Life coming out as a new game. Now my sons are both in love with Black Mesa and reliving a game franchise I enjoyed long before they were born. Point is, I've been around a while and played a lot of PC games.That said, I'd put Forza Horizon 5 is the top 5 games I've ever played.  Highly recommended for any gamer from casual to hardcore.

author: Beast
review: Fun game with lots of cars, trucks and other oddities. Where to start? Tried 4 and loved it, 5 has been great so far... Find myself wandering and doing other stuff than racing, the landscapes are beautiful. The racing and side events are fun but I always end up wandering off as there is too much to do. Detail to attention is game is awesome, own several vehicles in real life that are featured in game, 55 chevy, a few vw bugs, and 1970 chevy truck (1970 GMC Jimmy in game) funny how the steering wheels are the same and rims right down to the details. People did their homework on the vehicles and it shows. Spending many hours just playing, customizing, and taking it all in. If you enjoy more than just racing you'll love this game, but it will sate racers as well. I'd love to see more classics in game, Just can't get enough.

author: AntOnDrugs
review: FH5 is amazing but there are some issues I have with it. The leader boards for races have so many cheated times on them, which as of right now, still haven't been removed. Personally I don't like how I can't choose what type of race I want to do, and it's somewhat annoying when the game makes me race a certain type of car with a very specific class that 90% of the time I don't have a car tuned for.  At the very least I'd like to be able to choose either the class and/or type of car I want to race in(although I assume it'd be a nightmare to have the community to be so segregated but oh well). Other than these few things I've encountered, the game as an absolute banger.

author: blucorsa
review: A fantastic continuation of the Horizon series, finally moving on from the dreary weather and mood of Britain to the warm and lush settings of Mexico. My only complaints thus far are that you still cannot alter downforce/lift on a majority of cars without installing that super ugly Forza Aero, and that the game physics still won't you properly rock climb, even if your car has enormous knobby tires and 15 inches of lift. What I've enjoyed most about FH5 so far is that it seems like you can leave a car in RWD and not feel like you're making a major sacrifice in terms of grip/overall handling. This may be different once I decide to finally tune an S2 or X-class car in RWD, but at least for S1 and below, RWD is finally a viable option, it feels much more forgiving to use.

author: Hans
review: Updating my review because of the recent changes made to the game. Developers seem to making the game worst and worst every update. I am not sure where there priorities are but it's becoming evident that they care less about making the game good. I may only play the game every once a while now because I enjoy driving in the country side , but the seasonal changes I couldn't be bothered. Especially PGG, that is unbearable. Rewards are not worth the effort and wheel spins were changed to have lesser credit options which is a spit in the face. Series challenges are basically the same every week, so new content is extremely thin and spread out. Game performance has been getting slightly worst, which makes no sense. Players still disappear online for no reason. And the trials are frustrating as ever. Sigh...I hope the game does get better in the future but at this rate, it really does seem like they don't care.

author: the snuuy
review: My most anticipated game of the year after being disappointed with FH4 and getting burned out and frustrated by The Crew 2 for the last couple of years and... it mostly lives up to the hype.I've got a lot to say about the game, so let's start with the positives. + The campaign is much more engaging than the previous game; the Accolade system lets you progress at your own pace but also incentivizes winning races and 3-starring PR stunts and Horizon Stories while the previous one was more "just do the race and we'll mark it as complete no matter where you place".+ Mexico is easily one of the best maps in the entire series, possibly on par with Colorado from FH1. Plenty of different map locations such as mountains, canyons, deserts, jungles, beachside towns and the colorful city of Guanajuato. Mexico also has a shocking amount of verticality, especially in La Gran Caldera volcano and the canyons.+ Car sounds easily blow FH4 out of the water. The previous game sounded like absolute trash, this one is a major step up and I'd argue it's honestly THE best sounding game on the market right now. Performance customization actually affects sounds too which is neat; mainly intake, exhaust, camshafts. forced induction and transmission upgrades.The game isn't without its flaws however, some particularly egregious and detracts from the experience though.- Playground removed significantly more cars than they added in-between FH4 and FH5. Over 200 cars from FH4 didn't make the cut, especially notable with brands such as Aston Martin, Lotus, Maserati and Vauxhall, whose lineup took a huge hit. It's likely they'll be re-added through the Festival Playlist over time, but that's another problem in and of itself since that system is reliant on one of my personal gaming pet-peeves, timegated content, especially if it's old content repackaged as DLC.- Playground seems to have doubled down on the criticism about Wheelspins ruining progression; while it's nice that they're less clogged up with cosmetics, cash payouts are much higher and cars are more frequent. This is more of a plus for casual or Game Pass players, but for hardcore racing game veterans, this could be seen as more of a negative for people who wanted more traditional progression.- Online is AWFUL. Players constantly disappearing from each other's instances in the map breaks Convoys with friends and makes Horizon Arcade almost impossible to complete. Eliminator is still buggy too, sometimes when I try to challenge other drivers on the map, it doesn't actually work.- Shaky optimization on PC. I'm running a GTX 1650 and Ryzen 7 4800H and while the game runs fine at 60FPS on High settings, the performance consistently begins to dip 90-120 minutes into a single play session. Definitely a memory leak, in a similar vein to FH3 and FM7's shoddy PC ports at launch.While this is easily the best arcade racer on the market right now, there's a lot of technical things that need to be fixed, such as the optimization and some online features. Hopefully these get addressed sooner or later, but either way, I'm going to be spending a lot more time with FH5. It's  too much fun for its own good.

author: Barakel
review: Very buggy, barely compatible with my hardware, sometimes unplayable unless I restart my computer before launching. Gotta restart the game every 2 hours because it memory leaks so badly. That aside, I dislike all of the differences between this and FH4. Many the cars I wanted to drive are gone, including the first three I tried to buy (AMC Javelin, Subaru Legacy, then the Mitsubishi Galant... Every Lancia is even gone...) I hate the new map. Every road is way too wide and simple, and the problem is made even worse by the fact that all cars are much grippier now. I never feel like my driving skills are being challenged at all. It's so easy to stay on the road and follow along that my car's build feels like the only thing that determines how well I do in a race. Most of the game is pretty boring. Online modes are enraging. There's still no penalty system for griefing, co-op/team modes still match me with people who didn't spend 1 minute to prepare a car as fast as the event's restrictions, and loading times are half as long as action time. 4/10. I'm only playing this because there's such a massive lack of any playable non-sim racing game.

author: Criffix
review: This is my first Forza game and I'm really happy with it.They are asking for a pretty high price imo, but if you are into these kind of games then it's worth it.Bugs are there but kept to a minimum. It's at an acceptable rate for a launch and there are no gamebreaking bugs as far as I can tell.The game runs fine but could use some optimization. It struggles with difficult scenes, for example driving through a city in the rain at night. Otherwise the game looks great.The game offers over 500 cars and they feel decent to drive. It still has an arcady driving style and doesn't always feel "real" when you play with a steering wheel but that's totally OK in this game.

author: SlappedByAFish
review: I'd stay away from these Devs and their sad excuse for a game. The only thing that's nice about Forza 5 is the driving and I'd say it only feels nice since I'm use a Steering Wheel. Everything else about it has been and will continue to be dog s**t. Best part is since their brilliant Donut Update, I've been unable to launch the game. I've tried everything to fix it other than resetting my OS completely. A week of radio silence, no help from the Devs and self troubleshooting later... I'm still sitting in the same boat as others waiting to play and unable to launch. These people are so bad at being Devs, they make the Iron Gate Devs from Valheim look presentable... and that's a low I didn't think possible. "-$80 EZ Clap, GG kid. No refunds." - Playground Games/Microsoft. Thanks :)Edit: As of 1/09/23, I said f**k it and nuked my P.C. back to the Stone Age and now Forza works again. So far after replaying for a couple of hours I've had no issues. Still leaving the thumbs down though because1. Still the only thing nice about this game is driving around and the paint designs.2. I still had to do a complete nuke of my P.C. just to get the game to run again, even though everything else was working with no issue on it.3. After getting it working again and signing in, all my progress in game was sent back to the Stone Age as well. All 60+ hours I put into the game before the cursed Donut update, gone...At least it's running again I guess, however it feels very bittersweet. Shame. :/

Congratulations!'Still, this is one of the best racing games out there

author: Auruchius
review: As big of a fan I am of racing games, the Horizon franchise has always been somewhat of a mixed bag for me. I loved 1-3, but playing 4 and especially 5, I feel like Horizon 5 is essentially an expansion DLC for Horizon 4. Essentially the same game at its core with a new coat of paint like the new map. Beautiful looking game, plays well and the mechanics are incredibly refined. What bothers me is how soulless the game feels. Has no sense of linear progression and because it's so non-linear, I feel like this is the game's ultimate detriment. There's quite literally nothing left to do after a week's worth of grinding. The seasons are repetitive with piss poor rewards and recycling content from prior titles and monetizing it as car pass DLC (which is pretty egregious). Addressing the elephant in the room, the glitches, crashes, and optimization issues I've encountered are so frequent that I simply refuse to launch it out of pure frustration. I still cannot launch the game properly without it crashing me on at least 7 or 8 times before it finally loads up. To add insult to injury, the online play has been atrocious with constant disconnects, and I've spent an unhealthy amount of time just trying to create a damn convoy. It's also quite incredible to me how we're 3 months into its life cycle and there still is no custom playlist feature for Horizon Open where we can filter through what class restricted races the player can match make into to. I'm tired of seeing basic feature sets like this being added as "content" to a live service game and this is sadly another title down the depressing pipeline of triple A "live service" gaming. I really wanted to like this game and after 130 or so hours, I simply cannot recommend it in its current state over derivative gameplay, a severe drought in meaningful content, the crashes, glitches, bugs, and poor multiplayer experience that still plague this game, and the fact that it just feels lifeless as a Forza Horizon 4.5 DLC. Despite all this, I'd consider getting the game a few months from now if it does get any meaningful DLC expansions, fixes, and feature sets that should've been in the game day 1 (can't believe I have to say that in 2022) down the line in future patches that make it worth your while, but for now, hard pass.

author: 'vermillion
review: As so often with launches somewhat close to the holiday season, this seems rushed or the PC version was nevery properly tested.People report immediate crashes, bad performance, or like in my case: Good performance after launching, terrible stuttering and framerate issues after 2-3 hours. Restarting the game repeats the cycle. A solution which actually works for me and a lot of others according to the steam forum, is using Nvidia Studio drivers instead of the gaming drivers. You can find these in GeForce Experience under drivers -> 3 dots in the top right.Anyway, something is wrong, and I fear that a lot of "Professional" reviewers, who were all given the XBOX version, will only quickly gloss over the PC version without proper testing.As it is right now, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone since it's a AAA full price game that is full of bugs and gamebreaking performance related issues.Since it's overall still a great game underneith all that, I would recommend the XBOX version since it's supposed to run extremely well, or wait for the PC version to get patched, which hopefully will happen relatively quickly. Check out the discussion pages on steam to check about the current situation.EDIT: With the latest update there's even more crashes, still virtually no traffic and barely any other players. The game is in a terrible state technically and the world is super empty. PG What are you doing?

author: Volovagos
review: Story is near non existent save for the Meme Vocho "story". Track design is at times very annoying. Meta cars are far too dominant, not just a bit better than the rest, they are able to pull half track leads on a 3 lap race. The social system is beyond broken, its nearly impossible to make a stable convoy, most of the time you wont be able to see your friends in the convoy if you can even get into a convoy. As many other reviews say, cheaters are everywhere, the devs dont care. The grind in this game is horrible, and the devs instead of punishing exploiters prefer to drag down the entire playerbase by reducing wheelspin rewards, making race rewards tiny, and just generally throwing busywork content into the game to keep you occupied for a bit until youve gotten bored and realize you cant refund this unfinished game. Wait until 2024 to buy this. PGG sold an unfinished game and expected the buyers to do all the testing for them.Edit 1: Played an additional 70 hours. Very little has improved since release. Servers are still ran on circuits printed on a cucumber. Online experience is still terrible, and somehow the new content coming out is getting worse.

author: Ash
review: I really enjoyed forza horizon 4 the setting was perfect and the seasons made sense. The world was fun to explore and the graphics were stunning. Forza horizon 5 just didn't have the same appeal to me. The world is feels empty and I don't like the broken english spoken by the characters in the game. The weather is just kind of pointless also, dust storm, thunder storm and and another dust storm. It gets kind of boring and I think Mexico was a poor choice of locations for a Forza game.The cars are basically the same as Forza 4 its a quick copy and paste job so most of the effort should have been around the world building. I can't see myself completing this game as my way of playing the game isn't about car collecting but instead just exploring the world and doing the races and I have no interest in doing either of these in forza 5. I tend to find a car I like and just stick to that one unless I have to change based on race requirements.I hope for the next instalment they will choose a better country for the game to be set in where actual seasons can make a return with weather that is more realistic rather than dust storms every 10 minutes.Finland would be an interesting place to drive around or maybe even Sweden, Iceland or Norway.Also it would be great if you could have an avatar that doesn't look like a 9 year old boy.Anyway I don't recommend this game, if you don't own a forza game yet just get number 4 its a lot better.

author: HyperionX
review: I am a 44 year old biker and trucker. After the divorce I found myself often lost, i was completely left alone with my thoughts. One day my 15 year old son: "Brian", approached me to show me a video on his phone. It left me completly flabberghasted by how "scary" it seemed. When my son left i couldn't think of anything else for the rest of the two weeks before i saw him again. When he came back he asked him again about it. He told me it was a funny little video"game". When he left again i decided: "heck it." I will buy it. I booted up my pc and started playing.Wow... I found myself wondering around the island, i chopped downtrees, killed road signs , and enjoyed the beautiful sunsets. The story of finding sexy robot twins really connected with me. After the divorce I also had to find my son again. Every two weeks when Brian came over i told him about the funny little adventures. The closer i was to finding sexy robots, the closer i was to finding Brian...I will not spoil any of this amazing story, but wow, just wow... The ending left me in tears, i couldnt sleep for days... Still, whenever i am going to work or biking i am always just thinking about this beautiful masterpiece named "Forza Horizon 5." (A fitting name i might add since it has horizons)If it wasnt clear already, Yes! I advice anyone with a "brain" to buy this masterpiece. This, This is not a game my "friend" this, this is an experience of a lifetime...

review: forza horizon 5 has one of the best feeling driving mechanics ive ever played its genuinely do fun and the tuning system is great you can seriously just take any car you want and have fun making everything thats not supposed to, drift or rally. but even with that i just cant recommend the game its just not as fun, the rewards are genuinely bad you barely get any super spins and when you do you will not get anything worthwhile and challenge rewards just suck, the tracks are okay its definitely way better than fh4 where """"rally"""" tracks were 90% asphalt, the cars are also meh its better than fh4's where most of the cars felt the exact same but you still have and abundance of samey cars and most are just cars from older forza games its nothing new. the player made stuff is honestly the most attractive part of the game there are seriously amazing tracks in this and pulling them off is a great feeling, overall tho dont buy. i would recommend playing tokyo xtreme racer drift 2 its miles more fun.

author: scoob
review: the happies- very customizable, custom liveries and verious aero parts- very pretty game- very pretty and very detailed cars- cars feel nice to drive- it's more arcade-y than other car sims, which is nice since it feels much easier to just pick up and play.- many cars- REAL CARS- making money isn't that much of an issue-  driving feels good!!the sads- the multiplayer sucks, you feel so isolated when there's no chat, you can't see where people are, everyone else are ghosts and because they're ghosts everyone has grown a habit of just ignoring other people since you can barely interact with people other than using the honestly bad "chat" system (that NOBODY really uses.) or honking your horn.- and although customization is good, its sometimes a COMPLETE gamble. sometimes your chosen car has dozens of spoilers, skirts, hoods, bumpers, and even whole bodykits, all the while some cars get no love, and don't have anything, which is a total bummer if your favourite car isn't a popular car- sure the map is nice.. but after 62 hours im getting pretty tired of driving in either a barren wasteland or the rainforests which go by so fast i barely notice.-WHERE ARE THE CITIES?!?!?!?! sure there's one big town which i'd barely want to call big. basically if you want some good and varied urban racing this um.. may not be it for you

author: nddiesel
review: FIX THE STEERING!!! I have a PC and have played a lot of racing games with my Logitech g29 and I cannot get the settings right. I have seen so many tutorials and changed my settings so often that I am losing my mind. Off road is almost uncontrollable. I get death wobbles pretty much every time I drive. I want to play but it's unplayable. Also the PC integration is horrible. Having to figure out what buttons are what... my god. Story is bad and the people are annoying it just feels like lazy writing. If they can fix the steering I can get past it. I was hoping to have fun in this game but I just end up quitting out of frustration. The worst racing game I've paid for.

author: Nytris The Raptor
review: It's just Horizon 4 with a different map, more badly ported cars and less meaningful content.Pros: looks pretty (when the graphics arent bugging)Good cool map, even if southern america/tropical regions are highly overdone in open worlds as of lateCons: graphics like to bug out a lot on my 1660ti even though the graphics are identical to horizon, should run fine on my pc but doesnt"more customization" was a lie, only a handful of cars the devs decided to use as flagship cars got more customizationalmost the entire car list are just ports from old forzas, literally nothing about them changedsound design isnt great, some cars sound good, most sound bad. The old 370z doesnt sound like a VQ should, and the new 370z nismo (which you have to pay for btw) sounds even less like a VQthe story and characters are absolutely soulless, like the devs knew nobody over the age of 5 would care, and it doesnt have to be that waybesides drivatars being even more broken, the rest of the game is very afraid to challenge the player. Nighttime looks like daytime with stars and a blue tint, all of the events are EXTREMELY easy to beatshort version is, the game looks good and the map is good but that all gets boring after around 12 hours of gameplay, the content the game actually has to offer isnt enticing past being ways to make more money.

author: JUDGE Panther
review: Your Gamepass save wont work with the Steam Version of the game.I was unaware of this when u purchased the game, but apparently if you, like me, have a save using the Xbox Gamepass, you'd be surprised you save didn't came in this version, even when the game force you to login the Microsoft Store, so beware if you dont want to spend a lot of time and effort searching saves and exchanging files as a workaround in a confusing way because Microsoft don't make it easy, you might lose your save altogether while using the Steam Version.If you have a Gamepass save, and want to startover, this Steam version will suffice.In my opinion the game and your time are not cheap, so it would make me return the game if i had not found a way to import the saves.Cheers.

author: Thundercleese
review: It's literally Forza Horizon 4, with slightly better graphics, a different location, probably more cars, and a new stat: Off-Road.It's not a bad thing, just don't go into this expecting a ground-up sequel that takes everything from the previous game and enhances it by 10.That being said, it's still fun.

author: goge
review: I bought this game just a few weeks ago because it was discounted. Someone might ask: being a Forza-Horizon fan why you didn't purchase the fifth series last year? I was playing Horizon 4 at that time and had no desire to buy the new game, Horizon 4 has spectacular views of Scotland, and all of these 4 seasons are presented differently, which made this game fun and playable; however, I quickly regretted it after playing the first round. Initially, I can feel the image quality improved greatly. In the previous series, there are some places blurred even though I changed the quality in the settings but there is a little flaw in 5. In addition, Forza-Horizon 5 is DLSS-available, which means gamers with RTX graphic card installed laptops or PCs can have a better gaming experience. Secondarily, there are more adventurous plots included in horizon 5. For beginners who lack driving skills, adventures can help them to practice different skills like driving in the jungle. Apart from that, you can choose the storyline on your own, for me who does not like street-chasing, I can finish the apex, wild, and Baja races first and then return to the street-chasing story, which makes this game more freedom. One more thing, this game's setting is an open world, which means sometimes if I just want to drive through Mexico rural, I can spend hours and hours passing through deserts and jungles without barriers.Overall, I strongly recommend this game. It has an open world, a free storyline, and a better image for your eyes. The map size also expanded, which makes this game worth to play, to enjoy.

author: Eternal Vigilance
review: Crashes frequently on my PC. I have no issues with nearly all other recent games I have played but this one crashes multiple times per hour. Steam refused refund because I am over their two hours (forget the fact that having a universal two hour time limit on returns is ridiculous when games vary drastically in length), even though the majority of that was spent in menus or afk. Even on sale this game is not worth it.

author: Lightbird
review: great game, but boy - the Hot Wheels ad campaign is something else. Don't get me wrong, the gameplay is solid, but imagine getting your first car in the addon which is with about 150km/h slow af and she's like "woah Hot-Wheels, FAST AF" "Hot-Wheels booster watch out!" "WOHOO Hot-Wheels Booster so fast." "did you know, Hot-Wheels", "HoT-WhEeLs" and that's the whole campaign you have to play through for the cars: She just shoves 1 ad after another up you assYou're just sitting there with your first car bored af, thinking ugh please give me a faster car asap and for the love of GOD: SHUT UP WITH YOUR HOT-WHEELS! I had 500 km/h with traffic in the real game and you're excited about 200-250 km/h after passing the booster.I had to turn down speech volume to 0 to turn a a 10 hours drive of "are we there yet?" - "NO!" - "are we there yet?" - "NO!" experience to actual fun gameplay after a bit of grinding with a now muted ad on your passenger seatRating:Actual game: 10/10Hot-Wheels with ad on passenger seat turned on: 0/10Hot-Wheels with ad on passenger seat turned off: 10/10

author: Chrisicle
review: Forza does not get anywhere near enough criticism. game is plagued with cheesy prize wheels and gifts. Its a game that feels like its more about cars than it is about racing. NFS payback and heat are far superior quality racing games compared to forza because its focus is on racing and making money through actual competitions to advance through the game. Cities in forza also feel extremely liner and don't give a sensations that you're actually driving through a city something forza could learn a thing or two about from NFS.I could let my other complaints go if it wasn't for the constant prizes. Its not gratifying when you win a high end car from the none stop prize wheels. You are pretty much receiving a participation trophy, its a very lame handout that must be the reason its so appealing to younger generations.

author: Soul Walker
review: Disclaimer: I am an Xbox Game Pass player.If you're looking for a story, I'm sorry you're not gonna get anything past a bunch of dorky characters just happy to be here.The Horizon Series has always been about just being able to freely drive around in the car you want in different countries. 3 With Australia, 4 with the UK, and now 5 with Mexico.Admittedly Drifting feels better on 4. But I can say that this game for me is much more relaxing with much less at stake. I get to just sit back, drive a few races, and collect cars.It's the ultimate Casual Racing game and I'm all for it.This game has set the bar for what Need For Speed can be and customers of both franchises should continue to hold both companies up to standard.

author: GAMEVICyt
review: - The game runs absolutely perfectly. Never crashed or something. It's really well made and optimised.- The story...meh, I haven't really paid much attention to the dialogues, but the racing gameplay it's awesome. I wanted to play this kind of game for so long, and after getting my gaming machine, this was the first game that I've bought. Played it every day since. <3- There are a lot...A LOT of things to do in game...I couldn't tell right now how much would take to finish it, but it keeps you hooked.- The world is very detailed and stunningly looking. You can spend days just by cursing around, exploring and gazing at the scenery. Also, I'm obsessed with photo-mode. I lov this so much. :')- The in-game money is kinda easy to get, imo...or I don't really understand how I easily made a few milions...just by racing and leveling up.- I've got the Premium Edition, which gave me a few nice cars to start with, and I think a token or something, which I used to get one car (any car), for free. xD So, kinda easily got the best Bugatti...only to find out a few weeks later that other cars are better. :') Rip.- I'm playing with a PS4 controller using DS4W.I recommend this to anyone who enjoys exploring, and open-world stuff. xD I lov it!

author: 2021eula
review: Unplayable On Steam Deck in gaming mode! (and how to get around it cleanly) whenever i start the game, it gets stuck on one black frame and i have tried restarting my steam deck, even getting to the first part of actual gameplay, the black screen never went away! (don't know if this is related but this happened with poppy playtime as well)(part 2) How to get around it cleanly-ishto do this, first you want to go into desktop mode after that, open steam press "View" then press "Big Picture" and find your game there and open it (disclaimer to restart your steam deck while playing in big picture games, you must hold the power button until it has chimed 3 times, then let go)Hooray for steam! they updated the steam deck firmware so now the steam deck can Focus on the game, but if you want to play in gaming mode, you have to make the controls based off of wasd because the game rejects ALL controller inputs, steam, if you are seeing this, can you make a alternate turbo as to where the analog input value gets multiplied and then gets converted into legth of presses within the presses per second? it would make So Many games feel So Much Smoother!to summarize this edit: the game recieves NO controller input in gaming mode, only keyboard input, and it would be nice if the controller settings had a analog-like turbo.

author: Frizzionnare
review: I waited a year to buy this due to others having performance issues and major bugs when it came out, and it's running so smoothly now. Even though the computer I use is a 2 year old gaming laptop, I'm still the minimum requirement on most, and my GPU is under the minimum. However, I'm still able to run high graphics at 60+ FPS most of the time. Anyways, I'm very excited to explore more on the map. The size and the wide scope of activities is overwhelming. The re-gifting feature is a really nice touch for those that don't care about money. I ended up getting over 13 cars gifted to me on the first day including a 918 Spider, Bugatti Divo, Lexus LFA, and a Pagani Zonda Cinque Roadster... It's nice and all but I hope it doesn't make the game boring because there's little to no progression whatsoever.

author: s u p e r g r a m p s
review: TLDR: Buy Forza Horizon 4.This game was a huge letdown. I loved FH4, the environment, the cars, the details, ran well, and the communal feeling.They set this game in a literal desert: it is desolate place with a handful of people in one place. The map is actually TOO big that you feel isolated, and the few people that are in the server are either in the main festival or all spread about. Then on top of that, Forzathon is just empty. It was so empty on launch, that they patched it so that less people contributed more points. Compare this to FH4 where almost 75% of server will show up and have a grand ol' time, and then scatters off back to what they were doing when they were done. You have none of that here, and the only interaction I have is with Horizon Adventure lobbies and the Trial as per season requirement for cars I wanted.The game also runs so much worse than FH4. I don't know any technicalities, but FH4 runs like smooth butter on my 2070 MAX-Q, but will dip below 30 FPS when it is not an average ~40 FPS all around. This despite the fact the games look mostly the same anyways. Again, not my area of expertise, but potato computers that could run FH4 can't run FH5 is what my experience entails. I mean Christ, they still have not addressed the optimization issues and I wonder if they just gave up on it. I quit mainly on the fact that the more updates the game got, the more unstable the game seemed to get, to the point that I was having awful desync issues and teleporting around. Not to mention the fact that convoys in this game are so hard to get working half the time. To say that there are a bunch of technical issues in this game is an understatement and the biggest turn off for me that led to me uninstalling it.The story is also just garbage. You are an instant superstar that everyone must know about every waking moment. The characters are hollow smiles that never, EVER not happy. Their dialogue is so bland and cringy. FH4 mostly left you alone to rise to stardom and never really smothers you in bland NPC interaction besides stories, which were fun if not challenging. FH4 just lets you race and leaves the story aspect as something optional. FH5 just smothers you in never-not-chipper NPCs that are so lifeless and hollow that it gets annoying real fast. This is personal opinion of course, but I feel racing games just don't fit story lines very well: just let me race and build my career without all the fluff thank you.Hot Wheels DLC was the only real fun I had so far, as it was much more interesting and fun than the entirety of Mexico. On that note, as of the time I am writing this review, there has been very little new content. Donut Media DLC dropped after I uninstalled the game, so I cannot form an opinion on that, but from the content I saw on it, it is more or less just copy paste of FH4 assets like they are somehow brand new and designed to keep me engaged in the game.That sums up this game pretty well: a hollow, un-optimized, version of FH4 that adds only a few new things and little else. You can call it Forza Horizon 4.5 for all I care.I will wait for FH6 to be in Japan, but I will never buy the Premium edition ever again unless it was worth it, like in FH4.

author: Taffy
review: If you haven't heard by now, this game is nothing but recycled content.That's not the only issue I have with this game however.If you were to play the older titles (specifically 1-3), they have a way better festival "vibe". They capture the festival culture and car culture of each games location very very well.Horizon 5 however feels like it's treating you like a 7 year old and trying to lecture you about the culture instead of just implimenting culture into the game.Horizon 5 has lost touch with it's core audience (that being car fans), and has opted for a wide and broad audience, which is killing the longevity of the games life and playerbase.FH5 is insultingly childish and treats you so. I certainly won't be pre-ordering these games in the future, I probably won't even buy them until months into their life cycle.The horizon franchise is dead.
