author: Azed
review: Forza Horizon 5 is the long awaited successor to Playground Games' best selling game Forza Horizon 4. FH5 is the first Forza game to have a development window greater than two years (3). Unfortunately, however this game doesn't show the growth one would come to expect in a 3 year development time. There is no doubt that this is a good game, but it comes off a little too safe. I understand the concerns regarding messing up a good thing, but really? Maybe the next release will bring about more exciting changes.

author: Only The Good Die Young
review: amazing game. as someone who is new to forza as a whole i picked up my controller and the driving felt super natural. i didnt have to fight the game to drive the car, it just did what i wanted it to. the graphics are amazing for how easy the game is to run, the sound design is great. the depth of the car tuning mechanics is engaging but easy to learn and the races and challanges give you plenty of content. even after putting 70 hours into this game i feel like ive only struck the surface. 10/10 this game is a must buy if you are even remotely into racing games.

author: Eliath
review: Lots of buggy accolades and convoys don't really let you play in the open world with your friends as they disappear randomly.  Races work fairly well if you want to play with your friends, but a lot of people, myself included, like to hang around the drag strip and race people.  It's a mixed bag of some really good and really poor multiplayer experiences.That said, the graphics are great.  There are 535 cars currently, and you can tune them quite a bit.  The showcase events are great, too.That said, I am running out of things to do currently.  I have been chasing accolades, which is fun, but if you aren't into running races over and over, playing races with friends, playing/creating player made skins/tunes/races, or just lazying about around the drag strip, then you might run out of content after a few weeks.All that said, the game is great, and if you like racing games, then give it a shot.

author: Tanka the Maid
review: The two Forza Horizons i played had been a love-hate relationship, but in "retroperspective" the 4th installment was more love than hate.Sure it had it's ups and downs, but it was mostly consistent unlike the 5th installment in the Forza Horizon Franchise. There is so much wrong with this game that i don't even know where to start.The Map is probably one of the worst Maps in any Video Game i have ever played, only The Crew 2 had a worse map than this. It just feels lifeless, created without love, a massive area filled with emptiness, disappointments & rocks to â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ you over at any given moment. It can be used as an analogy for Turn 10/Playground Games & Tripple A Games in general. To keep it short it has some nice spots, but the rest of the map is just shallow at best.This is your typical Tripple A Game, great graphics, i may even consider them stunning when you play it for the first couple of times.It's surprisingly well optimized considering it's looks.On mostly Ultra, 2560x1080p on a Ryzen 7 3700X & Vega 64 i was hovering around 60FPS in Guanajuato . That's all i can say about this department, it's your average Tripple A Game graphics that get boring after some time and will be considered obsolete the second the successor game is announcedCompared to the previous installment there had been some major upgrades in that department, many of the cars sound a lot better than they used to do.There are the occasional cars that sound a bit off, but it might as well just be me who never saw/heard those irl.It's quite a pleasure to listen to the game with the help of my 5.1 Surround Sound System or my Beyerdynamic DT 770 Pro, but only as long as i played with friends/played singleplayer as the second you enter race with other people they start spamming their horns & their Forza Link garbage.The music selection is utter garbage, but that has to do with my own taste, so i'm not gonna go into that anymore than necessaryMost of the content has been copy paste from Froza Horizon 4, which would be ok if they would have also paired it with new vehicles/new content.The stories that came with the updates are bad at best, they're even worse than the actual main story of this godforsaken game, i actually have no clue how they managed to do that.Every week is just a grind consisting of relatively easy but time consuming AI Races, either super easy or absolutely disgusting Stunt Events & a Multiplayer Team Race against the "UnBeAtAbLe" AI, but more on that topic further down below...Those recent months of updates stopped my friends and me from even playing this games, i mean apart from constant bugs that are introduced with every update, they also manage to bring our such boring content that we have stopped completley.Lmao, it's baaaaaaaaaaaaaad even for Racing Game & Tripple A Game standards.You basically pick up after the Story of Forza Horizon 4 as a "superstar".Now you're just racing for fun and to show that you're the star of the Horizon Festival.But that's as far as this story goes...You do some driving for different people, do some races and all that racing game stuff.At some point you even have a rival, you might expect that he hates you or smth like that, but no!He is exactly like the rest of the festival, a watered down and shallow character with a PG Rating of G.Everyone is extremely nice, you cannot fail as you're the SuPeRsTaR, even your â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ Rival likes you.So much for Music Festival with motor racing...The music part of the Festival isn't even prevalent anymore...The Multiplayer Races are torture, imagine bumpercars but on crack.FH5 doesn't punich you for ramming other people, so you can probably guess what a lof of people do...Even in gamemodes where you have to "work" "together" as a "team" to beat either the AI or other Players.And don't you even dare to pick a non meta car, you will get absolutely wrecked. Sure you can compete if the Players are incompetent, but the second it's a somewhat competent driver you can just dream of catching them.While i'm on the topic of races, only the first place is considered winning. It doesn't even matter if you score 2nd or 3rd place, the game dismisses it as a loss for you, because the "sUpErStAr" always scores 1st place.Honestly who ever at T10/PGG came up with this idea should be fired.â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ this game, â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ this franchise. This is my last Forza Horizon Game ever!I will do everything possible to prevent that my friends buy this piece of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ and even if they want it, i will help them pirate it, as this company doesn't deserve see another cent from our pocket.I hope PGG/T10 as companies crash, burn and die

author: âœª zionorbit
review: 8/10. This game is great, with amazing visuals. Good optimizations but it's just kinda buggy. Not surprising since it just came out but it's frustrating.If they could fix the seasonal speed zones issue which pretty much incorrectly receives the wrong information/shoots out the wrong information to the player I'd be happier. For example, the limitation might be 140mph (s1 class). I get in a perfectly tuned C8 and I go above the speed limit and I hit 150mph. The game tells me I should go 1 more mph over to complete the speed trap. Customizations in this game are meh, something they can honestly improve. If only FH5 had Need For Speed Heat like customization. One last thing is I would like to see my refreshed cars like maybe a M3 G80. or a recent F82/F80 or something like a M2 CS. I just want more refreshed cars. Something like a 2020 Honda Civic Coupe SI would be awesome.

author: SR-Humf
review: First off all this game is great. The graphics are just stunning, the car design is amazing and the sounds just blow you away. But there are some cons at the moment. - Memory leak. When you play the game for like 1 to 2 hours your FPS just drops for more then 20 to 30 FPS. - Ambient Occlusion ( SSAO )  Bug. When this is on, weird lines are visible on the road, especially when the road surface is wet. If you turn this option off, it will also be gone.- 5.1 audio bug. If you use a 5.1 audio setup, You barely hear the sound of the car. Don't get me wrong the game is really great. If they would fix the memory leak the game would be a solid 9/10.And it's not like I'm running this game on a potato PC. I have an i9 10900K , an RTX 3090 and 32 GB Ram.So I will recommend this game for sure. But keep in mind that there are some bugs, of which 1 can be experienced as Game breaking.

author: Mako
review: have you played previous forza horizon games and enjoyed them? if so, you'll like this one as wellyou've never played any and you're considering giving it a go? well, buckle up because i wasted probably an hour of my time writing this.pros to me-handling feels realistic yet arcade-y. responsive, yet controllable despite input of your choice.game in extreme graphics don't look as good as horizon 4 imo, but it can run even on some potato pcs so i guess that's a good tradeoff.way too many cars to choose from.plenty tuning options. (performance wise)livery editor is intuitive and easy to use, yet hard to master.anyone can pick up and enjoy even for a bit, including non car nerds.every week there's little challenges and if you do them all you get cars or other stuff.after the intro you can play at your own pace and choose paths to play as well.friendly community when it comes to helping and teaching, bumpers car in online.cross platform with xbox.lots of assists that'll help you learn the game if you need it, including a time slow (doesn't work in online). all of which i'd recommend disabling once you learn. don't know how to tune? plenty tutorials or willing players. don't want to learn? download a tune and forget about all that work.credits are easy to come by so you don't really gotta worry about not being able to afford stuff.can make your own routes, maps and modes. creator is only starting, lots more features said to be planned.plenty more content to come as a whole.cons to me:every vehicle seems to understeer unless tuned.tuning can be scary for new players.awd seems to be still king.a lot of vehicles got nerfed p.i. wise (point index, forza's class measurement), and in turn, that makes them not be able to reach top of some classes unless you engine swap or do drivetrain swaps.clothes in wheelspins still... but if you buy them all, they'll be gone (if you have over two million to spare on clothes. . .).your car can randomly decide it no longer wants to be a car, and instead be a spaceship. even on an entirely flat road.voice lines are hit or miss.new feature called chat link/forza link- before you could put 4 quick chats on your 4 buttons of your choice, now you can still do that but two are reactive to other player's chat or what's happening in game. i'm mute irl so i used to run yes/no, sorry and a salt inducing comment of my choice; mostly "another ones bites the dust". now i have to choose two of those.most cars are suvs/trucks, super or hyper cars it seems.i have 32 gb of ram, after 2 or 3 hours of play i have ram memory leaks and restarting fixes it. only game that does it.ai in coop is a pushover, even in unbeatable imo.can't place decals on windows.can't paint front rims different than rear, or use different rims altogether.can't change material of decals... say, a matte car and a metal flake vinyl.adjustable wings are still mostly awful looking... why can't we adjust aero on any wing, even if it's more or less than others?visual customization isn't the best, but the game doesn't advertise itself as visual customization heaven... so it's a non-issue issue.differential choice seems meaningless (to me, as i do my own tunes). all i've noticed that changes is the starting setting of them- say, race differential starting at 20 30, rally differential starts at 40 20. (not actual numbers, just giving an example).i'm sure i'm forgetting pros and cons, but i have over a thousand hours into horizon 4 which was worse than this in a lot of ways.tl:dr: if you liked previous ones, you'll like this one. if you like racing games, you'll like this i think. if you don't but you're curious, i'd wait for a sale. IN MY OPINION best SIM-CADE racing game of past 3-4 years hope this can help anyone decide, have a good day/night (:

author: mundip6
review: The graphics, lighting and weather effects are some of the best we've seen in a racing game, but of course it's all about the cars. Although this is an arcade racer that does not focus on realism but rather on short and fast action, the cars behave truthfully and react differently whether you are driving on a track, on the street or off road. The controls have been kept simple, making the game accessible to just about anyone. Altogether, this makes Forza Horizon 5 the most fun racing game of the moment.

review: The best racing game for a casual, open world freeroam experience. I came from DiRT 4 looking for something more than just racing events and this hit the spot dead on. Serious racing can also be great, but it has some downsides.Overall this game is an easy recommendation, but just to mention some of the negatives from my experience:- The AI difficulty scaling is quite bad with steps being too easy -> too hard, as the AI doesn't become "better", they become too fast + still have perfect traction & steering.- I wish there were more songs on the radio or the ability to add my own tracks.- Dialogue is as cringey as it gets and you can't skip it.Overall it's as if GTA V had only focused on the cars and racing, but extremely PG friendly.

author: PaulJ
review: Working my way through the campaign, Horizon 5 has a slow drip that keeps awarding unlocks presenting new cars right when the ones you've been driving become stale. Spending time in the autoshow customizing your car's visuals and performance is great. On the asphalt, gravel, beachsand or mud, the same familiar car tuning options from Horizon 4 make a return and adjusting the dials just right will give your machine an edge on the competition. The games colour palette, npc voice-overs and soundtrack are about par for the course, not all original but not annoying either. Performance wise, this game runs like a gem and looks the part too. With all the trash tier AAA PC games we've seen in 2021, this one separates itself from the chaff and looks & performs great. If this studio had internal struggles and last minute design changes due to the pandemic, it does not show in this game whatsoever. Kudos to them. If you're a racing fan, this game deserves some of your time.

author: Larsaron
review: Addictive carcollectathon, beautiful visuals, cars handle superbly, and it is great fun racing with your friends....If you can get past the slew of annoying bugs and technical issues the game currently has.  Daily challenges that just do not work.  Performance degradation (game starts at 90 fps for me, after 2 hours of playtime its down to 30 fps).  Online open world lobbies seem to be limited to 10-12 players, where in Horizon 4 you saw up to 70 at once per session, which leads into the next point, Horizon Arcade events which are required for seasonal challenges being IMPOSSIBLE to finish, since they need quite a few players to reach the goals.  But 99 times out of 100, you're doing it alone.I'm willing to have a little faith in the developers being able to fix these issues since Horizon 4 too was troubled at launch, but today it runs flawlessly.  And despite the problems listed above, at its core, Horizon 5 is an incredibly fun playground for all things racing!

author: Chocomonster
review: Be prepared for crashes, hangups and network problems. If you want to use a steering wheel, be prepared for it to either not work at all or have periodical issues, even if you have one of the most commonly used models on the market. The settings menu is also a total mess some settings conflict with each other and others disable each other with no apparent logic behind it. If you for instance want to rebind buttons on the controller, then you have to work around the fact that there are 4-8 keys that are REQUIRED despite anyone sane never using them, such as the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ ANNA helper-companion.It is clear that this is no passion project, because for all the content being made and released on a constant drip, nothing is being done about the core problems this game has and none of the updates do anything about simple player convenience changes. One example would be that if you collect one of every car in the game, then you cannot choose the colour, vinyl and tune for each of them, because the game is severely limited in how many 'layouts' you can store.I got my money's worth, as my hours make clear, but I would never recommend this to anyone, because it is such a gamble if it will even let you play the way you want or at all and none of the issues that have persisted since launch are ever getting fixed, because the developers have put this game on life support while they work on DLC and a sequel.I suggest you instead give your money to a developer that listens to player feedback and fixes technical issues.

author: HELLFIREâ„¢
review: Really fun game. No doubt, the best Forza game so far. The only downside is that I've noticed a few small bugs, but nothing too big. Barn finds are actually good and useful cars, Forza Edition cars have custom upgrades that are only available on the Forza Edition cars. It is easy to get Accolades at first and gets slightly harder as you progress, which is a good thing. I love the graphics.No doubt in my mind that this is the best racing game at the moment. Drifting mechanics are way better, and I find drifting way more fun than FH4. I absolutely love this game and there is almost nothing wrong with it.

review: ---{ Graphics }---â˜ Life-likeâ˜‘ Beautifulâ˜ Goodâ˜ Decentâ˜ Badâ˜ Donâ€˜t look at it---{ Gameplay }---â˜ Amazingâ˜ Very Goodâ˜ Goodâ˜ Mehâ˜‘ Watch paint dry insteadâ˜ Just don't---{ Audio }---â˜ Actual Ear Pornâ˜ Very goodâ˜ Goodâ˜‘ Decentâ˜ Badâ˜ Nails on chalkboard---{ Audience }---â˜‘ Kidsâ˜‘ Teensâ˜‘ Adultsâ˜ Grandma---{ PC Requirements }---â˜ Potatoâ˜ Laptop Specsâ˜ Decentâ˜‘ Fastâ˜ RTX Gangâ˜ NASA Supercomputer---{ Difficulty }---â˜ Very Easyâ˜‘ Easyâ˜ Normal Difficultyâ˜ Moderately Difficultâ˜ Very Difficultâ˜ Insanely Difficult---{ Grind }---â˜‘ Nothing to grindâ˜ Isn't necessary to progressâ˜ Average grind levelâ˜ Lots of grindingâ˜ You'll need a second life for grinding---{ Story }---â˜‘ No Storyâ˜ Some loreâ˜ Averageâ˜ Goodâ˜ Lovelyâ˜ It'll replace your life---{ Game Time }---â˜ Very Shortâ˜ Shortâ˜‘ Averageâ˜ Longâ˜ To infinity and beyond---{ Price }---â˜ It's free!â˜ Worth the priceâ˜ If it's on saleâ˜‘ If u have some spare money leftâ˜ Not recommendedâ˜ You could also just burn your money---{ Bugs }---â˜ Never heard ofâ˜ Minor bugsâ˜ Can get annoyingâ˜‘ Lots of bugsâ˜ 2020 Cyber Punk---{ ? / 10 }---â˜ 1â˜ 2â˜ 3â˜‘ 4â˜ 5â˜ 6â˜ 7â˜ 8â˜ 9â˜ 10I have no idea why this game is getting as much praise as it is. The online multiplayer is a complete dumpster fire, players are getting lifetime bans left and right, the absolute atrocious rubber-banding AI in solo play. A major downgrade in the Forza franchise. I've been playing these games for nearly 10 years, and this one is the most disappointing by far.

author: Old Man Withers
review: You can follow these steps to become a professional race car driver:1. Develop your driving skillsTo compete against professional race car drivers, you must have excellent driving skills. There are a few ways you can work on the skills needed to drive at high speeds. One way is to take up karting. Karts have a similar construction to open-wheel vehicles, and they travel at high speeds relative to their size and the structure of the courses and the competition is almost identical. Once you feel your skills have improved enough, you can compete in karting races to see how you measure against others.Another option is to enroll in a racing school. There are various types of schools throughout the country, some specializing in a specific form of racing. Through formalized learning, you can gain knowledge from experienced drivers and practice your racing skills on real courses. Consider searching for a reputable racing school near you and asking about requirements.2. Join a racing clubMembership in a well-established racing club can help you stay informed about racing events you can compete in and even provide you with resources to get you started in your career. One of the most well-known clubs you can consider is the Sports Car Club of America, or SCCA, which hosts races of various types around the country. The SCCA offers online applications and variable rates depending on factors such as age and military service.3. Obtain a vehicle and equipmentHaving a reliable, race-capable vehicle is required of all successful drivers. If you can afford to purchase your own vehicle, consider an unmodified model to which you can make your own customizations. You may also be able to rent a vehicle for racing, which can be a more feasible choice as you build up your funds to purchase your own vehicle. In either case, the members and officials of your racing club can provide guidance so that you choose a vehicle that's appropriate for your needs.Racing gear and safety equipment are also required to compete in races. This includes clothing and accessories such as a fireproof racing suit, helmet and gloves. Once you've obtained the necessary gear, have it examined by a club official to make sure it's up to standard.4. Obtain a competition licenseWhen you start out in your racing club, you're a novice. You need a competition license to compete in events. The racing club you belong to is the sanctioning body that issues the license, and it generally qualifies you for events in all racing clubs. Consult with your club to determine the specific requirements for licensure, as they're likely to differ. For example, the SCCA's requirements include racing three times within two years.5. Practice and trainPractice is necessary to become good enough to compete at the professional level. If possible, aim to work on your skills on a track or a simulator at least five times a week, and also compete regularly. It can also be helpful to develop a training regimen that includes cardiovascular and resistance workouts. Conditioning your body can improve your ability to withstand the physical challenges of the sport. In addition, consider studying professional races and analyzing the techniques of the best drivers. You can incorporate their maneuvers into your skill set.6. Look for a team or a sponsorIf you've performed well in your races, you may attract the attention of teams and sponsors. Alternatively, you can proactively get in touch with them to discuss terms. Teams and sponsors provide funding for your career in exchange for different returnsâ€”a portion of your winnings and permission to advertise on your vehicle, respectively. With their support, you can enter large races as a professional driver.

author: Sentinel
review: This is in my top 5 games that I have ever played. The graphics look amazing and the game-play is super fun. Would recommend to anyone who likes cars regardless if you haven't played racing games before. It can be as competitive as you want it to be. If you want to just drive around and explore a beautiful map you can do that. If you want to race agents different levels of AI that become increasingly more challenging then you can do that. And if you want to race real players you can also do that. I have enjoyed my time with is game and I will be spending many more hundreds of hours exploring and having fun. Hope to see you there!

author: wingusdingus
review: As fun as this game could be, and as amazing as it looks, I wouldn't wish this experience on my worst enemy. The connection issues have made me more frustrated with technology than I have been in the last few years. After countless upgrades, and a decent internet bill it is extremely demoralizing to try and join up with your friends and end up with constant connection issues. Friends will disappear while other players are still visible and active, "Not in leaders session" will be a common occurrence reminding you of the game's failure. This is only coupled with strange hitboxes on the terrain, and poor optimization which leads to textures crashing and frames tanking. Broken game on release, and it doesn't seem to have gotten any better.

author: Zenny
review: This feels like yet another game driven into a wall by the investors and other individuals who don't have anything to do with the actual development of the game. Everything they touch turns into ðŸ’©. It's always been that way, and every developer studio who has allowed it (or didn't have a choice) has experienced the same effects. Unfinished garbage which is released and later fixed more or less. No innovation, just recycle old assets as to improve profitability. No attention for quality whatsoever.Since the last patch many users are experiencing even more crashes than before, game will run at 5fps after 10 minutes of playing or while looking at menus. Horizon online is broken, no other players are visible. This is one month after release, kind of akward. It's now completely unplayable for me.PROs: -it's basically FH4 with a different map and theme, some features were added, others removed-good work on the map, there is more than one fun paved road now.-Nice atmosphere (as long as traffic works which it does only in singleplayer) and graphics-I can now paint brake calipersCONs:-Buggy mess, low performance, feels glitchy, they didn't even get basic stuff right like hiding your cursor when in fullscreen lol-No innovation, it's still the same game-Traffic doesn't work in horizon online and other players will disappear-Still no acknowledgment for basic tuning features who many were asking for since a decade (window decals, exhausts, new horizon parts)-Many good cars missing (bye alfa and lancia) and the best widebodies were removed-Developer seems more focused on banning players for stuff that offends only them rather than doing the hard stuff which is fixing this sorry excuse for a sequel-No acknowledgment for players who don't care for races and events and just want to enjoy their cars in online freeroaming. Now you can't even look for a new horizon life session, you have to go back to singleplayer, then enter horizon life and it will most likely still put you in the same session. This was important to find new players to hang out with.-Sounds are broken, turbo sounds like 100% pressure even when you just press the throttle by 10% or less.-Game won't do basic stuff like in fh3 and 4, won't remember your radio (need to turn it off manually each time), won't remember the amount of layers when looking for decals, other similar things.In short, if you have fh4 and the map didn't get completely boring yet wait for a sale. The only advantage from fh5 to fh4 are the map and paintable brake calipers, no other improvements. And these things are hardly worth over 80$.

author: Aoshi
review: Its Forza, it's beautiful, and i can't wait to sink many more hours into it however there are three disappointing issues that need addressing! 1.) They put so much effort into the car sounds yet the actual audio with the camera behind the car is too quiet!!! Lets be honest, the car sounds are what makes this game so why can i barely my car! Fortunately the work around i use for this is have the car sounds turned right up and lower everything else, then turn my physical speakers right up to listen to my RB symphony. 2.) In online mode there is virtually NO ai traffic! This makes the world feel very dull and empty, Switching to offline mode helps with this but it would be sick to play online and with traffic.3.) Load times, crashes, and bugs. When my games running, its beautiful, everything maxed out on 1440p with 100+ fps on my rig but these load times are horrendous even on my SSD! Lag/crashes in the menus is quite painful. Hopefully these issues are addressed and once they are i'll happily be giving this a thumbs up!

Glad Forza titles started popping up on Steam as they were my titles and surely was missing on a lot of good stuff.

author: â˜£ BradyBSB â˜£
review: Forza Horizon 5, while it is a fun game, is very similar to Forza Horizon 4. Well duh, they're just racing games, right? Yes, but the car selection, from what I can tell, is mostly identical to that of Horizon 4, but without any of the paywalls for certain FH4 cars.Horizon 5 is a nice change of scenery, and the intro to the game is definitely the most off-the-wall, memorable one I've seen yet. There is much more of an off-road element present for people like myself compared to Horizon 4, and even some Baja races that I haven't unlocked yet that I'm definitely excited for.Is it worth $60? Well, maybe, but, that doesn't include the cars that will hopefully still be added, not locked behind paywalls, like Horizon 4.To date, I would say I like the game, but I can't give a number rating like I usually would. I like the game, but some of the bugs present at launch are pretty frustrating, so, I would advise towards waiting a couple months, or a handful of updates to buy just to avoid any frustrations, like suddenly losing a 1M+ skill chain. End.

review: I really really recommended to buy this game :)The game is just amazing.You have a huge map that has a lot to do.Do not be afraid to do damage to pillars or trees, etc.Anyone who just wants an experience and does not want to spend too much, so it is advisable for him to go for this version.I personally, really do not recommend for few cars.I Understand it is very expensive for this package, but it is highly recommended for those who want maximum experience.Huge map, Beautiful graphics, Impressive numbers of cars, Lots of missions and stories.The game ran smoothly with no issues at all.Control of the cars, is simply superb, when you find out how each one reacts.There is a choice of what level of difficulty you choose :)To play with a friends is a nightmare.I do not understand why I need to add a friend from Microsoft?I bought the game from steam, so let me join my friend on steam!Several times it also happens that there are disconnections.The cars do not break, except the glass is full of cracks and does not shatter,and beatings here and there and color drop and that's it.Other than that everything is great.

author: Classic Kobe
review: Recommend this game to anyone wanting to get into a racing game. Has lots of content that will please any car fanatic or newbie. From car customization to drifting, drags, road, and dirt races. From dune buggies to Bugattis, I'm sure you can find something that you like.

author: TastyAppetizer
review: Always was a fan of the Horizon series, but this was my first ever Horizon game as I didn't have a console or a computer capable of running it (sad intel HD noises). Built a moderate level PC and after playing it, have to say it meets all my expectations, really enjoying my time with it. Gonna split this review up into the good and bad.-> Beautiful map, extremely varying environment from region to region and there's something for everyone. From off-road racing, to grip racing, to drifting on side roads.-> Great optimization, runs at 1080p high@60fps, with a GTX 1650 GDDR6 LP so thumbs up for that.-> Even at high, the game looks gorgeous, and the weather effects look, and sound great.-> Great selection of cars, got around 200 in-game, and they all feel relatively unique from one another.-> Progression is light, you're given loads of cars through wheelspins and accolades (in-game achievements), so you can save up your credits to buy something you really like. The game doesn't force you to do anything, you can play it at your own pace and do what you like doing.-> The handling model is arcade, but fun to play with on keyboard & mouse (keeping only ABS on).-> Servers still do cause issues, but they have improved massively since launch so I wouldn't worry about it.-> Multiplayer is a mess, I've only played it casually and there are clean racers but most people cannot drive without ramming you into oblivion or using your car to slow down for a corner (wondering if the changes to Horizon 4's multiplayer made it into Horizon 5)-> There are a few texture glitches, especially when the road is wet, but I'm not sure if it's only because the game is running at high.-> If you're looking to no life this game to get high scores for various activities (not my thing, but just wanted to mention), like setting fastest times, highest speeds, longest jumps, there are a few exploits currently ruining the leaderboards. -> Clothing, emotes and horns in wheelspins, I feel like the lifestyle aspect of the game should be separate from the racing/car aspect of the game.Overall, an all rounded game, that is enjoyable to play solo, and would be for multiplayer if they tweaked it so that people don't wall ride or ram into you. It's great to unwind and explore the map with your favourite cars and take in the sights. There's quite a bit a content, and there's going to be more on the way of course.Also wanted to mention that I got the premium edition, can't really say if it's worth it or not yet as the expansions aren't out yet, and won't be for a while I guess. But they haven't disappointed in the past, so if you're think about getting the premium edition, I'd give it a soft recommendation. But, if it's on sale definitely get the premium edition.

author: Brebs
review: Great Game but I have a couple complaints. After having the game pause for a while, lag spikes start to happen a lot more frequent. Another thing with graphics and performance is that the render distance for trees in this game needs to be raised. It was better in forza horizon 4 with the same settings. Theres a bug where when you swap exhausts, it takes a while for all the components of the engine sound to load too. The special effects like the turbo sound loads before the roar of the engine. Also just a suggestion, sometimes i feel like there isnt as much of a set campaign mode as I would have hoped. It kind of feels like you can get bored from being lost and not knowing what to grind for. Other than that it is a beautiful game. Extremely fun and well polished

author: rubrub_27
review: I am definitely not going to lie, I had high expectations for this game and I can gladly say it exceeded them. I had no interest in cars or racing in general, however this game has made that enjoyable for me. The freedom and choice Forza Horizon 5 grants you allows any kind of audience to enjoy the game, whether it is racing, tuning cars, collecting cars, etc. Furthermore the game can run on any kind of PC with very good or very bad specs. Graphics are gorgeous supporting RTX as well. Even though there were a whole bunch of bugs when the game first came out, it is currently at a very good state, except for the online multiplayer aspect. I spend more time trying to join my friends party rather than playing the game. Even though there were updates and improvements to the online features throughout the games lifespan, the online experience is still sometimes unbearable. Other than that the game has almost has no flaws.I started being more interested in cars in general having no prior knowledge. Now I began watching F1 races more, took more interest in cars like my father. We discuss old Porsche cars which is very enjoyable. I can say that this game played a huge role in that.Definitely recommend it, 9.5/10. It will be 10/10 if the online multiplayer aspect is fixed.

author: Bryant
review: TL;DR:Graphics: 10/10Music: 8/10Gameplay: 9/10Story: 8/10Controls: 10/10Early glitches and issues aside, it's a quality title. That being said, multiplayer issues are still present even after the first big patch, particularly in free-roam/open world segments. I would highly recommend the title to anyone, even the uninitiated into racing games, the open world is a blast to just drive around in.EDIT 11/25/21: I'm surprised by the infrequency of updates to the title if I'm honest, with only one patch since launch and a myriad of issues. However I stand by the original review despite the continued multiplayer issues.

author: AemJoues
review: Forza Horizon 5 is an XL version of FH4. Everything that was good about FH4 has been used in FH5. You can now tune the cars to whether it should be a drift car (drift-mode) etc. Unlike FH4 the cars are less arcade-like and more realistic. But at the same time, they still have the Forza Horizon way of handeling. From someone who comes from league racing in F1 2021, rFactor 2, ACC etc., I think FH5 is a fantastic game. The game is relaxing to play. It has both elements of relaxation and races where you need to concentrate.Some have had problems with the game. The only problem I've had is that online does not work very well. When you are in a convoy you cannot see the HindanOthers have had problems with not being able to open the game. These things will be resolved soon with an update.Would I recommend the game - yes. Usually I do not think that a game is worth the costs and therefore i buy them on offer, but here the game are one of the only ones where I can say that it is 100% worth it. I bought the premium edition for 100â‚¬ and think it's worth it. I've been playing 30 hours and I'm not done with the storry mode yet. So in short, yes that is worth it. You would have lots of fun with your friends online, and with the story-mode offline.

As of now, there are many many cheaters, so the leader boards are totally messed up, so that is one thing that is needed to fix. Overall it is an awesome Horizon game just like the others I have played, all you need to do is wait for the updates to come out slowly and surely it will be better when most updates have come out.

author: westlane #DankeSeb
review: If you liked Horizon 4, this is a no-brainer. If you have an interest in cars or motorsport, there's plenty to love in this game. If you are a sim-racing enthusiast, there's not much for you here in terms of competitive racing or simulation driving. As someone who loved Horizon 4, is passionate about cars and motorsports (F1, MotoGP, WRC, WEC) and loves sim-racing: I wholeheartedly recommend this game for like-minded individuals. For everyone else: as of this moment, (november 17th 2021) there are about a hundred technical issues impacting game performance, online connectivity and user experience - the worst of them being memory leak in the Steam version ultimately serving as a countdown to a crash to desktop. Mileage varies heavily from user to user when it comes to these issues so if you haven't bought this game yet because you're worried about technical issues I'd advise you to check the Forza Support Twitter account until issues are resolved.

author: acrylog
review: Forza Horizon 5 is by far the best game in the series. Aside from the bugs that we've come to expect from a new game launch and the cheaters posting unrealistic times on the leaderboards, there aren't many flaws I can think of. The map has a wide variety of terrains and sights, giving you the opportunity to do many of the things that you want. The premade races aren't even that bad either. You can even watch 12 hypercars tumble down the side of a mountain in one of them, if you desire. The accolade system rewards you for doing certain tasks, some of which you may not have even thought to do. Car tuning has been made better by the inclusion of fully adjustable 7, 8, 9, and 10 speed transmissions, giving you the ability to make the car drive how you want, as opposed to the previous games only giving you a 6 speed or however many came in the car originally.This game is missing cars and manufacturers from the previous entries, most notably Citroen, Lancia, and Alfa Romeo, as well as a few cars such as the 2002 Lotus Esprit V8, 2005 Hot Wheels Mustang, and a fan favorite, the 1962 Peel P50. The game does, however, give us new electric cars like the 2020 Porsche Taycan Turbo S and 2020 Lotus Evija. Overall, it's a really fun simcade that has the potential to be really good if it just gets fixed.Edit: V10 Scene 95 has to be the worst story mission that has ever existed in a Forza Horizon game. It's basically impossible if your difficulty is higher than above average and your traction control is off.Edit 2: This was written before the P50 was added to the game.

author: changeintoatruck
review: This amazing homemade meatloaf recipe is tender and juicy on the inside with a sweet and tangy topping.  This is a traditional meatloaf made with ground beef, breadcrumbs, onions, and perfectly balanced seasonings.  A ketchup-based topping adds incredible flavor.WHAT MAKES A REALLY GOOD MEATLOAF RECIPEI think the trick to good meatloaf is using lean ground beef.  The problem with a lot of meatloaf recipes is that they call for ground beef with a high fat content.  As the meatloaf cooks, the fat cooks out and makes a greasy mess.  Not this recipe!HOW TO KEEP IT MOISTYou may be thinking, but wonâ€™t lean ground beef make the meatloaf dry?  Not at all!  The milk, egg, ketchup, and diced onion in the meat mixture are all working to keep the meatloaf moist and delicious.WHY PUT MILK IN ITMilk soaks into the breadcrumbs and helps keep the meatloaf moist.  I typically use whole milk in recipes, but any type of milk including non-dairy milk alternatives could be used.  IS IT BETTER TO COOK COVERED OR UNCOVEREDSome recipes call for covering the loaf pan with aluminum foil before baking to keep the moisture in.  This is not necessary in this recipe.  Bake uncovered for the entire 55 minutes.  It will stay moist.SHOULD I SAUTÃ‰ THE ONIONS FIRSTSome recipes call for sautÃ©ing the onions before adding them to the raw meatloaf mixture.  This ensures that the onions are completely cooked and soft.  Iâ€™ve found that if the onions are cut small enough, they will cook through during the baking process and do not need to be sautÃ©ed.This recipe calls for finely diced onion, so there is no need to sautÃ© it first.  Skipping the sautÃ© step makes the meatloaf preparation faster and easier.This classic meatloaf is perfect for a busy weeknight meal because it can be prepared in minutes.HOW LONG SHOULD IT COOKThis meatloaf is cooked in a 350Â° oven, uncovered, for 55 minutes. The internal temperature should reach 160Â° F.  Be sure to let the meatloaf rest for 10 minutes before attempting to slice it, so it holds its shape.LOAF PAN VERSUS BAKING SHEETI prefer to use a loaf pan because it keeps all the glaze in place perfectly and the meat is juicier.  But, you could line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.  Shape the meatloaf into a loaf shape.  Top with the glaze.  And, bake as normal.HOW TO MAKE THE BEST MEATLOAF*Note:  The full printable recipe is at the bottom of this post.Add 90% lean ground beef to a large bowl.Add dried bread crumbs  and some diced onion.Add milk, an egg, ketchup, and worcestershire sauce.Add dried parsley, garlic powder, salt and pepper.Mix it together REALLY well.Pour the meat mixture into a loaf pan.Spread it into a flat even layer.MAKE THE MEATLOAF SAUCEAdd ketchup, brown sugar, and red wine vinegar to a bowl.Whisk until combined.Pour the glaze over the meatloaf.Bake it!Let it cool before slicing.CAN THIS BE MADE AHEAD OF TIMEAbsolutely!  Just cover the loaf pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate it until youâ€™re ready for it.  Then, uncover it and let it come to room temperature as youâ€™re preheating the oven.CAN THIS BE FROZENYes!  Prepare the meatloaf, put it in a loaf pan, and top with glaze according to the recipe directions.  Cover the pan and freeze.Place the frozen meatloaf in the refrigerator to thaw about 24 hours before you want to bake it.  Then, uncover it and let it come to room temperature as youâ€™re preheating the oven.WHY DOES MEATLOAF FALL APARTYou may not have used enough binding ingredients.  This recipe calls for plenty of breadcrumbs.It may be over baked.  Fifty five minutes is all it takes.Or, you may have sliced into it while it was still too hot.  I always let my meatloaf cool for 10 minutes before slicing into it.Iâ€™ve been playing around with this recipe for the past few months, making it many times.  And, I didnâ€™t mind the repetition at all because I do believe I ended up with the best classic meatloaf recipe ever. ðŸ™‚Ingredients1 lb. 90% lean ground beef1 cup dried bread crumbs1/2 cup diced yellow onion1/2 cup milk1 large egg beaten2 tbsp. ketchup1 tbsp. Worcestershire sauce1 tsp. dried parsley leaves3/4 tsp. salt1/2 tsp. garlic powder1/4 tsp. ground black pepperFor the Topping:1/4 cup ketchup2 tbsp. packed light brown sugar1 tbsp. red wine vinegarInstructionsPreheat oven to 350Â° Fahrenheit.In a large bowl, add the beef, bread crumbs, onion, milk, egg, 2 tablespoons ketchup, worcestershire sauce, parsley, salt, garlic powder, and pepper. Use your hands to mush and mix these ingredients together until well combined.*Add the meat mixture to a loaf pan. Pat the meat down into an even layer.In a small bowl, add 1/4 cup ketchup, the brown sugar, and vinegar. Stir to combine. Pour the sauce on top of the meatloaf and spread it into an even layer.Bake uncovered for 55 minutes.Let the meatloaf rest for 8-10 minutes before serving (or it may fall apart).**Notes*Be sure to mix the meat really well.  This is a very moist meatloaf recipe so under mixing can cause the meatloaf to be too soft/mushy. **I use two thin spatulas to remove the meatloaf from the pan and transfer it to a cutting board. You could also slice and serve the meatloaf directly from the loaf pan, or use parchment paper to line the pan for easy removal.NutritionServing: 1/10th of the meatloaf | Calories: 164kcal | Carbohydrates: 14.8g | Protein: 11.7g | Fat: 5.7g | Saturated Fat: 2.2g | Cholesterol: 49.9mg | Sodium: 399.3mg | Fiber: 0.6g | Sugar: 6.7goh and I think the game is ok too.

author: Sparkster
review: By far best Forza Horizon game to date!Pros:    Graphically game looks incredible and big props to the sound design team! Vehicle upgrades can change the sound of the cars entirely which I really enjoy. Replay-ability is off the charts no matter what you decide to do. Whether you are cruising across the MASSIVE map looking for XP boards or doing as many races as possible you will NOT get bored of this game.Cons:    Online play is somewhat buggy. When trying to play with friends one of the players usually disconnects after every race and will have to rejoin the convoy. Sometimes it can work flawlessly other times it just simply will not function correctly. Game crashes when the intro cutscene starts that showcases you and your friend's cars which is very annoying. Another thing to note is when you do convoy up with a friend and want to go explore the open world one of two things can happen. 1. Friend can drive up to you and then will completely vanish (or disconnect)2. You and friend can be cruising on a road perfectly normal but one may disconnect and will be sent either into offline mode or into another world itself where other friend is not present.Final Conclusion:     Pros outweigh the cons drastically. If you are searching for a fun racing game look no further! Very addicting will be hard to stop playing. If you like to play alone this game will exceed your expectations. When the online features do work you and a friend will have tons of fun racing with or against one another. If the constant disconnects get fixed in a future update this game easily will be a 10/10, but for the reasons stated above, STRONG 9/10.If you ain't first, you're last!

author: Swing N'Miss
review: For a player that only cares about the multiplayer spectre of the game this feature is a hot mess.More disconnects than I can count, every time I get a match I get dirty racers ramming you outside of the tracks and since I like to play clean I legit quit after the first encounter, wall crashing slow down shouldn't be a feature, it's not that I'm Lewis Hamilton but I usually go against the wall because players push me into it they just can't race clean, can't pick my game mode and/or class performance that I desire it's all random and I have to spam cancel every time I get a race that I don't want, no ranked pvp system (but with the quality of the pvp I don't blame the devs for not adding competitive features yet)...and no patch on the horizon to fix these issues.Single player just doesn't appeal to me otherwise I could find enjoyment, I don't play a racing game to collect cars, to quest or to play against the AI on a daily basis, that's just extremelly boring from my perspective and since multiplayer barely works and when it works it's hot garbage filled with bad drivers playing Demolition Derby I just decided to uninstall, not worth my time.My biggest regret was wasting Â£80 for the Prime Edition. Anyways lesson learned...never again.

author: âœª Jason
review: This game does not disappoint! Even tho FH4 already had stunning Graphics, FH5 took another huge step towards realism. Thx to raytracing you have even sharper, even cleaner and even more realistic looking reflections and shadows. Next to graphics, they also made the engines sound absolutely amazing + the sound changes slightly, when you install certain parts. When it comes to the map: its way bigger then the one in FH4 and features a lot more long straights, fun offroad tracks, small towns, a stadium, a bunch of festivals instead of only having one, a few dragstrips and some amazing, diverse landscaping.There are a few things tho, that still need to be patched and those are: the game sometimes crashes, when installing certain body-modifications to a car, the textures often bug out (mainly the roads), there often are connection issues, especially when playing with friends and lastly your car sometimes just randomly stops.Besides those few issues, that by no means make this game unplayable, i think this is one of the best games ive ever played. it never gets boring and they didnt even publish the DLCs yet. I'm sure, that they will soon release a major patch, that fixes most of these minor problems and makes the game even better!

author: True Neutral
review: Forza Horizon 5 is another excellent addition to the Forza Horizon series, one of the best racing franchises if not the best at the moment. Forza Horizon 5 is a great game to both car enthusiasts and people who don't know a whole lot about them alike, with lots of car variety and customization, it's one of the most diverse car games I've ever played. You can race any car on any track, with any ruleset, alone or with friends, and it helps that it has quite a lot of tracks too, with a track creating tool for the community to make even more, which brings me to another thing this game does nicely: Community interaction. Players have the option to create tracks, tunes, game modes, liveries, snap photographs and share it all with other players online, being rewarded in game if your creation is popular with others. You have the option to interact with random people you find driving about in FH5's open world, give and receive cars to and from random players, and there are a few official online modes which you can play to compete or cooperate directly with people online in a series of races, challenges and minigames. So if you like games that are heavily based around their communities, this one does that really well.The driving itself is Forza Horizon standard, it's arcade, but not Need For Speed levels of insanity. Physics kind of works like it should, real racing knowledge will help you in this game, but don't expect Assetto Corsa or Project Cars levels of simulation. It's not a simulator, and it's for the best.Graphically the game is beautiful. Cars look amazing and the scenery helps too. Some talented people take amazing photos using the game's photo mode and share them online, and I can kind of lose myself for a moment seeing what each player has to share in the photo gallery.The AI is a bit disappointing to be honest, with the harder difficulties seemingly not abiding by the same rules that player cars do, and they usually ram you or suddenly brake, resulting in collisions that may or may not affect your race.The soundtrack is good, it's a nice selection of songs, although I haven't heard too many as I find myself focusing more on the sounds of the cars and listen mostly to one radio station (Horizon Pulse).It's not without its problems though. Technically it could be better, and seems it had a bit of a rough launch. It crashed randomly a few times for me, and some friends had to look for a few workarounds to get the game to launch properly. The FPS seems to heavily drop after some gameplay time too for what seems to be no reason, since it runs pretty smoothly otherwise. At launch at least the servers are a bit problematic. You'll get disconnected often, friends and other players will suddenly vanish in free-roam sessions, and I've been actually disconnected from a race once. But there were a few messages in-game telling us a hotfix addressing these issues is coming, so here's hoping it gets better.But in general, the game's a lot of fun. It reignited my passion for cars a bit, and playing together with friends, experimenting different races with different cars, making ridiculous upgrades on otherwise non-viable cars, having fun odd run-ins with players in free-roam, and all around just having fun in Horizon Mexico really makes this game worth it in my opinion. And it will probably get better with updates or so I hope. I really think this is the game to play if you're looking for racing games right now.Forza Horizon 5 does what it wants to do really well, and a few technical hiccups aside, it's really some of the best car action the gaming industry has to offer. If I had to rate it, I'd give it a 9/10.I hope those who bought it are having as much fun as I am, cruising around Mexico with my friends in all kinds of cars. Here's to another successful Horizon festival.

author: Aromalliv
review: This is my first Forza game, like FIRST FIRST. I must say that I expected a lot due to the hype that surrounds it. I even bought Premium because I was so excited to see what this game has to offer. But...it was okay, not really that great but it's still a good game. I enjoy it, I'm having fun driving my dream cars, and just going crazy in this game.But there are some stuffs that I also hate, such as tuning cars (It's on me, I didn't do a thorough research about this and like I said this is my FIRST Forza game). Tuning cars takes me more than 15mins to properly tune a car which is a waste of time. Like I just want to race, not play a Mechanic Simulator. But I guess that's the reason why Forza is different than the other racing games. So yeah, this tuning part is still good, just hate it a little.This Premium stuffs, does not feel like Premium. The cars that comes with the Premium are garbage. Like literally. I feel like I can get those cars even if I just buy the Standard edition.Another thing I hate is the lack of customization, I am talking about the spoilers, skirts, bumpers, and stuffs. Like why can't I customize my exhaust? My hood? And why are so little options? Maybe I just have to download Need for Speed if I want customizations. Maybe it's just me? This is my first Forza game so I expected a lot and didn't really know much about this game. Also, add more cars. Why is there only 1 car in Infiniti? Why just add a Q60? What about the G35, G37, and Q50? You guys added a Veloster soooo where is the Genesis? Tiburon? Also, where is the widebody Charger? Where is the Camaro Iroc, I know that there's a Pontiac that looks like one. I know there are more than 500 cars in the game, half of it are old and ugly...so who want to drive those old and raggedy looking cars?Maybe it's because it's only been the 2nd week since its release? So I guess I just gotta wait. But yeah, all in all. This a good game, still gonna keep playing it to get better at tuning lol. Just please, add more options when customizing the looks of the vehicle. Still want to say great job to the people who made this game tho, thank you for all your hardwork. I give this game an 8/10. Still love the game tho and because of this game, I have learned that I should do an in-depth research about a game before buying it.

author: OverPro
review: Forza Horizon 5 is a deep and nuanced car nirvana for revheads and auto geeks to endlessly collect, tinker, and experiment. Itâ€™s also an extremely accessible buffet of racing spectacle open to everyone, from Deluxe Edition diehards to Game Pass nomads â€“ no matter their driving skill or mechanical knowledge. Itâ€™s an occasionally goofy but always earnest Valentine to Mexicoâ€™s world-famous culture, and a romantic ode to the magic of road-tripping through postcard-perfect vacation vistas. Itâ€™s a long haul, MMO-inspired racer thatâ€™s exploding with more races, activities, and event types than can comfortably fit on some parts of the map â€“ and yet it still always feels relaxed rather than daunting. It never locks you into something you donâ€™t want to do and steadily rewards you for however you choose to play it. It looks beautiful, it sounds magnificent, and it is glorious to play. Yes, Forza Horizon 5 is a lot of things. Above all, however, it is the result of a racing studio at the peak of its craft and the best open-world racing game Iâ€™ve ever played.MASTERPIECE 10/10Forza Horizon 5 is the result of a racing studio at the peak of its craft and the best open-world racing game available.

author: Dhruba.prime
review: You can't go wrong with a Forza Horizon game. At the moment there are some bugs but they are not so atrocious that you will skip the game. The car mechanics, the scenery, the music are enough to hook you in. Plus the DLCs will be coming. This is one hell of a successor to the grand Forza Horizon 4.

author: Austad
review: Forza Horizon 5 is the latest addition to the Forza Horizon series. It is a great game with a beautiful landscape and amazing graphics. Except mountains and stuff in the distance look bad even if you are on a High-End system like me playing on 1440p/4K at High/Ultra/Extreme.There is lots to do and many cars. I mostly drive around.The game had it's issues at launch; bugs, glitches/exploits and online issues, however many have been resolved. No problems as of rewriting this review.Plays well with steering wheel, although 1st person view the steering wheel barely moves, it just doesn't add up to how much you are actually steering. It should turn as far as your steering wheel does. Is it the best Forza Horizon game to date?Depends. This is personal preference of course, but in many ways Forza Horizon 3 is better than Forza Horizon 5, and vice versa. One thing that is better in FH3 is the map. FH3's map is beautiful and has many different areas to explore, including; jungles, deserts, and a big city, and a few smaller towns, FH5 on the other hand has a beautiful big map, which is good, the size is better than every other Forza Horizon game, but I don't like the city, it's boring and kinda sucks. I also feel like I'm driving the same places most of the time, which I didn't really feel like I was in FH3.FH5 has a good long and straight highway (unlike FH4, that one really sucked). Customization still SUCKS, hire some people from the NFS team or something, even the Crew 2 is better at customizing, and the Crew 2 sucks as a car game, arcade or not, and is okay at anything else. NFS also sucks lately with weird unrealistic handling and so on, but at least they got customization and not Forza Aero, even the new FM8 struggles with this... "lots of customization" (continues to show Forza Aero).Both expansion packs have come out. Personally I'm once again disappointed. Forza Horizon DLCs almost always sucks. We got Hot Wheels (again) and I didn't even touch it since I don't care about it, but I do however care about spending 100$ on this game knowing the game will be good, but merely hoping for the DLCs to be good, and what do I get? Hot Wheels again... To be fair I sort of liked the FH3 Hot Wheels DLC, I played it a bit, but I was also a kid back then, so I can see why they chose what they chose, but just like with most cars that get added in to the game they just do the same all over again. There are minus points for adding in cars as "new content" that were in the previous game... they ALWAYS do, but the new RS6, M3, Koenigsegg CCX and CC850S, Bugatti Chiron Pur Sport, and perhaps some more normal cars like Audi A4, A6 and BMW 3-series? No. There isn't Alfa Romeo in the game either, huge disappointment.Latest DLC is the rally DLC... if I want rally I'd go play Dirt 5... this doesn't even interest kids like Hot Wheels and Lego does. It's just a boring low effort DLC for a game that isn't a rally game, yes you can offroad, but it still isn't a rally game in any way. Do better Forza Devs.I literally could of bought Dirt 5 on sale if I just bought the Standard or Deluxe Edition of FH5 at launch anyways.It was worth full price at launch, now only buy on sale, and unless you want the DLCs because they seem good to you or if you only want that Hennesey Venom F5 you get from owning Hot Wheels DLC then get Ultimate Edition, if not buy Deluxe Edition for car pass and some other stuff. Recommended buy on sale (50% or better).I'd expect Forza Horizon 6 in autumn 2024.Awards: - Most anticipated game award at E3- Steam Awards 2021 | Outstanding Visual StyleMetacritic: 92

author: A Soda Nater
review: TLDR : if you want to drive around with friends and race one another, its a perfect game for it.Servers are as stable as they shouldve been right away at launch, everything is much smoother, post launch update has been pretty good though lacking way too many JDM cars. Everything is littered with western stuff and copies thereof.However, theres still alot of issues I personally find to be really annoying.- bots are still stupid op- memory leak is still a pretty glaring issue- not enough older JDM cars- cant remove barn find vehicles- the map gets boring real quick- graphical issues where artifacts keep popping in and out of existence are still happening from time to time, even with updated drivers.+ going up and down the mountain pass road doesnt get old.I've alot more issues I could list but i'll stop at this. It is ultimately a better game than what it was on release, but I cannot from the bottom of my heart reccomend this if youre looking for random social interactions, unless you find a group online, on discord, or if your friends could join you for a drive and races, your fun is not gonna last long.FH4 still has better map design imo, much more verticality, variation, and the dirt roads there are incredibly superior.

author: Silento
review: The game's graphics are fantastic, in my opinion the best graphics in any racing game, performance and handling is great, they sounds of the vehicles have also improved drastically. Campaign is decent, the variety of cars is good and the challenges are fun. However every new game comes with it's bugs, and on this game the bugs are quite annoying.Multiplayer connectivity is terrible, people randomly disappear and reappear, you get randomly disconnected from online serversThe eliminator  - finding servers sometimes takes a bit of time, most of the time the players disappear out of the map and if you get lucky to see them in the game without the help of the map you can't even challenge them. There's this bug where you race a player and you get to the finish line, but the actual finish line is nowhere to be found, so you just wait for the time to be over and you get kicked out immediately along with your rivalGAME CRASHES - the most annoying part of this game are the random crashes, it also doesn't tell you the reason for the crash. DO NOT put wide tires and a wide kit on the car because your game will crash (not on every car), don't try to remove your body kit because it will also crash your game, sometimes even when you're trying to change the grip of your tires crashes your game. There are a lot of unpleasant crashes that ruin the experienceStarting up game - When i'm starting my game (big picture) in the menu I have to alt + tab in order for my game to load.Some retro super cars have an outdated look, as far as I know the supra has a manual gearbox, so is the r33, the guy just holds his steering wheel while changing gears, but that's just a tiny problem and it's nowhere near as problematic as the other problems I've have addressed. The good thing is that i'm expecting the devs to fix all of these issues. I'm not gonna bother crying about the goliath or the taycan glitch, because they're just fun and some people don't have the time to grind the game all day and just wanna get the cars they desire. Although these bugs could be annoying at some points, if you try to avoid them, the game is really fun and enjoyable.

review: Ok... where do i start?First of all the more updates we get, the more unstable the game itself.Second, they literally don't give a damn about online modes! i mean they don't give a damn about cheaters!Third, they still didn't add team racing modes! i mean they introduce this game with their focus on social interaction, for example online team adventure on FH 4 where you can racing together with your friends againts other team. but why they delete it?? that doesn't make any sense!On top of that, the dev are lazy, they always recycling content from older series without improving it.The game is actually good, the graphics is good, if you're not into racing elements or competitive racing and you're alone and don't have any friends.but for someone like me that love competitive racing without racing simulator and stick into controller, i suggest don't buy it. and buy Forza Horizon 4 if you looking racing with your teammate or your bros.

author: hunterz263
review: I don't play racing games that much, but this one is different. I played a bit of Forza Horizon 4, but this one really nails the formula. There is so much customization, so many events, and it has some amazing cars. Progression is great and makes you feel rewarded no matter what you do. It is a game I can recommend easily simply because it gives you dopamine no matter what you choose to do. Forza Horizon 5 is a game that just wants you to have fun, no matter what you do, and I can easily say it nails that mission. From the Horizon Events that have you racing literal airplanes, just down to the XP signs and exploration, Horizon 5 just gives you happy juice no matter what. And its community has made some absolutely jaw-dropping car designs and vinyls that you can download and enjoy on your favorite cars. The amount of cars is staggering also, and the game is extremely generous when handing them out. By the first hour, you will have amassed some beautiful cars and that is just the beginning. There is much to unlock.The design editor is also extremely robust and friendly. There are many tools to get your car looking the way you want. Even if you aren't good at creating vinyl groups, you can download pre-made ones from the community and put them on any car you want. It is truly amazing just how much content there is in just customizing your cars appearance, and that doesn't even cover the absolute maddeningly detailed tuning system. Plus, if you do want to customize your car, it is extremely easy to understand and use, but an extraordinarily powerful tool if you master it.Finally the graphics. There is not much to say other than this game is the definition of paradise on earth. So many beautiful locations to explore. From mystic waterfalls, down to arid desert regions, to beautiful beaches, and deep into lush, rainy jungles. Forza Horizon 5 is a game that will make you step on the brakes and just marvel at its beauty, which is only enhanced by some impressive rain and dust storms.As for performance, for me performance has been buttery smooth. However, your mileage may vary based on reviews I have read, but to me this game is extremely well optimized and can maintain a smooth 60FPS easily without issues on the absolute highest graphics settings, RTX enabled. Never once have I encountered frame drops or chugging, nor have I crashed once. For a game as large as this, with this many cars and detailed environments, it is almost magical how this game can run so smooth. The developers at Playground Games are absolute wizard when it comes to optimization. My only gripe with this game comes down to monitization. As you can see on the Steam page, there is a VIP pass, a season pass, and a car pass. The Forza series is known for having some pretty bad monitization, but this isn't really an issue here in my opinion. I bought just the regular edition of Forza Horizon 5, and so far, there has been no reason to buy the car pass or VIP pass. All of the cars you get with the Car Pass can be obtained in the game pretty easily without hours of grinding. Leveling up is also extremely fair and you will be getting a new car probably every 40 minutes to an hour. There's also no way to purchase Wheelspins with real money, which is always a plus. This game may have monitization, but considering how much content is there, and the fact they don't let you purchase Wheelspins with real money is a massive win to me. Even if you aren't a racing game fan, I still recommend you check it out. You may be surprised just how approachable this game is and how addictive it can be. There is so much accessibility for everyone, and it is nice to have a game that just rewards you for doing stuff you want to do.  You will never struggle with what to do because everything you do in this game is rewarding, satisfying and fun. It is a game I am glad I paid $60 for and have no buyer's remorse, unlike with a lot of other games that came out this mouth.Give Forza Horizon 5 a go, and enjoy the absolute happiness this game will give you. And just remember, if you are not sure what to do, just hit the accelerator. You'll find your way to something truly satisfying on the horizon.

author: Detale
review: I covered a Ford F-450 in pink camo and life size anime girl on each size, completely overhauled under the hood, and accidentally created an oversized dirt racing GOD.Game is overall BEAUTIFUL, and as competitive or chill as you want it to be. An excellent game, I don't regret spending a single penny.

author: Dev
review: Truly the greatest car/racing/open world franchise of all time. Rarely do games just get it perfect out of the gate, and PG and the Horizon franchise has shown for years that they can always deliver. It'll always be worth your money and time and it's hands down my favorite game of all time.

They fixed almost all bugs for stability, (ESPECIALLY CRASHING)2. They removed they super wheelspins from most cars (especially Willys Jeep).3. My game does crash once in a while along with  some VRAM  issues where I loose textures and experience FPS drops. It really just depends on if you want to play the game now and get ahead of everyone else or wait until they polish the game out more.

author: ryanlion013
review: Don't get me wrong, this game is so much fun when it works. However, it struggles to do so, with frequent crashes and the worst online that I have ever seen in a video game I can not recommend this game until it is in a playable state. I'm tired of companies releasing half-baked games instead of just releasing them when they are ready.

author: Redwood
review: EDIT: Game-breaking multiplayer bugs that still haven't received a patch and wont till atleast the end of the week as of writing this review. This is crazy. I have never seen a game launch this broken and the developer delay the hotfix for this long. Me and my friends cant even drive together because of the dissapearing bug that is affecting EVERYONE.Falls short of what I excepted as a next step in the franchise. Especially considering the time gap from FH4.I love the horizon series, but with every new release it seems as if the game is progressing at a shockingly low pace for things that fans have been asking for since FH2... We are getting the bare minimum solely for marketing material to get us to come back and buy the game.-  (suprisingly poor collection considering they added them last series. Alot of us were expecting much more selection this year, but no)- (definitely an awesome feature, but in its current state no one that plays my blueprints gets to see any objects I place allowing them to bypass ramps, etc... broken)-  (This map has a few incredible mountain roads)-  (really cool, but why cant we just change it to whatever width we like for every car. not certain widths only on certain cars? This is something need for speed has had for YEARS)- -  for things like stance cars. Allow full range track width adjustment and more camber options for a start. - . We already have player owned houses. How about being able to walk through your own garage/house to see your car collection / current car? We could upgrade the garage by buying a more expensive house, lots of possibilites here. I really really hope this is something that is integrated within this series eventually. Game changer. - - . Even just changing the color of the main stiching or leather would be enough. As someone who plays first person most of the time this really bothers me.-  Why is it that we have a general wing that fits on every car yet its literally the exact same wing design? Why not add a few variations that we can choose from? This cant be that difficult. Being a car guy and knowing car people that love this game we all absolutely despite the look of the ebay style forza wing. Please give us more general wing options for each car.- . I cant be the only one that finds it super ironic that the picture for the livery editor features a car with a livery you cant actually replicate in the game? (Windshield stickers all over it)- . Ability to change things like burble and backfire amount in the tuning section. - . I myself know how to tune cars but the fact that the tuning menu has looked identical for the past 5 games bothers me. It desperately needs a tutorial or easier interaction for new players that are terrified by it and don't know how to properly do anything that could be necessary when creating something like a drift car.- . But I feel as though this games map does a good job-  not my cup of tea but should be an incredibly easy feature to add.- . The cities in all games have felt extrodinarily lifeless and need some sort of crowds (that obviously jump out of the way if you try to hit them like in past racing games to keep it rated E). - . We have so many options to customize our character yet we cant even go anywhere? We already have drone and photo mode which means that walking around in first person is extremely possible. This would be great for things like online car meets. Not a must but would be a great feature. - . For a game that constantly shoves us offroad and presents us with these cool new offroad vehicles and trucks. The rock and object climbing physics are laughably bad. Its almost like the suspension model or hit box model itself is just completely broken. And there are definitely things i'm missing on both sides. The games current network connectivity problems make it unplayable with friends unless you are strictly doing races. I hope the day one patch fixes all issues and brings it back to the okay game it should be. - Great graphics- Decent races- Great mountain roads- Beautiful Map- Lifeless Cities- Badly rubber banding drivatars. Worse than any other previous Forza. Dont set difficulty to expert otherwise they will magically gain 500 hp in a straight line even though you're in the exact same car.- Loads of network problems

author: Dinkus
review: Coming from FH4 and previous Horizon installments + Motorsport 2, 3, 4 and 6 i can safely say that Forza Horizon 5 is already a masterpiece on it's own.Horizon 5 is (so far) the most beautiful racing game i personally have ever played.The game offers so much more then say FH4, the map is absolutely humongous, i don't know how they did it but props to the developers. What's also interesting, there will be 2 more additional maps to this game that will release on a later date or so i have heard. My first reaction was: How? that's insane!!The car sounds in general (meaning i'm saying this with caution) are so much better if not perfection compared to Horizon 4.The environment sounds are also beefed up and on top of that, all the little details like blow off valves turbo whistling ect. are spot on!Honestly i can't put this game down!!---- However, like with previous Horizon games (i think), Horizon 5 also comes with its little bug's like the Connection lost errorand a new one which can happen randomly is; your car while driving can suddenly reset? meaning, if you are doing a skill combo or driving at insane speeds, your car will re-spawn in roughly the same location and your skill combo will be gone.Frustrating? i know. Hopefully the developers are working on either of these bugs so we can enjoy a smoother game-play in the future. ----The above described issues have been fixed with the newest update AND MOREthis update rolled out on November the 18th.you can read all about it on their official twitter page or do a google search.** i can confirm the game is running butter smooth for me now **when someone reads this short review and hasn't bought the game yet..if anything, buy the ultimate edition and you won't be disappointed.cheers*EDIT*: Ofcourse once the bug(s) are dealt with -as in fixed, i will automatically update my small review. But for now i think people should know this information before they buy the game.there might be other bug(s) or error(s) that i haven't experienced yet or never will experience (hopefully) *so please keep that in mind*!!For now though, lets enjoy this wonderful game together shall we?
