author: kilÃ©sengati
review: Overall, it's a good game - more of ! The map is larger, more detailed and delivers more variety. I've never been to Mexico, but this is what I expect to be an idealised version of smalltown Mexico to be. There are less cars than in FH4, but I assume more will be added back in again as the game progresses over time. When it comes to game modes, some things got changed-up a bit, but it's a slight step-down as it currently lacks ranked modes.The game suffers from many technical issues a game of that price shouldn't upon release. I mainly noticed connectivity issues mostly in freeroam as well as sudden weather changes during races and lighting issues in caves and tunnels. The latter two are of cosmetic nature, but the former is seriously hampering freeroam playability. Again, it's a great game, but for its price it's only fair to expect a flawless and feature-complete experience, which FH5 in its current state doesn't achieve. No matter how prevelent the practice of releasing unpolished titles is within the industry, it's always a reason for a thumbs down - especially when the game comes from big developers and publishers.Speaking about achieving things: Some achievements within the creative section are locked behind ridiculously high download and upvote numbers, which means they are quite possibly unachievable unless you are an influencer or doing elaborate and possibly legally questionable anime and replica liveries. But hey, life is just a big algorithmic lotteryâ¸®This must be the brainchild of some alien lizardmen only knowing office culture and social media. Thinking more about it, the thing with forced online interaction got worse since FH4. Humans like forced interaction, don't theyâ€½ ðŸ‘½ðŸ––

author: dankdirtydiabeetus
review: Overall I think it's a good game. The dialog is pretty cheesy and annoying, not quite to the levels of need for speed but damn close. The driving mechanics are great, and Forza set the bar pretty high with Horizon 4, but for some reason the feel is just better in this game, like I have so much more control of the car and more grip. The Graphics (if your card can keep up) are pretty impressive as well. Overall a decent game that I have enjoyed so far.

author: DKM
review: Absolutely amazing game!  But they need to fix some pretty glaring bugs, such as the game randomly crashing the moment that I load into a race. Doesn't happen all the time, but happens way too often.Update: most bugs have been fixed and the game is way better for it. I now really only wish that they would add more one-off versions of cars like the Senna and P1. We really should get the GTR versions of those as well as the super rare versions of other cars that are already in the game. I also hope they work on some of the engine sounds, some of them are clearly computer generated and definitely not recorded from a real car. Although most stock exhaust systems do appear to be real recordings of the real car. One last thing, and I know it may not apply to a large portion of the player-base, but it does effect me, PLEASE for the love of god make it so that the game works with the RPM lights on my Logitech G923 wheel! I'm really just nit-picking at this point, but it really is a great game and if these things got fixed, it would be that much closer to perfection! I really do stand behind this game and think that anyone considering it should try it!

author: Weak Sauce
review: Enjoyed the **** out of the intro!Then the game crashed.Enjoyed the intro, again.Then the game crashed, again.9/10 will try the intro a third time at a later dateIf they fix the game crashes (that many other reviewers have pointed out), I'm all in!  Until then, refunded.12/11/21 Update:So I repurchased the game last night, got through the intro, created my character, and raced around like a giddy school girl for over two hours without any issues whatsoever.  Today, I launch the game and as soon as I get into a car to drive it around, the game crashes.  I've made many attempts today to get around or overcome the crashes without success. Refunded a second time.  I really dont understand wtf is going on.  Such a disappointment.

author: The Noodle Bandit
review: Forza Horizon has never looked better! The biggest and most detailed map they've created to date with some of the most breathtaking visuals you could have in a game period. The cars look and sound fantastic and are an absolute joy to drive. The game's library of cars is extremely large with over 500 to choose from! I'm sure your dream/favourite cars are there. The story is also really fun and the most interactive one they've made so far with separate Festivals each unlocking their own types of races.The only thing that I'm even remotely unsatisfied with would be the technical side of the game. There are a handful of bugs (Which I'm sure will be flattened out in the near future) but the one thing I think they've messed up with, would be the way they've handled the online free roam. Your friends/convoy will disappear quite frequently so if you drive around with friends or like to drift with friends and other people this tends to break the flow.That being said, this game is an visual masterpiece with a humongous map to explore, has plenty of activities for you to take on and will have you driving around in Mexico smiling all the way. I highly recommend this game to everyone!!

author: Meihem
review: There is no progression in this game. There are hundreds of cars, and the only way to make that manageable for the average player is to make it plenty easy to collect cars. It is no challenge to collect cars, and because of the wheelspins and stuff there is no point in racing for money.That being said, most of the fun that I have had in this game isn't about getting the best and fastest cars, but about trying many of the cars in the game and customizing them and racing with them. It's definitely a sort of make your own fun type of experience. Racing in a 2002 Honda Civic isn't everyone's idea of cool, but to me it's pretty cool to be able to mod and paint cars how I want and be able to get them up to snuff with higher classes.Especially if you love retro or classic cars, there's a ton of them in this game and you can customize races to be just cars from a certain decade or whatever. This game has a lot of customization, for cars and race events, and the Unbeatable AI isn't too bad, but you will be beating it if you use meta cars.Which there are meta cars, its no secret. I think using the same car every race defeats the purpose of having almost 500 cars in the game, but it's a reason to avoid online Horizon Open S2 races especially.Not to mention the game looks and plays wonderfully

author: CptCookiediet
review: I have some minor issues with this game. I get disconnected quite frequently despite having a good and stable connection, but I remember similar issues with FH4 and since I'm mostly a solo player it doesn't really affect me all that much. What's a little more annoying is after 2 hours or so of playing the game it starts to stutter to a point it becomes unplayable (maybe some caching issue? dunno), but simply closing the game and restarting it fixes that issue for the next 2 hours or so. For some reason it feels smaller than the FH4 area even though it's said to be bigger. That being said, when I turn on my pc there's only one game I want to be playing and that's Forza Horizon 5. Despite my issues I just love driving around, getting more cars, more cash, more skillpoints, more experience and I don't see my farming ingame ending anytime soon.

author: SirRevolver
review: What a beautiful fun racing game. If you are looking on semi-realistic or arcade racing game. This is it. You can set up how you want to play. From raw control inputs and no assists to full on drive assist (basically car drives itself at that point). Great improvement on engine sounds compared to previous forza.Main character finally can speak! No more weird cutscenes of mute person staring at speaker.Improved character customisation: Not only there's more but now you can actually buy common stuff and more rare pieces are achievement rewards or wheelspin rewards.Gigantic and nicely detailed map.If you liked FH3 or FH4 you are going to love this game.

author: SideWays
review: I would give it a 3/5 in its current state. I had some initial trouble with crashing repeatedly in the intro, but I eventually figured out it was a piece of recording software running in the background that I had forgotten about. After that I lost my progress because I was not linked to my Xbox account during a session. Its alright, but not as good as it could be. I had set my expectations to fh3 levels, but this is closer to the previous game in terms of play time and story. I disliked the lack of classic cars, especially European classics. after playing a bit and having saved some credits, I took a look in the shop to be greeted by no Alfa Romeos, Fiats, Lancias, and very few older porches or British roadsters. They supplemented this largely with new models alongside truly enormous amounts of american muscle cars to bump up the total, and I'm not a huge fan. they also removed the handy "upgrade heroes" tab, which I found rather pointless. Now its harder to tell which cars have or do not have body kits and major visual upgrades, despite this being featured prominently in forza's promotional content. There isn't enough room on this review for the bugs, but the official bug report page is hundreds of items long. One in particular has been rather annoying, a visual bug that makes the game look like its rendered in much lower res textures than in reality. trees look like brown sticks with some green spikes on top, grass disappears entirely, and hills are shaped of play-dough. overall, this game could be a lot better if they iron out the bugs and cater to a larger audience of enthusiasts.

author: diegofkda
review: Forza Horizon 5 has been so far all I can honestly ask from an open-world racing game. A fully featured, diverse and gorgeous map, top-tier sound system, incredible graphics... And the list goes on. Playground Games decided to take an extra year developing a Horizon game, and it really shows. The physics improvement is no joke, I've been driving with a steering wheel and the experience has been incredible. The story is actually compelling (within Forza parameters, it is no Last of Us). It is also far from perfect; some bugs took over the release, and some details from FH4 went missing, like the glowing red brake discs when you brake, or the paddle-shift animation. But the physics, the improvement in force-feedback and the overhaul of the Horizon story all make up for it.As a fellow simracer and a gamer, I can confidently say that Forza Horizon 5 is a decent simcade, a great game and simply, the best car open-world title to date. If you're broke, maybe wait for a sale. If you have 60 bucks laying around that you would otherwise spend on gifting Nitro subscriptions to e-girls, use the money to seek therapy. If you are already too broken inside and you have no fix, this game would at least allow you to cruise around thinking about what went wrong with your life decisions with incredible graphics. Solid recommend.

author: frkshw
review: 8.9 hours, not including my offline playtime. (Playing since Friday)While I do recommend this game, at this moment most of the time you're gonna play with Horizon Solo instead of being online (strangely enough I was able to play The Eliminator with online people, it seems that this game mode is stable).Graphics are visually stunning. I'm able to play it on Extreme setting with Raytracing on High (highest) settings with above 75 FPS average on 1080p (usually sitting in between 70-99 FPS) on my RTX 3060. I've taken some screenshots of the game.I believe the performance of the game can still be improved as there are still random crashes and frequent FPS drops, and I hope that online connectivity gets fixed too.While the soundtrack ain't for everybody, I really liked it, as surprisingly I had some favorite artists and bands present in there (Foo Fighters, DIIV, deadmau5, Porter Robinson to name a few) and Hospital Records... man that drum and bass just fits well.I would've given this game a perfect 10, if not for the bugs present. Understandably it's still the first official week of FH5, so let's hope for the best.See you in MÃ©xico!

author: n1ckn4m3
review: I love driving cars fast in real life, but for whatever reason I have a hard time falling into racing games -- the Forza Horizon series, however, has always been my jam.  Something about how they present the content and the blend of sim/arcade racing makes it significantly more "fun" than most other racing games are.  I appreciate the somewhat light-hearted approach and silly, over-the-top set-piece story missions and everything, as well as the fact that it's always a tent-pole game as far as graphics are concerned.FH5 is no exception -- it takes the already lush and gorgeous visuals from FH4 and amps them up even higher, adding RTX support and a significant expansion in draw distance and landscape design.  Running on a current gen GPU, you should be able to get 4k/HDR@>60fps with ultra quality settings with no issues -- I'm on an i9-10900k with a 3080Ti and the game absolutely _smokes_ in 4K on the hardware -- even at 2x MSAA with RTX on high I'm averaging above 70fps.  A lot of work has been done to ensure  consistent frame-pacing as well.Oh, plus it has the Warthog from Halo and the Delorean DMC-12, so it gets an additional gold star.A lot of people have had issues with the online, but outside of a couple disconnects here or there throughout the 10 hours or so I've been playing, I haven't had any real issues.

author: CallMeKP123
review: Horizon, this is MEXICO!This game is absolutely stunning! Can barely distinguish the difference between real life and this game. In fact, I'd even argue that playing this game on Extreme settings (Everything cranked all the way up), this game looks better than real life!The cars sound and feel spectacular and each car I have driven feels unique and upgrades only make that gap bigger.This game is huge with loads to do which will keep you playing for a long time!Once again, Playground Games have created one hell of a driving game and world which I look forward to spending many many MANY more hours in! (Written at 4.8hrs)Update: I'm now at 13.6hrs in to Horizon 5 and have done some more of the events and unlocked as few more cars, houses, side stuff etc. and I'm still having a blast. Playing with both a controller or a steering wheel (I have the Logitech G920) is super fun!  A game you can sit, chill out and play for a few hours and not get bored. Also, The Goliath race.... BEAUTIFUL! It took me like 13 mins to complete and it's the longest Horizon race ever made so far. Takes you what seems to be all around the map and my oh my is it beautiful! Playing on the highest of settings on an RTX 3080 and Ryzen 9 3900X and it runs beautifully!

author: bot.dÃ¸c
review: [REVIEW UPDATED]After discovering Forza Horizon 4 last year (shame on me I was so late to the party) and loved it, I told myself that as soon as FH5 will be available, I will buy it. And I did it. I even preordered it so I can download it early to play ASAP. Full price on Steam, 60 Euros. Told myself that if it will be at least as good as FH4, it will worth every cent. Long story short, it's not...yet!So I entered in a beautiful game with nice graphics and great music just to find a sh*t load of bugs. 2 weeks passing (meanwhile players abusing all kinds of bugs to jump the leaderboard) and the first big bugfix arrives. It made the game a little more "playable". At least now the Online part of the game works. After this, small bugfixes arrived with some bugs fixed, but most of them ignored. Now, after 3 months of existence, you would think it addressed most of the game-breaking bugs, right? NO! Here is what is wrong with this game now: 1. Game crashes when you exit the garage. Still no fix after 3 months!2. Stuttering after a time ingame. It appears the game doesn't know how to clear old cache and it burdens the graphics card. Still no fix. 3. The house you buy with 5 million credits to get 1 free daily spin doesn't give you a free spin daily! It gives you a free daily spin when the game wants, if the game wants. 4. THIS IS, FOR ME, THE WORST PART! The Support Team is understaffed/overburdened/ignorant. Hear me out: Last week, after 100+ hours of gameplay, I enter FH5 just to see the intro screen letting me choose a name and with all my progress lost. No cars, no level, no credits, no forza points, nothing. I contacted the Forza Support Team via ticket system, Twitter and Facebook and after 1 week I don't have any answer. Not a single word. And I'm stuck now with 100+ hours of progession lost and I can't just jump into the game and redo all the races, all the achievements, buy all the cars. I just can't. [UPDATE] After 1 week of tickets & messages on social media I've recieved a reply from Support Team. After that, I've deleted the save files, reinstalled the game and waited another 3 days until I've got this message:After that I've recieved 500+ messages on Forza with each car, clothing, horn, forza link and credit I've ever owned. In conclusion, I've lost the level, progression, accolades, car tunes and Forza Points. But I've recovered the cars and the credits. [/b]Note to everybody: BACKUP LOCALLY YOUR SAVEFILES![/b]This game is still full of bugs that MAYBE in the near future will be fixed. Sadly, it is 4 months after the release and they haven't resolved the main bugs.Now, after a year, the game still have issues. But it's ok.

author: Neme
review: Later edit: don't bother with the game, it's not worth it and fixes seem to make game worse instead of better. Wait 1 year, maybe it will have solved most of the issues. The game, in it's current state, is about a 7/8 out of 10. It's basically Horizon 4 with improvements to the graphical engine and physics engine. The new location is great, the biomes are outstanding and you have much more freedom than you had in Horizon 4. You don't have to go through a 4-6h tutorial that doesn't allow you to play with friends. After a few introductory races, you can start playing with friends, which brings us to the bad.. connectivity issues. The game right now is plagued by connectivity issues, random disconnects from the servers, alert error messages that don't display anything, friends not being able to play races due to those disconnects.. it's pretty bad, but solvable. There are also issues with memory leaks (which lead to poor performance or crahes), random and not so random crashes (like when changing parts on your car or bodykits multiple times) and texture quality issues when playing the game a bit longer. The other problem in the game is AI, which is infuriating sometimes. If you played Horizon 4 on Unbeatable or Pro difficulty, expect a shock. AI is just cheating, right in front of your eyes, with cars being on rails on higher difficulties, which cheapens your experience. Get ready to play on Highly Skilled difficulty for a time, if you want to win races :).With all being said, i still recommend the game, i enjoy it and i expect that these problems are solved in maybe.. 3 months tops?

author: Mr Banana
review: I am so surprised and upset with this release. Don't get me wrong the game seems very good gameplay wise (would probably be my favourite out of all 5 in the future) but there are just so many bugs it makes the game unplayable. To make clear I am trying to play with a friend which is what causes a lot of the issues so if you plan to play by yourself you will be hit with a lot less issues. Main Issues:Difficult to connect to a convoy (server issues)Once eventually in a convoy it takes ages for friends to join the session (server issues)Once in the session friends cars disappear every 5-15 seconds for between 10 seconds and 5 minutes (server issues)The textures are bugged when on the highest settingsThere are frequent frame rate drops in online sessions (fine in horizon solo)The car will just randomly slam to a holt at times The game has been crashing but not as bad for me as it has been for othersDraw distance is terribleMany LOD issuesAntialiasing doesn't workVIP status is removed quite often but is fixed by tabbing out and tabbing back inThose are the issues I have had however I have read of many more. Sounds like the game doesn't stay open for more than 2 minutes if you have an AMD graphics card or have bought on windows store. I have the Premium Edition edition and haven't been able to make use of many of the advantages to this edition and so therefore I am refunding the game. It feels to me like this game has had very little testing and I feel like I have paid for a Beta. I will more than likely get the game again in the future when it has been fixed but for now I want the money back.

author: TheMoo
review: Ok,  obviously, the game is fantastic from a technical standpoint,  graphics, updated sound compared to the prior version  -  Forza fans know what to expect here.  We now also have a story again,  at least,  much more of one than in the 4th installment.   That said,  it's the intangibles that does it for me.   The game gives an insane sense of accomplishment after you spend the time working out a build, fine tuning the settings therein,  and finally unleash it on to the Rivals leaderboard -  landing yourself a top 1% spot globally out of over 90,000 others just feels great because you know you earned that.   You have to work for it, putting in a flawless lap without any collisions or the like, and this is far easier said than done when you're wrangling 1000+ hp through chicanes, twists and various elevation changes.   The Horizon series leans more into the arcade side of things,  but the simulation roots of the Motorsport series are undeniable - this makes it one of those racers that are easy to pick up, but hard to master.

author: Igloo Arsonist
review: Imagine going to a restaurant. You order their premium 100$ VIP pizza. First ever of its kind. And you paid extra and get to try it before anyone else.. It looks delicious. And your friends came along to enjoy it with you. But it comes out and is half cooked, and the meat on it is still raw and there is some glass in it. You complain. Awhile later, they tell you as long as you remove the meat and glass and dough and sift the rest of it through a strainer, it might still be edible, and they will "work on" making you a better one that has a little less glass in it. You do what they suggest, and still inadvertently eat some glass and the raw meat gets bacteria in the wounds, so you get horribly sick as you slowly bleed out from your insides. You die. When did the gaming industry get to a point where releasing something that doesnt work become so normal? In no other industry would something like this fly, who decided it was acceptable? Its like everyone wants to reopen those wounds Anthem left behind and remind me that any game could be the next disaster, because its ok to publish half finished projects and actual garbage in the gaming industry.Im not saying Forza itself is garbage. The game is beautiful and is the racing game ive been waiting for. But the state it is in.. Thats the garbage. Stop normalizing games literally not functioning when they release.Ill gladly change this review when i can play the game as it was advertised.If you want this game id wait a hot minute for the online features and constant crashes to get fixed

author: Foxerino
review: This has been the best Horizon game since 3 for me. I'm not saying Horizon 4 is a terrible game, but I feel like map and how they handled certain aspects of 4 made me clock in way less time than any other Horizon game I played, including the first one. Forza Horizon 5 however feels like a proper follow up.Forza Horizon 5's map in Mexico is beautiful, like VERY beautiful, and unlike 4, it's very diverse with locations and biomes, such as the lush jungles, sandy dunes and rocky volcano. With it also being the largest map out of all the Horizon games, there's more than enough to explore. Plenty of dirt, asphalt and open land for all the types of races too. It's just very fun to drive around in this game, as there aren't random patches of 1 inch piles of rocks that'll dead stop you.I'm not really too much of a car nerd, but the fact we have 500+ cars means there's definitely a car or few that'll appeal to your tastes, and still has that ridiculous Forza customization where you can slap a V12 into a El Camino. If you're a car collector you'll definitely be busy in this game.Along with performance upgrades with the car, we still have the sort of great vinyl editor, and being able to slap liveries of replica real life cars or probably what half of you reading this are gonna do which is anime girl liveries. We still have 3000 layers to mess with in the vinyl and design editor, which is more than plenty to make amazing things provided you can spare the time to do so. I was hoping there to be more shapes or some kind of improvements to it, but it still works fine as is.Horizon Adventure is the "story" of this game. It's how you'll be unlocking the various festival sites, the showcase events, and the extremely long races such as cross country's The Titan or road racing's The Goliath. The initial expeditions are kinda cool, such as the one to unlock road racing events, but good lord the rest of it is a pain in the ass. You have to unlock accolades to progress which is easy enough, but every time you unlock a new thing, the game forcefully stops whatever you're doing in free roam (including breaking skill chains, drift zones, etc.). Not to mention the dialogue, my god. It's not terrible but it's very annoying. It's that usual corporate friendly stuff where they play it safe, and everyone is super friendly and make very poor jokes, with there being barely any effort put into the voice dialogue. What doesn't help is that now YOUR player character talks, with either being british or a woman, those are your ONLY two choices. Not like it matters anyways, once you're done with the Horizon Stories and Adventure, you'll barely hear lick of any dialogue from your character or others, so it almost seems pointless to give your character a voice. Speaking of british, not to meme or anything but if we're in Mexico, why is more than half the cast British?Character customization is also back and it's kind of just whatever? You barely see your character and they barely stand out anyways, the only time where the customization is meaningful is the ported over and EXTREMELY DATED showboating and victory emotes. You know the ones. Hotline Bling dance, dabbing, the WHIP AND NAE NAE. I only found two new ones, and  one that they haven't brought back (like it even matters but it's pretty funny) because of the whole Alfonso Ribeiro dance scare (Carlton Banks from Fresh Prince of Bel Air. Basically he was getting all pissy about Fortnite a few years back having "his" dance as a emote so he was saying he was gonna sue and blah blah, but that obviously failed, but it made Microsoft/Playground Games piss their pants and they immediately took the dance out of Horizon 4 for everyone.)The online in this game is how it should've been day 1 in Horizon 4. Free for all, no team racing. It's fun for what it is, as it's pretty much A, S1 and S2 open class racing which are the popular classes (B class if you're doing dirt and cross country). However it's saddening once again the D, C, and B classes are ignored because of this, which will make a good portion of the cars useless as even upgraded to at least A class they won't perform well in that category. Though in the Playground Games online events, it could go as low as C class. It's odd with the choices they made, but then again they also took out map voting and vetoing in Halo so it seems every developer under Microsoft makes dumb decisions. Personally the car class and race type voting from Horizon 2 and 3 is still the best in my eyes.Going back to the online racing for a moment, they have brought all the improvements from 4 into this game which is for the better such as ghosting a player if a high-speed collision is detected because of a person trying to ram another player, or wall-collision slow down if a player drives too poorly or attempts to use the walls to their advantage.They also have the Eliminator, a battle royale with a car racing twist, which I haven't touched at all since 4 or even now in 5 yet, but it's another free mode and will be fun for a majority of people.Finally there's Horizon Tour which is a team of human players against mediocre drivatars. It's essentially The Trials from Horizon 4, but there's a 2 minute rotation for different kinds of events which I personally find to be a lot of fun since it makes use of the variety of vehicles in this game.Horizon Super 7 returns, a series of 7 player created challenges that you have to go through to get the reward listed in the menu. This mode is hit or miss as it doesn't really give much XP and I'm not sure the rewards reroll daily after you unlock the initial Super Wheelspin or if they refresh each time you fully complete the 7 challenges.The music in this game is pretty good on all fronts except maybe Horizon XS. Pulse and Bass Arena still have some pretty damn good bangers if you're into the music those radio stations offer, and Hospital Records SLAPS. Again I'm bringing up Horizon 4, but Hospital Records in that game was the WEAKEST out of all the games it was featured in. Hospital Records in this game only has one song that I don't really hate but it's kinda eh. (Bandicoot is the one)The last thing which I want to praise highly of is the blueprint and race editor, also known as Eventlabs in this game. If you're familiar with the Grand Theft Auto Online Race Creator, then it's practically this. You can create your own custom routes in the map, such as making your own version of the Goliath. Along with routes, they have various props to get very creative with, such as half pipes, jump pads, and platforms, so you can make really fun and unique courses if your creativity is good enough and you can spare the time! Just be wary that there is some kind of weird thing in the game currently that perhaps if your route is TOO complex with props, like have a lot of them in it, then upon loading the route the game might softlock, but I assume they'll release a patch for this soon.So what's the too long and didn't read final verdict of this game? If you like racing games, this is OBVIOUSLY a must buy. It's the best one since Horizon 3 in my opinion, the map is beautiful, has plenty of variety and the largest one so far. Plenty of cars to choose from with each of them being pleasant to drive. Amazing ways to show your creativity with tuning, designs and eventlab events. Great music and just overall a very good time. If you unsure about your purchase, it is on game pass for at most 10$ for a month. Just be wary that currently if you had previously created vinyls or designs from previous Motorsport or Horizon games and you buy the steam version, they currently can't be ported even if you use the same Microsoft/Xbox account to login.

author: Jin Kagekiyo
review: + Game is really fun on controller+ Map feels large and a lot of corners for drifting. Mountain area drift circuit is amazing.+ Playing co op events with friend is really fun and seamless when convoy leader starts event.+ Forzavista allows you to sit yourself in the car./ The push for the feeling of being in Mexico is heavily pushed with the voice overs throughout the game./ Photo mode is really nice, but have screenshot yourself or steam screenshot for local. Required to download app or use forza site to download uploaded screenshots, but not showing in my gallery for my account./ Huge section of the map feels like desert especially on the west side. The scenery isn't really pleasing to me there, but mountain, jungle and city is very diverse.- No Rocket Bunny kit- Advertised wheel support, but my G923PS does not fully work. I get the disconnect error. Vjoy work around allows you to use wheel, but does not give the full proper experience with accurate force feedback.- Draw distance is kind of funky. Feels like things pop up too close.- MSAA adds horizontal lines to my graphics- Game will crash randomly sometimes. I've had it crash when buying a car, loading a new destination, starting an event. It doesn't happen often to me. I've crashed probably 6 times within 26 hours.- Every time I drive towards my friend in the same session, both of our cars will ghost and we disappear off the map from each other randomly.1st PCCPU: AMD 5950xRAM: GSkill 64GB 3600GPU: EVGA 3090 KingpinDrive: Samsung 980 Pro m.2Screen: LG CX 4k 120hzAll settings are set to max except for MSAA because it added horizontal lines to the graphics for me. Game runs at 82FPS solid at 3840x2160 without overclocking. Game looks fine.2nd PCCPU: Intel i3-8350kRAM: Corsair 16GB 3000Drive: Samsung 860 Evo SSDScreen: LG Monitor 1080p 144hzLower end PC had 144fps at 1080p on high mode, but had issues when reaching mountain areas. Frames will sometimes drop to 72fps. The game will freeze for a second or two saying Low Bandwidth Streaming. The computer has to catch up on loading the terrain and assets. The game is great, but at the same time there are bugs and false advertisement for support of wheels. I have to give a recommended No for now because I really wanted to play this with a wheel. Don't advertise support for something that isn't supported and working. At least announce that you are working on the inclusion / support of it. The bugs feel minor to my experience once you get over the initial crashing due to antivirus or other things particular to your PC setup.EDIT:Wheel is now working because the disconnect issue is fixed. My Logitech 923PS is working with stock settings and its easy to just change the steering range to how you feel fit. I'm really enjoying the game now. I've changed my review to positive due to the fixes. This was one of the main issues why I got the game and I'm happy I can finally enjoy it.EDIT:Game is still fun, but I'm experiencing either hackers or bugs. I'm not seeing anyone in eliminator, but I'm getting challenged and always lose when near the finish line. I'm getting challenged with no one near me. I'm also having issues where Horizon Arcade isn't counting for season achievements. Both of these are really annoying when trying to do the season activities to get points for season cars.

review: It's a robust game, I loved the graphics and car handling, much better than NFS franchise haha, but it's not all rainbows and sunshine, there are so many things which are wrong. To begin with, Performance degrade after an hour of playing and you have to restart to get the same performance back ( its a known bug and people are working on it). author: Wet Noodle
review: It's Forza Horizon. If you liked 4, you'll like this one. The graphics are amazing but there are a lot of issues, both technically and with the core gameplay.New tire smoke physics are pretty good, especially if you're drifting. You can tell they put a lot more effort into drifting in this vs FH4. They also added some other cool customization like more tires (slicks vs semi-slicks) and transmissions (can now choose between 6 speed, 7 speed, all the way to 10). Nothing groundbreaking but a welcome improvement so your 1,500 hp Geo Metro or whatever is actually driveable. One glaring issue is the Driviatars, which need a serious adjustment. They've always been kinda screwy: difficulty level doesn't change the AI behaviors, it just allows them to cheat more and break the in game physics. That's always been the case but, for the most part, it still worked. In FH5, however, it's the worst I've ever seen it. On some races, the Unbeatable drivatars are literally unbeatable while other races, Unbeatable drivatars drive like children. Rubber banding is also more of an issue. Go ahead and set the difficulty to anything Expert or above and get in 3rd and about 1-3 seconds behind P2; you'll notice that P1 and P2 will start breaking physics and just fly ahead until they're literally 5-10 seconds ahead of you in a 3 minute race. It's pretty ridiculous when I have to tune the difficulty on a race-to-race basis because the devs screwed it up that much.I also don't really like the music in this one. There's a couple of good tracks but Pulse is just bad. I hear the same 3 songs the majority of the time and they're songs that literally repeat the same stanza 20 times over their 2 1/2 minute duration. It's not a huge problem, just kinda disappointing. It will occasionally repeat a song that it just had on as well. The music should pump me up, not annoy me.The "tuning" for a lot of other things seems a bit off as well. PR stunts like drift zones and speed zones have gotten a lot easier than FH4, on average. A lot of the challenges (the story ones that show up as yellow on your map) have gotten pretty easy too. With a few outliers, I've managed to get three stars on my first try for most of the PR stunts and story challenges I've done without even trying that hard (and I'm alright, but not THAT good). Online racing is also terrible. The ghosting mechanics are outright broken and make it so that clean racing is basically impossible. The only viable strat to actually win is to pump as much HP and an AWD drivetrain into a car and just rubber band your throttle trigger/pedal down for the whole race. Basically no punishment for taking people out so someone can ram you off course, make you miss a checkpoint and lose like 5-7 seconds while they just go on their merry way with no punishment whatsoever. It's a joke. Between the AI and online experience, they may as well classify this game as a demolition derby. They also removed any kind of ability to choose what kind of race you want to do unless you're already in a Convoy which, again, don't work. So if you really liked A class street racing in FH4, get ready to wait up to an hour to get into a session with 3 races and half the time, you join and it's already half done. Load times are also insanely long a lot of the time, minimum 3-5 minute wait before your next race and I've had a couple where it was literally loading for around 12 minutes before we got to the next race. I really can't see why any dev would remove the choice of what kind of race you'd like to matchmake for and the networking is truly awful for a AAA game. Also, as per usual in FH games, the fact that you can't set parameters for races, 90% of events in the game come down to whether you've downloaded the tune that most abuses the physics. Very little skill is required to win races in this game, just copy the meta and hold down the gas.Steering wheel settings are atrocious. Not only do you have to remap all the buttons EVERY time you start the game, but it just feels... terrible. And it's not just my opinion, lots of people that I've talked to agree that the steering just feels bad. I can make it through DR2.0 stages with a wheel with relatively little issue, but taking so much as one small turn in a dirt race in FH5 is like pulling teeth. It's like the wheel isn't actually tied to the in game car's wheels, you just turn it to the right and the wheels just kinda go to that position-ish in their own damn time. I've played some relatively realistic sims like project cars 2, DR2.0, and BeamNG.drive. This is by far the worst experience in terms of actually controlling your car.And on top of all of that, they're pretentious enough to make the opening logos of the game unskippable. That's the ultimate pretense, right there. I don't need to see your logo every time your game crashes...So as a person that usually plays single player (since the online is so awful), I can't recommend this game. Really sad cause it's so pretty but I'm only 30 hours in and already getting bored of the game. They took a thing that was a problem in previous Forza games and made it so bad that the game is nigh on unplayable at times and I don't use that word lightly. Barely into the game and I find myself logging in to do 3 races, get frustrated at the terrible AI, wheel mechanics, bugs, and other issues, then log off. I'm kind of astounded that they managed to make almost every part of the game worse (or null improvement) except for the graphics, the map, and some customization options. The most fun I have is in freeroam, driving around the empty world because traffic and other players won't spawn around you if you're online. It's like there was literally zero play testing performed on this game before launch. As a driving game, this can be pretty fun. Lots of different cars, open roads, and it looks great. But as a racing game, this is one of the worst you'll find. Hot wheels and Mario Kart are better racing games than this.

author: Valonielu
review: Easily one of the best racing/car games out there. Over the previous game, the major difference is the sounds of the cars and the environment. I cannot quite tell you how good everything sounds, it is something that only you can experience for yourself :)The location for the game is perfect and looks incredibly realistic and detailed. Lots of different areas with character and a majestic aura to them. Its both fun to cruise around and race, whether you race on tarmac, mixed terrain or go offroad. On top of its looks, the game is also very well optimized with tons of settings you can fine tune (including difficulty) to best suit your needs and hardware.Overall, Forza Horizon 5 is a must play for car lovers and racing fans. Simply glorious!

author: Lycon
review: A LOT of connectivity issues, hard to play with friends, DCs from races, gets stuck on menu after a race sometimes. The online racing is 3 min racing 15 min waiting. When driving open world you get stopped dead in your tracks because reasons? a lot of times. Theres also a memory leak issue, after a few hours of playing it happens and you have to restart your game. also, and this is a giant negative point: unskippable cutscenes and conversations, like seriously? This brings me too the characters and dialogue. Theyre pure ****. holy crap I hate every single character and dialogue ive seen/heard so far. The cringe is beyond words. Also, some cars are locked behind wheelspin RNG. the world map itself is also the worst one so far, its so blands... they could have gone with the awesomeness of Japan but no... lets make a bland easy to craft map for easy monies. Anyway, the good side: the cars and driving are nice. Graphically it also looks really good imo.

author: antiklaus
review: this game can be amazing - IF it works. but it doesn't. don't give them money.PROs:+ gorgeous visuals and huge world with lots to do+ great feel to drivingCONs:- more than 50% of the time it crashes when booting it up- after 2 hours playing it starts dipping from 100fps to the 30s - and i am quite sure this is not their first game with memory leak issues.- poor performance or even higher chance of crashes when you got anything running besides the game (music, streaming software, anything really)- the online connections are horrendous - as to be expected on a launch day. but it was so in the early access time as well. the game worked great when i played 4 hours on friday - then things went south and continue to do so each day. so i can't refund even when i wanted to.so wait for fixes and all our negative reviews to be updated. if that happens.if every pissed off customer will stop playing the servers may be able to cope.i guess i should keep my hands off of microsoft-studio games. i never have any luck.

author: Barney
review: The forza series means a lot to me. On the second console of my life, the xbox 360, one of my most played games was Forza Motorsport 4. This was probably due to the fact that I have been a very big car enthusiast since the age of 5 and loved to drive the cars, race and listen to their engines in the virtual world. I have played every single forza game ever since and quickly found myself more interested and immersed in the horizon series, probably because of the open world freedom and the more versatile gameplay. Some would argue the realism of these games, but I believe they always keep a good balance between enjoyable gameplay and realism for hardcore carguys. The weakest entry in the series is probably Horizon 4, but the great gameplay has more or less compensated for the poor sound quality, the extremely forgettable story and the bugs so I wouldn't say Horizon 4 was a bad game. It was just the most forgetabble one. Fortunately I can say that this game is an improvement over previous games and I recommend it.

author: fast1uck
review: I dont write a lot of reviews but this is one franchise i've put a ton of hours into. When I originally saw how paired down the cars list was I thought it wasn't going to be a big deal. Boy how wrong I was. This game feels empty. It feels like a step in the wrong direction. Literally the only difference between this game and FH4 is the increased foliage and new location. It is the exact same friggin game as FH4, just now with unskippable horrible dialogue and cut scenes. I couldn't care any less about this story. Everytime i'm locked in an unskippable cut scene it makes me want to quit the game immediately. This game's  story feels like a fast and furious movie in all the wrong ways. I'll check back in once i've put at least 100 hours into this but this is whole hearted a step in the wrong direction for this franchise. The only upsides to this game is that it seems to be well optimized out of the gate, looks gorgeous and the driving is fun as always. But if you've put a ton of hours in FH4 dont expect anything new except to be more annoyed and bored quicker.Edit: After 140+ hours I still cant recommend this game. It feels like a shell of it's former self with some really questionable stereotyping going on. The driving dynamics are the exact same, yet something feels like its missing. They really missed the mark with this one, I cringe every time I hear the opening menu music.

author: Diet Coke God
review: If you're a fan of Forza Horizon 4 then this is more of the same and in some instances better. - Seems like there's significantly more launch content.- Map has a lot of cool unique areas and is a completely different setting than 4. (Way less rain too). - Great lighting and particle effects graphics. Only graphical complaint I have is there's pop-in and low res textures that can happen rarely, especially when going fast. - Driving feels good, maybe a bit heavy/restrictive considering I have all the assists off, but you can play around with drift cars if you want to fix that. - Payout seems pretty fast. Already have nearly 70 cars and bought some expensive rare ones I wanted.

review: ---------------------------------------------------------------->>>>>GAME CRASHES @ LAUNCH???<<<<<----------------------------------------------------------------Little Tip for those who keeps getting crashes upon starting the game.Go into your -> Date&Clock settings (Right click your Time on the bottom right conor, pick "Change Date&Time")Make sure your Time & Timezone is set to automatic and click "Synch" after. Worked just fine for me afterwards.

author: Pollkie
review: I'd like to thank Turn 10 and Playground Games for fixing the issue regarding the game crashing upon launch.PROS:The game is as per usual, simply GORGEOUS, probably the prettiest looking. The opening of the game gives me goosebumps as I drive through forests, sandstorms, jump from a volcano and tear up the highway. Its over the top. The number of cars in the game is a lot. The Horizon games gives you so many cars for free that your collection expands so quickly that you will have a hard time choosing what car to take into a race. New players would like this mechanic. The cars feel very nice to control no complains there. Halo sounds for your car horn, anyone?CONS: The subtitles had an issue when the player speaks (yes, there's dialogue in the game). Whenever the player speaks, the player would be named as the last NPC that interacted with the player. I was like why was Ramiro replying Ramiro in the cutscene turns out it was the player that replied Ramiro. Hope I have explained this clearly. Horizon rewards us with cars so easily that it defeats the purpose of having an Autoshow in the first.Overall, the game is very good for both new players and long time fans of the Forza Horizon series.Last review: As much as I love the franchise, this is rather unexpected and unfortunate. The game keeps crashing during launch and I have no idea how to fix it. Disabling my anti-virus software did not help. I am sorry but its a thumbs down from me for now. Please patch ASAP, cannot wait to tear up Mexico.

We lost more crops to these cars than 50 years of drought!My family and I haven't been able to sleep for weeks now: These drivers rev their cars days and nights outside our houses! Actually, one of them flew onto our roof last night...Rest of them just keep ramming our walls!And some of them chased our poor burros and perro around for hours!What's worse? All of them speak English with a British accent but pretends they speak Spanish by randomly adding them in sentences! So I beg you, please send help! Save our family! PLEASE!"This message is not sponsored by Horizon Mexico.

author: raz3r
review: Playground Games has gone all in with Forza Horizon 5 and it shows. Technically it is a masterpiece, it's not only the best looking game of this generation, it also runs smooth as butter with insane framerates. Gameplay wise we're talking about more of the same but this time the amount of content is just massive. Actually the only "issue" I see with this game is that it floods the player with stuff at every corner, like seriously slow down! As per the location... I wasn't really convinced about Mexico at first but I couldn't have been more wrong, they really nailed the festival this time, Mexico offers every single possible biome and new additions like the sandstorm are downright crazy. If you love racing you just have to play this game, no way you'll regret it.

author: ä½ æ˜¯äººé—´æƒŠé¸¿å®¢
review: Forza Horizon5 is the best picture quality game I have ever played. Exquisite texture maps, complex terrain changes, and more details than the previous one.The game's playability is exceedingly high, but it will be a bit boring at the beginning of the game. The map is much larger than Forza Horizon4; the weather system is a point that shocked me. The feel of the vehicle is as good as ever. Through its free adjustment, you can achieve the effect you want to deal with various races.Horizon Pulseâ€™s music is consistent with my music aesthetic as always, and the cover songs are still very local and very pleasing. However, I still found some problems when I was playing, and the frequency of these problems was remarkably high (the latest graphics card driver has been updated):1: The online system is unstable. I still often disconnected under various attempts by me and my friends. Sometimes when looking at other people's cars from my perspective, there will be abnormal movement.2: In single-player mode or online mode, sometimes the speed suddenly drops to zero. The specific conditions for triggering the bug still need more exploration.3: After the HDR mode is turned on, abnormal light and shadow displays will be displayed on the road.4: The Xbox Game Bar cannot be opened normally in the game (it may be my problem), GeForce Experience cannot read the fps value normally.5: When the menu is paused, the handle will sometimes keep vibrating and will not stop.Overall, I still think Forza Horizon5 is an incredibly good game. This game allows me to see the unremitting efforts and challenging work of the R&D team. I am extremely fortunate to be able to play such a beautiful game in my youth.

author: LiekMudkipz-
review: Forza Horizon 5 is a welcome return to the series! Even after playing every Horizon title I still find myself aimlessly wondering the map for hours on end in my favorite off-road car. You know exactly what to expect as a returning player, and you will be in shock and awe of the amount of content if you're new to the series. The semi-simulation/Arcade like gameplay is a perfect formula that doesn't seem to get old. I can spend hours tuning vehicles to my liking, or I can just pick a pre-set tune made by the community and jump right into whatever it is I want to do. This makes it both fun and interactive for players who want to get the most out of their cars while also providing a simplistic option for more casual players. You are free to progress through the game by following whatever interests you best (be that drifting, street racing, offroading, exploring, etc.). The game can be a little overbearing with how much content it throws at you at once, but if you pick and choose your own personal goals, Horizon 5 can be an absolute playground for you.The graphics alone are drop dead gorgeous! Horizon 5 takes place in a fake Mexico by mashing together different biomes/environments that make for really good eye candy. On the plus side of that, the game is optimized really well to perform a stable and graphically sound experience.Next let's talk cons. The pros definitely outweigh the cons here but they need to be mentioned.1. The game throws an insane amount of cars at your face all at once. While rewards are very much welcome, throwing a new free car at your face every second depreciates the value. While this may be a personal opinion I'd still like to mention it.2. On the PC version I will get random crashes. Out of the 39 hrs playtime I've had about 5 CTDs. Thankfully these were mostly in the menus and not on the road.3. Game UI can be confusing. From scrolling Horizon 5s map to selecting cars in the menu, it can sometimes be difficult to navigate. There's always alot of clutter on screen and while the game does have filters, it can sometimes be a pain to find what you're looking for.And that's my personal review. Overall I give Forza Horizon 5 a solid:9/10

author: Sweats Profusely
review: While I haven't played too much of it so far, this is my favourite Forza experience so far.The series of Forza Horizon feels like it was really just building up to this game. It may be more of the same in some aspects, but it's definitely a fresh taste on car customisation, feel, and all round experience. Mexico is a great environment for controller play. If you have a steering wheel, it is still a struggle to play anything but street / road racing (Which there is a lack of) without bonkers skill and even then it feels wrong in my opinion, but as a controller or keyboard player it's still better than the previous iterations of Horizon.Overall I recommend it highly but if you are looking for a steering wheel game I'd personally recommend something else.

author: SbM
review: You like cars? Good thing you're here. Forza Horizon 5 is the best entry in the franchise and a high quality game overall. It brings a new location, more cars and an incredible amount of QoL fixes over previous installments. What's not to love?Edit: Many people experienced constant disconnecting from the servers(myself included). That was fixed within a day for most people, and we were informed that they are further investigating the issue.The game also seems to crash for some. The temporary fix is to add forza as an exception to your antivirus software.

author: astralsands
review: I haven't played a racing game in nearly a decade so this one is sort of blowing my mind with it's Incredible graphics, sound, amazing controls and attention to detail. I've wasted many minutes just in Forzavision looking at car models as well have spent many minutes trying to auction snipe cars at the last minute. Before I wrote this I completed a race that took 23 minutes and was balls to the wall through farmlands, jungles and then up a mountain and then down the rocky dirt road side of it. It was so intense that it reminded me of skiing in real life. The controls for each vehicle in this game are out of this world and makes arcade racing enjoyable even for those of us who aren't car freaks or racing gamers. On top of that there are multiplayer races, aracade, battle royale, player created content and so much more. There's so much to do that it can be difficult to decide what to do. Definitely worth the money.

author: The Sandwich Cat
review: This game is fantastic, Horizon isnt a racing game about shaving seconds of laps times or finding the perfect tune. Its a celebration of all things cars and this is such a fun loving tribute to the racing genre. Absolutely worth it!!

author: Harass-Man
review: [Update:Changing this to negative, it's been almost a month, but Playground Games can't be bothered to fix online, still keep disconnecting at times, point combos still randomly get interrupted wasting your time and effort, but you will get banned for making parody logos. Driving cars around was a lot of fun, but literally everything else is infuriating]When you start playing you immediately get introduced to obnoxious characters and greetedwith terrible musical taste, but worry not, you can turn down radio volume and dialogue to 0 as well as disable DJ and then just play some real music or eurobeat. Game starts with a much shorter prologue this time letting you take a few rides for a spin, after which you will create a Playstation 2 generation looking character. Selection assembled from the ugliest goblin like humanoids I have ever seen. Then you can feel direct influence of Kenshi, because you can play as a torso quadputee or you can be ableist and pick to have all limbs. Select your gender/pronouns, as in, male, female or welfare check communist. Unfortunately you will always play as a woman because the game has no selection of facial hair. Tragic, but that is not the worst part, you are forced to be British so not only you play as an annoying hipster, you also sound like an atheist/critic youtuber. This game obviously is an arcade racer, hence not very realistic, game does not involvetrafficking illegal immigrants, smuggling drugs and at no point you get kidnapped by a cartel and get your car stolen. The drone is still kinda useless, it flies so low at that altitude tour balls are still touching theground, wheel spin gatcha is 90% clothes which seem to be lifted directly from a wardrobe ofsomeone who can't start xir day without avocado toast, as well as season objectives nowrequire certain car class and category which is unbelievably annoying. Now, if you manage to get past all that, the game is really fun, map is huge and gorgeous, roster of over 500 cars that you can deck out with weeb garbage, but most importantly it has a winding mountain road on the main map where you can pretend you know how to drift just because you watched Initial D once.Other than that itâ€™s just a Forza Horizon game, if you enjoyed previous games, youâ€™ll enjoy this as well, and if you never played one before, now is as good a time as any, just steel yourself for some high grade cringe.

author: fumzy
review: This game saved my life.I am 27.My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.Thank you

author: harry
review: Set in Mexico, this is another superb entry in the Forza Horizon series which improves and expands upon its already excellent predecessors. Forza Horizon 5 provides players more choice and freedom by giving you the option to first focus on whatever subcategory of racing you prefer (for example, I chose to start off by opening the cross-country racing festival, giving me access to all of the cross-country races across Mexico. Similarly, I could've chosen to start off with street racing, track racing, dirt racing, etc). As you progress throughout the game you will continue to unlock and branch out to the other available festival locations/racing subcategories in any order you want until you eventually unlock them all (you are not permanently locked out of content forever, it is simply there so you can focus on what you prefer in the earlier stages of the game). The progression system is balanced extremely well (experience points which progress you to unlocking new festival locations and showcase events/credits to buy new cars and upgrades). It never felt grindy or like I was being overwhelmed with too much content at once. The handling for each of the cars is also excellent (similar to the previous Forza Horizon games) and strikes the perfect balance between not feeling too light like an arcade racer or punishing like a sim racer. Difficulty and assists can be fine tuned to your liking to make your experience easier or more challenging - the less assists/harder AI difficulty you have, the higher your bonus credits % is per race.As you've probably seen from the promotional material, this is an astonishingly beautiful game that looks the same in-game as it does in the trailers. Mexico is jaw-droppingly vast, featuring numerous biomes and variations in altitude from mountainous volcanoes to thick swamps, coastal beaches, woodland forests, dense cities, small towns, rolling sand dunes and agricultural lands - it's a gift that never stops giving. With this graphical fidelity, I was expecting performance to be less than satisfactory, however, I have been pleasantly surprised at how well this game was optimised as I am able to maintain a steady framerate even in the dense city areas. With every single setting pushed to the maximum, I was able to hit a constant 70-90fps at 1080p on an AMD Radeon RX 6800/Ryzen 5 3600XT.Like all other aspects of the game, the audio design is also excellent. I would, however, recommend putting the audio preset to 'car focused' as I personally found the music and GPS voice a bit too loud on the default setting. In saying this, music selection on the different radio stations is also solid for each of their respective genres and the hosts didn't feel too obnoxious or as if they were interrupting the music too much.This is a simply excellent game that I do not see myself putting down anytime soon and I wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone, even those who tend to stay away from racing games.

author: sparky_buzzsaw (Cam)
review: I feel like something of a broken record when it comes to Forza Horizon. It's a great game, undoubtedly one of the best racers on the market, but for every smart decision, especially in regards to accessibility, one of its biggest draws, there tend to be lots of little moments where things can still be improved.For one, and this has been a problem since the original Forza Horizon, not all the cars are technically feasible in an open world setting. Most of the 4WD and AWD vehicles make sense. But even when the game puts you on a mostly solid surface for a race, the other cars don't feel nearly as manageable, often leading to squirrely driving and fiddly turning that never feels quite as right as proper Forza.As mentioned, accessibility options in Forza Horizon astound me, and they do a great job of continuing that here. You can turn on an option to continue the plot even if you lose a race, meaning the old annoying showcase and new-to-this-series story missions aren't going to frustrate you quite so much with the rubber banding and other FH eye-rollers. But that doesn't change the fact that those problems are still there. Turning assists on during showcase events, for example, ends up being even more difficult somehow than without, because with guided braking and turning, you're not building up the speed to win at the predetermined point near the end of the race. This is the third or fourth game where this is a problem and it's astonishing that it hasn't been addressed. Rubber banding stinks!Then there's the other new event - Trailblazers. I need to screenshot one of these because the checkered flag is impossible for me to see. For one, the icon clutter on the map means the finish line is lost in a sea of other events. The sunny skies and sands of Mexico (which are beautifully rendered in this game, by the way - it's flipping gorgeous) often obscure checkpoints, leaving me wandering or relying on GPS which can't get me to the finish line in time to finish some of the events. When I'm doing an event like this, the clutter needs to go. Some option to turn on color-changing, big splashy checkpoints would be awesome too.One last complaint - that's it, I swear. The music. There's one or two decent songs in the mix, but for the most part, the music is singularly toothless. I can always play other stuff in the background so it's not a serious problem with the game, but this soundtrack makes me feel like I'm driving ten miles an hour (or whatever the British equivalent would be) in bumper-to-bumper traffic in London, not racing through the Mexican desert. My heart should pound, not feel like it's marinating in Nyquil.But apart from that, this is more Forza Horison and that's a very good thing! I like that the protagonist now has a voice, and there's a cheerful exuberance to it all. I hope they lean harder into the history of the cars you're racing and the cultural impact of them, as that's probably the best new addition to the game.

author: Scurvee
review: I was excited for this game as I played FH4 a ton (couple hundred hours).  Turns out there is almost no new content; it is 99% the same experience as FH4.  No new cars worth the cost of the game.  The car pass has been a joke; the first car I was looking forward to was just released 1/27 and then the content was bugged, not downloading past the release date and I have yet to drive it.  No groundbreaking or enticing game modes.  PC start menu has bugged out since day one, you can click on an option and nothing happens until you minimize the game and then click back in.  As far as I am concerned this game is a flop, sadly these are only a handful of the issues I've encountered.

review: Forza Horizon 5 is an absolute masterpiece of a racing game. The graphics are stunning, with breathtaking environments and highly detailed cars. If you're a fan of racing games or just looking for a fun and beautiful open-world experience, Forza Horizon 5 is a must-have.

author: Mirukahia
review: Since long time I was hoping and searching for a good / entertaining arcade racing game, it has been years since I enjoyed one (NFS2010 / The Crew1) after that, most of the NFS, specially the two latest ones, TC2, Grid, etc, you name it. Each one of them lack "of that thing", boring, bad graphics, bad driving, stiff, performance... FH5 changed that. Huge customization, nice driving (playing with most assists off) lot of activities, races, events, modes, the car catalogue is an entire book!, the world, Mexico looks so neat, performance is great even early access / day1 standards. Ultra graphics + RTX on, 1440p and I have just not seen a drop below 75 fps. If you were waiting for "That good racing arcade game" , it has come my friend!

author: ECV_Flipper
review: The overall story line is terrible.  You're this amazing driver who drives through the jungle and towns with not a whole lot else to the story.  This game is nothing but collect cars and achievements.  The cars a little too easy to get and the game basically dumps every resource at you early on so its not even a challenge to get up the ranks in cars.  The upgrade system is horrible.  Swap an engine into a 1970s Camaro and its automatically S rank.  Do that in reality and the thing would get smoked by a GTR on pump gas.  The driving mechanics are dull.  Forza 4 played better than this BS.

author: Demilikos
review: I heard a lot of great things about the Forza Horizon series. I wanted the upcoming release of FH5 to be my first foray into this exciting game world for car enthusiasts. I heard a lot of great things about the developer as well. The prerelease reviews were glowing, so I decided to get the $100 Premium Edition to play the game five days early.Me and thousands, maybe tens of thousands of others haven't been able to get past the Playground Games logo 10-15 seconds after starting the game up. It constantly crashes to desktop. For the first few days, this problem was barely acknowledged at all on the "problems list" sent out by the developer. They sent a list of recommendations to do that included disabling Discord, your antivirus, and more. I tried everything except disabling my antivirus (but I did add a folder and .exe exclusion to it) to no avail.For the people who do get in, there's a whole load of problems being reported as well like crashes, constant disconnections, memory leak issues and more.For now I will try to refund this, which is a shame as I was looking forward to this release for months. I'm sure the game, when working for everyone, will be amazing. But I can't recommend it at its current state.

author: aarxn.
review: I'll try keep it short and sweet, here's why in my opinion this is probably one of the best Forza Horizon games made so far //Pros:- Map is huge, not to mention absolutely gorgeous.- Cars sound and feel amazing to drive, which compared to horizon 4 is a massive strong point for me.- The ability to unlock multiple Horizon Festivals & Houses ( Each of which having their own benefits )- Races feel more challenging than ever, even on lower difficulty ( but still keeping them fun for new players )- Multiple story missions to complete, each with their own unique rewards.- New customisation options both for your car ( performance & cosmetic ), and also your character.Cons - Roads feel incredibly wide, which in turn makes the cars feel slow on straights but fast when cornering.- Slight issue with connectivity when in multiplayer sessions ( will probably be fixed )- I personally have found the playerbase in online lobbies ( particularly freeroam ) to be un-engaging, not   particularly an issue with the game, but it just doesnt feel like many players want to interact with others   compared to previous Horizon games in the franchise.Hopefully this review helps you :)

author: MAD
review: tl;dr - It's alright. If FH4 has a discount, get that instead.||| Connectivity & Multiplayer |||- Very rare connectivity issues and desyncs.+ Can play with friends faster.||| Car Customization |||- Same stupid visual customization system- You cannot move and stretch a shape, you need to move through menus. Need For Speed has the best customization system and whatever Forza has is the absolute worst. It takes forever to do something with it. - Liveries? It's better to keep them for yourself as you might get banned.||| Player Customization |||- Mostly the same characters for your player as before+ A few new characters- Clothes clip (like pants with boots, for example)- No beards!! Beards do not exist.* * Beards do exist in the form of a white beard and a santa hat. ||| Creating races |||- Good ****** luck creating your own races! Your friends won't see the props, sometimes you won't see the props. If you see the props today that doesn't mean you'll see them tomorrow. - So many issues with the checkpoints, at many times you will miss a checkpoint, all of a sudden! You can, of course, rewind. Wait no, you can't. That also gets bugged! But you can go back and edit the race and the checkpoints. HA. NO. YOU CANNOT DO THAT. Perhaps leaving and going back to some menu to load up the track you just created, that will put you back in the editor. NO, THAT FUNCTION  DOES NOT EXIST!- Want to create a circuit without any waypoints? Guess what happens. You start the race and then after the car runs for 30 meters the race ends! OF COURSE YOU CANNOT GO BACK AND EDIT THE COURSE TO ADD WAYPOINTS.- An absolute terrible mess but in some rare cases, if you just want to race from one point to the other, creating races works. - AI will get confused. Most probably. - Random resets due to checkpoints (even though you didn't miss any)- Time of day and seasons from a custom race can't be changed. It will default to whatever time of day is currently on. - You can't edit any details (not that they would save) without retesting the race. Weather? Test race. Car type? Test race. Clearly they didn't test their game so you must.  ||| Map |||- Stupid filtering of the map and events. The map is always a cluttered mess. - It won't hide things you completed / won. They'll FOREVER be there unless you hide them each time you enter the game.- Scrolling through the item list gets bugged- Sandstorms are random, barely happen and they don't do much. If you play on lower graphics it just looks like it's about to rain. I guess the same for the other seasons? No idea, I never feel any difference. ||| Steering wheel, pedals, clutch |||- Same small FoV from inside the car. And I play on 3440x1440.- The steering wheel animations are super basic, 90 degrees- And as it turns out, now that I was made aware of it, even manual w/ clutch is â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ now vs 4.- No noise when missing the gear.||| UI |||- The menus when navigating towards your car are full of useless interactions where it showcases your car for no reason and so on. Same when purchasing. It's been stupid like this for long, including in FH4.+ Better than FH4 as you can see some extra details in the Festival Playlist. ||| AI |||- On custom races, the AI is really bad. - The difficulty curve a bit wonky. The game is really hard but it's not a turn-off.||| NPCs ||| - Not enough NPC traffic. ||| Graphics |||- Ray tracing? No, not in gameplay, that's for sure, try Photo Mode.- It gave me a "Low Video Memory" with an RTX 3080.- Textures of the road get corrupted, looking shiny, very dark or as if they have placeholder textures. - A lot of scanlines when dropping the resolution.||| Multiplayer |||- Fairly OK when you don't find people who stop playing mid tournament and you lose because of them. Happens more often than not.||| Conclusion |||- It's basically FH4 with a new map, tweaked cars and a few improvements. That's it.- If you do something that's creative, you're going to get in trouble or it won't work. + Fun with friends and if you don't already have FH4.(I'll keep updating this with more)

author: Maranello
review: PROS:- Graphics are amazing, specially the cars- Benchmark is great- Runs very well on extreme graphic settings (though there is a bug where the game becomes very laggy after 1 up to 4 houres of gameplay)- I had some fun races- Plot is easy to ignoreCONS:- Gameplay gets repetitive- Game is to expensive for what it is specially when you bought the deluxe versions- Menu's are a messy clutter of junk- There is no reason to play,: Basically, you get everything for free in the game. You drive 100 meter you win a car, you do a race of only 3 laps. you win a car, you take a photo you win a car, you spin a wheel you get a car. You accidently make a fart you win a car. There is no progression, you get everything.- Online is also a mess: Long loading times, disconnections, since there is no ranked racing there is weight or reason to play. so most drivers leave the lobby.- Ghost cars: Why show other people in my world? They are just ghosts, as far as i know you can't even interact properly.- Ghost cars online: whats the point of racing together when everybody is a ghost? If you want clean racing it fails big time.Since ghosting happens so randomly. and whit ghosting enable no one cares for the other cars.- Every racing game has some realism to some extend, well this game don't. (even with realism on) When you win a car, see the car, hear the car, it probably don't drive like a car.- Poor wheel support- Gamplay is not quite good. No sense of speed, no realism (even though its a arcade game), the cars feel floaty, and no proper damage model.- I can't select any manly white character. There is one dude and i can give him girly hair.A game i will still pick this up when i feel like it, but nothing i expected it to be. Its all shiny, but it has no value. My first Forza game, probably my last. Its not the worst game i played but certainly nothing i can recommend.
