author: psanta
review: Loading screen. The graphics are nice. Loading screen. Car handling is okay, most cars lose grip too easily - but when you tune one to your taste, it feels great, I must add.But generally speaking, the game is not _fun_. The skill score system rewards destruction/off-road drifting too much, or regular driving around too little.Loading screen.Coming from the NFS games, not simulator titles, I'm missing some of the casual/arcade-y/messing with the police aspects. 500+ cars, yes, but...... from the first minute you get A and S-tier cars. I don't feel progression. Loading screen. Speaking of arcade-y elements, I tried zombie/king/flag event and it's okay at best.Despite the loading screens and general wait time between opportunities to drive a car, simple online races were absolutely fine, most of matchmaking/wait times were much shorter than other loading screens. I would like more options of which online races am I signing up for. I got into an S2.998 race without owning a car that came even close. The rental car had so much acceleration in 1st-2nd gear, up until 130kph that even half-pressing throttle (gamepad user here btw) without burnouts was impossible - and I couldn't customize it as it was rental.Totally subjective opinion, but I am not a fan of the "guy waving at stupid crowd melting at the sight of his/her car" concept (of loading screens ;) ) and the general idea of Horizon festival. This was my first Horizon title ever bought, and it probably will be the last.I hate that a game bought on Steam has to be linked to a Microsoft account. I hate that every time the game starts, an in-game Steam overlay shows up with "Do you want to link Steam and xbox accounts?". No, I just want to play this 100GB $60 game, thank you.To end it on a positive note, acessibility features and prosthetic limbs are nice touch Microsoft added.edit: after moving the game files to the steam library on my nvme drive, loading screens became totally acceptable.

The GT2 rear end falls into the ground around 130mph which compromises the entire reason for driving it in the first place, which happened in Forza Horizon 4 with the Apollo which was never fixed before the release of Horizon 5. The RS7 completely crashes the game when in the wheel selection in upgrades.

author: Meepus Moopus
review: I must admit, I wasn't expecting such a dark story in a driving game. A group of sociopathic millionaires take over Mexico and transform it into their private playing ground. The locals have either fled or are confined indoors, because venturing outside would mean certain death under the wheels of deathboxes painted with anime girls. Cargo planes and ad-covered airships control the skies, while the screams and crunch of metal are hidden under the cacophony of drivers blasting "wololo" from Age of Empires 1 from their custom car horns.Truly this is the best societal collapse simulator I've ever played.

author: Joey376
review: This game has always been the little kids arcade "smash em up" version of forza, Ive never liked any of them, in fact I only bought this because I have to fill time until forza 8 or Grand Turismo. It maintains alot of quirks that are rather unreasonable this far in the series. One that always kinda made this game boring fast is everything is smash-able outside of a building, telephone poles, guard rails. trees basically the world is made of paper so not a go to game for any sort of realism or challenge to improve your driving or car setups. It still has the nearly identical cheesy story that it drags you thru as the last 4 horizons. Next on controller why is it mandatory that I assign RADIO STATION CHANGE, FORZA LINK (whatever the F* that is), and PHOTO MODE as MANDATORY controller bindings? Shifting isn't even a mandatory key binding. As the rant continues I find the game to gift way too much, there is no real goal or even the slightest hint of a grind. You just start the game and its already given you 5 million dollars in super cars and a half full bank account. Like give me a civic and a 1,000cr and let me struggle to get a lambo in a few days atleast. On a smaller note the flashing from the speed cameras is insanely annoying, it is slightly less aggressive then fh4 but id rather just turn it off. As for the positives, it does have very nice graphics and is running smoothly at all maxed settings on a 3080. The car selection is pretty good and its always had better customization options then regular forza.

This map is much less interesting and diverse than that in FH4, especially because there is no changing seasons. One positive thing i can say is that force feedback on steering wheels is better than in 4. Aside from that there is no improvements, still no story, still no style or direction, soundtrack still sucks. Also partying up with friends is still difficult, if not even worse than in 4. It also claims to have all these cars in it but the truth is you can only use a handful cause only some cars actually perform well enough to race with, and the online aspect is trash cause its nothing but people using modded tunes for their car that makes there car ridiculous fast and impossible to beat. author: Myrvold
review: Written when I reached 69 hours of gametime. "For the giggles".The game is basically a bugged map-DLC for Forza Horizon 4. It looks much the same, drives much the same. When loading in blueprints at other seasons (dry, wet, storm, hot), they always mention "spring, summer, autumn and winter", which is also used in the festival playlists. Though, elsewhere in the game, the Horizon 5 style season-names are used. It's like they didn't bother changing it all, so mashed it together instead.This goes for radio stations as well. My favorite is Radio Eterna, nothing beats some classical tunes when you rip out the countryside. It was called Timeless FM in Horizon 4. If you have a skill song, and change away from Radio Eterna, you get a message on your screen telling you to change back to the skill song. So it tells me to change back to Timeless FM (what the station was called in the last game).You got the random skillchain-stops, glitching out of the map bugs. The devs/publisher banning livery creators for rather safe liveries, but not doing anything towards modders, hackers, cheaters.You got the persistent performance drop of the game. Which means that you need to to re-start the game every 90-120 min to get the framerates back up. It's not that it runs out of memory, or anything in the PC gets to hot. It just... happens. With 5 out of 6 in my gaming-group.The online part of the game basically don't work. Cars load in and out at random, making driving together in freeroam pointless and impossible. It happens in the Eliminator games, it also means that while there may be 30 guys on a session together, you only see 5. Which then again makes it look like no-one is bothering with Horizon Arcade, which is an important part of the Festival Playslist, rendering that pointless.There are accolades that just don't work, or is written wrong (e.g 3 stars with a certain car on a certain jump. Which in reality is that car, 3 stars, but a different jump than what's written...). Festival Playlist dailies which are bugged and not possible to do etc. etc.When the game works like it should. It's a fun experience. Too bad it doesn't work as it should at all. Even with 69 hours *giggles again* at the time of writing, I cannot recommend this game to anyone without feeling dirty.On a 50% sale in the future, maybe.EDIT, 28th November 2021: New quite big bug. Props in EventLab events (former blueprint, custom races) may not load (more often not loading, than loading) on the newer events. "Old" events (1 week +) seems to work at bit more often. This makes many of the custom made races pointless... Again. I cannot recommend this game in it's current state.EDIT2: 30th November "You've played an additional 8 hours, would you like to update your review?". Yes Steam, I would. EventLab creations are more bugged that I knew. More often than not you get the checkpoint missed bug, and as you cannot change what you've made, you have to start over again... that's 4 hours wasted... Amazing.

author: ã‚â§ðŸ¾
review: I don't have much experience in racing games outside of Trackmania and older arcade-style games like NFS. This was my first Forza game, and I can say I'm very happy with my purchase. I only bought the $60 version at the time of this review, I can say the game exceeded my expectations and offers an insane amount of content.The driving is fun, and drastically changes depending the road type and car you're using. The graphics are some of the best, and surely the top of its class for this genre. There's so many random things to do and work towards so you can really do what you feel like, and I love that aspect in any game. The game offers freedom and player choice with its content and flexible customizability.I'd say the game fits much more under a casual and enthusiast setting than a competitive. The option for competitive play is definitely there, but high leaderboards are full of bug abuse and cheaters.Which leads me onto the main issue of the game, it is very buggy. Physics will break, your online connection will break, combos will break. It's annoying but the game is good enough where it's generally excusable, but paying this much for a game I expect these things to be fixed with time. I even had a friend who purchased the game only to have to refund due to it crashing on startup.The game is good and I highly recommend it if you're a racing fan, car fan, or just want a new gaming experience like myself. Just don't expect a completely bug-free game, and remember Steam offers refunds under a certain playtime if you don't like it or can't play it.

author: The Iceberg
review: Game devs are literally on par with Rockstar, will not ban or remove hackers that hack the scoreboards with impossible times, BUT the moment you mess with the economy, permaban. They shut the damn auction house down for a week because people were exploiting it. Then they proceeded to ban everyone who used this exploit even though they werent actually hacking. Some of these exploits were released with the game, no external hacks required and they banned people for using the exploits that were ALREADY IN THE GAME! But actual hackers dont get any repercussions at all. I have been banned for no reason, the message I received does not even state why I have received a ban and better yet the support team refuse to help even though I have screenshots of everything, the Forza website even states I have no bans and no ban history at all. I have played this game completely clean since release. What a way to treat loyal players.

author: TROTTA
review: This kinda sucks since ive been really exited for this game. This game would genuinely be a great improvement from forza horizon 4 had the game actually work as intended. The world is bigger and the graphics look a lot nicer however it appears that playground games have focused to much on visual details of the game and has neglected to make sure it even works properly. Been stuck on the intro for about 3 hours on extreme settings. The game would run super smooth throughout but once i crossed the finish line of the intro the game would crash to desktop trying to load a cut scene forcing me to re launch the game and re do the entire into all over again. after completing the intro at least 5 times and trying on lower graphic settings i found out that the fix for me was to close discord and run the game as an administrator. In a perfect world the issues would end here but no. no they don't. after actually playing the real game for 10 min i decided to restart as i have heard people complaining about the game crashing on startup after the intro. Unfortunately what i didn't know was that me restarting the game would mean that i would not be able to play again as no matter what i do: running as administrator, playing on the lowest graphics, uninstalls and re installs, killing random apps in the background, and reading other peoples fixes on the internet, Would just lead to another disappointing crash as soon as you load into the festival. I will say this tho, if you can find away to make this game work i would recommend it however we are probably gonna have to wait for some patch or update. so i don't recommend the game or at least not in its currant state. in the meantime i will recommend forza horizon 4 if u wanna scratch the racing itch. Hopefully playground games fixes this game soon.... s a d

author: AerialComb
review: There is a few things to mention in this game if you already played Horizon 4, specially if you played it recently. If you played Horizon 4 when it came out, and did not played recently, basically the  whole experience was overhauled, specially the multiplayer aspect of it.  They add it a bunch of new activities to do online.The gameplay itself is the same as previous title, events play almost excatly the same way. What they did differently is basically the setting and made some improvements to the story missions in the game. Maybe graphically the game seems better but I am not so sure. What this game does extremely well is how fluent it is, the experience is almost seamless, you can basically go through the whole game without actually racing. By driving around and doing Accolades or tasks if you want to call them, is enough to go through the game and feels rewarding. The game never forces you to do any activities that you dont want to do, and there always different ways to progress.

author: nabby
review: I am currently torn on this game. It is a fantastic addition to the Forza series. Classic Forza graphics, awesome list of cars, better engine tuning than previous games, amazing and massive map (like honestly fantastic), mechanics are, as we know, very good, runs well, and just an easily enjoyable game. (Some users have reported consistent crashes - in the 30 hours I currently have played since early launch, I have had just one)HOWEVER, what makes this a tough one for me, is simply a lack of external car modification. That may, to some, not matter and sound stupid. And that's fine. BUT, to players like me who enjoy cars for widebody kits, customizing cars, JDM, drifting, stance, fenders, bumpers, etc. etc. - this is not it. They launched with the claim of EVEN MORE CUSTOMIZATION. They simply did not deliver on this promise in my opinion. Yes, there are a few more cars that have some nice mods, but they don't have Rocket Bunny kits. That alone destroys the potential for the JDM classics that we have loved for years and something like over 20 cars that used them in previous Horizon games. Just gone. It honestly puts a sour taste in my mouth. If you are like me and enjoy building out something like a BRZ, 240sx, 350z (insert car here) with an amazing kit, go play a previous game. Until they add more bodykits in, or, at the very least, get back that beloved Rocket Bunny license, I honestly can't recommend this for drift/JDM enthusiasts like myself.

author: Parge Lenis
review: 150.00 $ for this ? Really?  (the game can't be refunded after 2 hours of playing time. Another reason to stay away).The BAD:- Glitches are everywhere and are breaking the economy. You can literally sit AFK and grind levels while you sleep . Â­You can literally print money with Super spins from the Willy jeep mastery. That means you can have 400 cars in two days and around 60 mil credits. Also you can buy cars that aren't even out yet (no need to get them from the festival).- Visual bugs and low stability. You can be in a race or just discovering the map and see your frames drop for no reason. A lot of people still encounter major performance hits and CPU usage spikes, often staying at 100%, and result to restarting the game to try to regain performance. Sometimes there's multiples horizontal black lines that is ruining the image.- The multiplayer is for casual player and it forces you to play a type of race. They removed the ranked system to have it MMR based which is okay but you can't even look for Road races (S1) or just Dirt (A). When you queue you need to be lucky to find the races you want or you will be forced to play CC or Mixed road surfaces. Also when they removed the ranked system they removed the lap/gap/split time. So you have no idea how far you are ahead or if the person behind you is gaining on you on certain part of the race.- No mute option. You are force to listen to the people with open mics in your race. You can mute yourself but not the others. The only fix is to mute the game in the volume mixer.-Nothing is new from Horizon 4. It's the same game but with better graphics (if it's not lagging).The GOOD:- Visual update on the cars and the sounds of the vehicles are really well made.- Improved story line.- Great graphics when you boot the game (sometimes).PC info: Intel Core i7-8700KAsus ROG MAXIMUS X HEROCorsair Vengeance LPX 16 GB (2 x 8 GB) DDR4-3000Samsung 960 EVO 500 GB M.2-2280 NVME Solid State DriveAsus GeForce RTX 3080 Ti 12 GB TUF GAMING OC Video CardAsus TUF Gaming VG27AQ 27.0" 2560x1440 165 Hz MonitorEdits : Correcting some errors and adding pc specs.

author: srslytho
review: Changed to recommended, because enough issues have been ironed out. Though my feelings remain all the same: I'd take my $80 back and buy back on a bigger sale had I not left it open by accident over the refund period, because it just feels like an extension of FH4 rather than an entirely new game worthy of a new AAA price.  I used to think that the new sound alone was worth the price of admission, but the longer I play, the less that matters, and the more the flaws seep in. Once you get past the novelty of the new map, sounds, and graphics â€“ this is FH4 all over again and while 4 has its fair share of flaws, seasons were a major feature. Horizon 5 didnâ€™t contribute a lot we havenâ€™t seen. It takes the formula and makes it bigger. Unfortunately, bigger doesnâ€™t always mean better.If I have to point out  major issue: Itâ€™s progression. There isnâ€™t any, nor are there any goal to the game. Making a game this open-ended is a double-edged sword. Put it this way: I set my goal to collect cars. All Iâ€™m missing are playlist exclusive cars, and I canâ€™t do jack **** about it but wait. No oneâ€™s selling a Civic RX on the AH, and itâ€™ll be free on the playlist. So that, for one, takes away the incentive of racing to grind money to buy cars. Because you canâ€™t buy it. At all.That puts us to my biggest gripe: Seasonal playlists. Itâ€™s the true progression. The â€œstory modeâ€ presents little value â€“ you can probably finish every race in the game in a day; another for the story if you can stand the dialogue. After which the content that remains is either drip-fed weekly or community made. I never liked it. It time-gates core contents and pulls on your FOMO. If you miss a season, youâ€™ll miss rare cars. Your other options are to buy them at extortionate rates from the auction house or wait to see a rerun. What is this, a gacha? At some point I stopped having fun and just apathetically did things to get the rewards I want in a season. Or even not at all with Extreme E. Thereâ€™s been a lot of improvements like featuring required cars as a reward in another challenge/shop, however the plethora of atrocious Trackmania-esque Eventlabs and Extreme E season that requires the use of  for 8 championships a month and rewards you with an exciting array of palette-swapped cars, palette-swapped race suits, or palette-swapped helmets highlights the fundamental issue of the playlist.IMO playlist feels like it goes against the whole appeal of Forza. What I loved about Motorsport 3-4 when I switched from GT4 was the liberty. There was a lot to do, but it never felt like a chore because you always have multiple options. It takes time and effort to get your first supercar, but not egregiously so (ahem mandatory license tests), and you can do things at your pace because that shiny Lamborghini isnâ€™t going away in a week. So if you're going to make a game with 500+ cars and zero direction and progressionâ€“Why wall people from getting the cars they want by making them only attainable whenever the devs say so in a playlist? I felt the same way about FH4â€™s, but it at least has a  online mode. Even at my most burnt, I can still play FH4 longer. Roam online, chill, pull up to a Forzathon, see if anyone else's a weeb. Its lobbies fits 60-70 players and you can see them all over the map. FH5 online feels dead as you can only see people in your immediate area and no one plays Arcade. Iâ€™ve never seen more than 10 people on the map at once, and soloâ€™d most Arcades. If this was a limitation from the bigger map, it proves my earlier point.The racing is not entirely pleasant. PvE, I think weâ€™re all fluent enough in English to know what unbeatable means, so let's not play genius â€“ it should be more figurative than literal. You're not fighting the AI for their driving prowess, but their ability to ignore laws of physics. Unbeatable placing you dead last to waste your time with traffic may require you to channel your inner Sennaâ€”specifically Suzuka 1990 Senna, T-boning your opponent into the first corner. A trick the machine learning AI certainly learned. I enjoy my fair share of challenges, but when said challenge is obnoxiously artificial, itâ€™s not fun. It's cheap, difficult for the sake of being so. Some may argue this is even more satisfying, but truly, I'm not enough of a masochist to see that. I have a 6 paragraph rant about the AI of this game, but in short, just look up FH5 Unbeatable drag race and tell me how "Git Gud" can mitigate that.As for PvP - I thank the return of custom open, however the fact that it wasn't available from launch paints an unflattering picture of PGG's decision making. We still have ridiculously inefficient matchmaking, long load times, nonexistent balancing/woefully inaccurate PI/stats, wallriding penalty that canâ€™t tell honest crashes instead of making wallriding less effective, and the removal of ranked that meant to, quote: "create a safe online environment" giving the exact opposite effectâ€”placing the rammers, tryhard meta drivers refusing to get off their Boneshakers/Mosler GT3s, poor sod in a stock car, and everyone else who just wanna drive their favourite cars, all in the same pool.If you think Iâ€™m just a bitter old manâ€“youâ€™re not completely wrong. I can grovel on for days, but I'm petty because I've been a fan since Motorsport 3. I'm not obliged to blindly like a game I paid $80 when it has issues from its predecessor a decade agoâ€”like having to manually scroll through hundreds of your own decals just to find Pirelli. It's not to say that FH5 is a bad game. It's technically apt, but creatively stagnantâ€“having another HW DLC is proof. At its very core, the driving model is IMO still the best of its kind, Mexico while not visually all that exciting has tons of fun roads, and when stars align and rammers are gone, even an online race can be fun. However, in addition to the wall of text above, it feels like it has shifted its attention to a demographic with the attention span of a goldfish. They wrote this game for an age group that Iâ€™m confident does not give a single **** about the dialogue, while the rest of us have to suffer.Prior to FH4, the last Forza I played was FM4 and FH1 (we don't talk about FH2 X360), and I felt an overwhelming familiarity, good and bad. And this is FH4.5. It's been 10 years since Horizon 1, and beyond the graphics, I don't think we've evolved enough. Horizon's too comfortable without competitors. What else is there? A 4 year old Ubisoft game and a game axed not one year post release because EA? I'm not under the impression that interior animations have improved much if at all since FM3, and their answer to unique shift animations is still to completely ignore itâ€“but we can now do the Macarena. With Rocket Bunny gone, the 240SX, S13, S14, and S15 Silvia have the exact same body mods they had in FM3. The 86/BRZ had less than in FH2. Gran Turismo had an insanely detailed photo mode since GT4 on the PS2. 10 years ago they sold paint as a paid DLC. Now they have a livery editor with SVG import feature and window decals. It took T10/PGG 13 years to reimplement caliper paint, a feature in FM2. I guess they also turned the livery editor UI vertical. Which IMO is worse. Matter of fact tons of UI elements in this game felt amateurish, but I can yap all the way to November on that topic. On the topic of liveries, I refuse to believe that I canâ€™t transfer hundreds of my liveries from FH4 (MS Store) to FH5 (Steam) because of â€œtechnical limitationsâ€. Thatâ€™s my first experience with this game, and maybe why Iâ€™m so ticked off, and a big part of why I amassed 300+ hours.To sum? IDK. Driving fast good; janky Saturday-morning cartoon Spanglish dialogue bad. No progress make man paint car for 300 hours. Goodbye.

author: Arrowhead
review: Really great game.I haven't played a car simulator game since Gran Turismo 6 on PS3. I'm glad I finally bit the bullet and decided to give Forza a try.I think there are around 700 vehicles in this game, and the 'custom liveries' feature is one of the coolest things I've seen in a game in a while. Basically, people make their designs, or download designs from others. Some of these livery makers are very talented. You get nearly unlimited aesthetic customization via this feature.Stay away from the Hot Wheels DLC. It is awful. I DO however believe the base prices for the single DLC cars is fair. I like how you don't necessarily need to 'buy' the DLC cars. You can snag them from the game's auction house from other players, often at reasonable in-game prices.There is a lot of emergent gameplay in this video game. I can't even count how many impromptu unofficial drag races I've had w/ other players in my freeroam worlds. Players usually count to three, by honking a horn, and then everybody takes off! A lot of fun, even if your stats aren't recorded. Racing, and showing off to other players in-game is very enjoyable as well.Game is pretty expensive at 79.99 CAD. Damn, I remember when main title AAA games were 59.99 CAD!Game is pretty bug free, I haven't really encountered anything egregious or amateur looking. Only issues I've had is an occasional CtD, but I've never lost any data.I can't recommend this game enough to people who love customization / tuning. The game's cars can be minutely tweaked, or as crazy as a '76 Jeep Renegade drag racer that hits 350 kph+ in less than 10 seconds. The choice is yours, and different cars have different uses. I don't really care for the story, or any of the characters in the game except my own. The story hasn't really given me any reason to get attached to them, and I couldn't tell you a single first name of their's without having to look it up. The setting in this game is great, being open-world, you get a huge area to explore, and seemingly unlimited track variations, as there are over 500+ roads present in this game. Mexico and its countryside are treated beautifully by this game's artists. The game really has a unique look to it.I feel that I've only just touched the surface of this game. I've yet to make a custom design for my car myself, and I haven't even collected 1/8th of the cars yet. I've barely progressed past level 55 in my save. That's another feature I like, the levelling up system, and the constant gaining of points while driving. The more advanced you drive, the more EXP, the more CR. Quite a sophisticated system, really. Game also has a spinning wheel device that grants you amazing prizes at random between races. You can win anything from a new car to 150,000CR. Not going to lie this is quite addicting, and I get excited every time I use it. Not sure what that says about me, as I don't gamble IRL.Oh yeah, don't think this game is restricted to just conventional asphalt races - there's everything from hill descents to offroad racing, to trailblazing, to speed zones, to drift zones, to gymkhana, etc etc. This game has a bit of everything.I run this game on an RTX 3080 + an i9, 16GB RAM, on extreme settings, (or ultra, whatever they called it). This game is super optimized. It runs super low on my card - despite the graphics being exquisite. Draw distance and reflections in this game are especially great. I also on a side note love the near unlimited variations you can do w/ your character's appearance. Like said previously, customization is the name of the game in this one.Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys video games. I'm sure anyone who picks this up will enjoy the gameplay, and the natural interactions you have w/ players in-game.9/10, if I was to assign a rating.

author: MY ASS
review: The game is fun.  A big problem with this game is you can't stage your car for any race.  There's no count-down and that means you're pedal to the metal once the race starts.  Then you have at least 3 seconds of not being able to tell what RPM your car is at.  It makes it hard to turn up the difficulty because you're setting there roasting your tires and not getting optimal straight line performance.  This ruins some of the competition playing online without any visual clue what gear to be in at the beginning.  It's obvious this game needs refinement as well as it's pretty buggy with navigating the menu UI while trying simply alter the graphics setting.All this being said, the game is stunning.  Off-roading a real vehicle you'd normally play in Forza Motorsport is basically why I bought this game and that makes it fun to play.  It's a good time if you're looking to simply fool around.

author: Fabityagi
review: I don't usually write reviews, but this game has made me so disappointed that I think I will make an exception. First, I will start by listing the good parts of my experience with FH5:The refund process was great, the code garbage was off my steam account in a couple of hours, big thumbs up there.Secondly, I will list the negatives, the intro of the game feels like it was made for a target demographic of infants, even if you manage to fail the first showcase mission which in itself is pretty much a miracle, you keep on getting praised like the special little snowflake you are. But aside from the cringy at best, and downright insulting to intelligent beings, story. The driving itself, you know the most important thing in a driving game has gotten worse and worse with each new horizon game. 1 was good, 2 was the best out of all of the horizon parts, 3 was not great, 4 was bad, and this is just garbage. I was playing with a Logitech G29 for the most part, and the force feedback was astoundingly good for horizon, Motorsport 7's is still way better but it's good enough for an arcade racer. The thing that annoyed me most is that the cars had no grip in the rear, like with all the other horizon parts RWD cars are pretty much garbage until you swap out the drivetrain to AWD. In Motorsport 7 RWD is drivable, so it's not like they don't know how driving RWD should feel in an arcade racer, Microsoft just decided that horizon does not deserve the work needed to overhaul the driving system, rather they'll put in the option to have prosthetic arms and switch pronoun at will. WHO CARES ABOUT THE MAIN CHARACTER IN A DRIVING GAME? Put the character in a race suit and BE DONE WITH IT. TLDR FH3 but a different map and better force feedback on wheels. If you want an inclusion simulator full price is fair, if you want an arcade racer full price is an insult, id maybe recommends getting it for 20-25 bucks, but more than that is an insult to basic human intelligence.

author: Deyione Scott-Wilson Eason
review: Since nobody is going to say it, I will.The map isn't really that good. Most of the land surrounding the festival are just full of boring streets and desert. There are definitely areas that are fun that's for sure, but it seems empty and barren. After traveling miles in any direction it seems to overcome this, but players seem to gravitate towards only a few areas (the festival, the volcano, etc..) which makes the entire game feel like nobody is there to play with you (at least in single-player). In addition to those cons about the map, there are bugs that cannot be overlooked at the moment with constant crashing and disconnecting among all users playing the game since launch. Although all of these bugs will probably be fixed within the month, it's ruined the entire experience for me; especially when you're about to win a race or are in the middle of a sick drift, and then the game completely shuts down on you or your car stops instantaneously. Although this new arrival in the Horizon series brings many new cool things for racers to enjoy, it's just not a game i'd recommend.TL;DR map feels boring and empty, cannot resolve with a convoy because of bugs currently in game. Constant freezing and crashing while playing the game among all players

author: Kurt Nobrain
review: This game basically feels like , in a new location. IMO, a worse location, but at least it's a bit bigger. Hopefully DLC will spice it up like they did for 4. CONS: - Very cringe dialogue + unskippable cutscenes = pain- Very overwhelming map and the game doesn't do a good job of explaining things to you- Online play feels like a regression from 4, with no ranked mode and the 30 second timer forcing you out of menus when queuing in a convoy- No good sense of progression in the base game, but then for some reason in the hot wheels dlc they added progression which locks you out of everything you've already unlocked. Pretty weird, the progression should've been in the base gamePROS: - Performance is good - Easily locks at 60 fps on 1440p (i7 9700k, 1070 TI). Solid 60 FPS on Steam Deck as well ! - Gameplay is fun as ever- Tons of car options - Tons of race optionsIn conclusion, this game feels like a reskinned  but that game was really fun so... Update: The Hot Wheels DLC is pretty darn fun, I liked it a lot more than the lego DLC for FH4. I still don't really like Mexico, but the racing feels good :shrug:

author: Johnny Platinumhand
review: I don't like racing games. The last one I played was Grand Turismo 5 on PS3. Can't say I loved it, but I had some fun playing. Now after many years I buy a racing game. Basically because there is nothing else fun to play. And I should say this game impressed me from the very start. It's just beautiful to the eye: graphics are awesome, scenery is gorgeous. Driving is more than enjoyable. I would genuinely love the game... if it weren't for some flaws. There is not many, but they are exterimely annoying. First, the game crushes sometimes. Generally, I don't complain much about it in other games, but crushes in Forza are absolutely annoying. They happen in the middle of customization, reset my build and make me do it all over again. Second and most discouraging for me and my friend - co-op is a complete mess right now. It's hard to get into same lobby, and if we manage to do so, one of us disconnects shortly after. We can't play some game modes because after completing them we get stuck in one screen for eternity. Current state of co-op completely discourages me from playing with friends. I really hope this issues will be fixed soon. The game itself is very fun, I never thought I could enjoy a racing game that much. P.S. Some problems have been fixed, I can finally play with my friend with almost no issues. I think the game deserves a positive review now.

There are 2 problems with this game that makes me not recommend it. If you buy it for the eliminator aka battle royale or the playground games, ur gonna rage a lot. Physics in this game does not make any â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ sense. No matter how fast ur going, if you just hit a root on a tree, ur whole car stops, it doesnt drive over it or fly over it, it just â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ stops and its really pissing me off. If your playing the eliminator and ur driving into the forest/slump or whatever it is, ur finished. Theres also a bunch of logs in the forest that makes ur car go stuck, so thats fun.The second problem is a really strange technical problem. Every time I challenge or get challenged in the eliminator, my game always freeze for whole 2 seconds right when the destination in placed, which means that my car always just gets out of control because I cant see what im doing. This is so annoying because if my opponents car is the same level as mine or right below mine, he gets the biggest head start and ive lost.I've played the eliminator a lot and I've had a lot of fun, but those physics and technical issue is getting pretty â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ annoying. Also in playground games, trees are just the deadliest thing in this game apparently

author: For Goguryeo
review: The map is better than FH4, Game-play is about the same but slightly improved.Looks phenomenal, might have a decreased roster of cars, but more cars are going to be added to keep the game fresh. For example the last updated added a total of 8 cars and the game is updated frequently.People that are not recommending the game are most likely running into bugs or wanted to keep money farming. The money farmers are complaining because they can't play the game as it was intended to, you are not meant to have all the best cars after 20-40 hour or so, it has been like that since Forza Horizon 1. This game is about actually about playing the game/story mode and earning money and wheel spins through that.

author: Swatmatfindiddly
review: I've had fun, but this is nearly the same game as Forza Horizon 4.  It seems to have less content because the map no longer changes with the seasons. Biggest gripe after many Horizons, the career races are too short.  Boring has hell racing a 3 lap race, or a 3 minute sprint, etc.  There are 3 long races and they span the entire map.  Fun, but there is no middle ground.  Sure you can change a circuit race to be as many laps as you want with blueprints, but it doesn't count toward progression.The blueprint system is improved in that you can now place objects in your blueprints.  Trailers, grand stands, jumps, ramps, tractors, dinosaurs, it's all a great way to add life to a custom track. It's very fun to build your own track where ever you want, but the system needs some work.   One example, you cannot edit your tracks after setting the finish line.  This is insanely annoying.  You put a lot of time into a track and TEST DRIVE it, but cannot edit after the test drive.  WHAT THE **** IS THE POINT OF A TEST DRIVE IF YOU CANNOT UNDO WHAT YOU HAVE PREVIOUSLY DONE?!  And quite often the custom assets will not load into the map the first time you start a race.  Great start, needs improvement. Short career races is a design flaw and not likely to change. Updates bring new bugs or races don't function correctly. I hope they can put some TLC into the blueprint system and it's checkpoints to improve it. This game is such a sub par version compared to previous entries,  can't recommend it until they fix all this crap.

author: Ronin
review: This game is great. The graphics are amazing and the game actually runs smooth. However, I cannot recommend it at the time of writing this review due to one major flaw. The main thing that makes the Forza Horizon fun for me is the ability to just drive cool cars around in free roam in a convoy with my friends. It is impossible to do that at the moment because first of all it is hard to even get in a convoy. In FH4 you could just easily join people on your friends list in game. Now in FH5 you have to minimize the game and pull up the xbox app on your desktop and join them from that. More importantly though, once you get in a convoy you can't even drive together because your convoy members constantly disappear and reappear. It has been nearly a month since this game came out and this is still an issue.

author: How
review: As someone who has played all 5 Horizon games, Horizon 5 is the best title in the franchise so far. It has the best graphics, most amount of features, the biggest and arguably the best map,  better seasons then Horizon 4 and much more. Now the question comes, is it worth the price for you? It depends. If you have played Horizon 4 and you can't get enough of it, then you'll feel right at home with Horizon 5, the gameplay is very similar with minor improvements overall. However, if you have played the Horizon 4 and you didn't like the handling and progression, there is almost no point of buying Horizon 5.If you are new to the franchise however, I think this is the best open world racing game out there as of this review.

author: Recreational Drowning
review: I would recommend this game to people who are car/racing fans. There are lots and lots of cars. That is one definite pro to this game for sure. The one issue with this fact is, they all feel very similar to drive. There is definite lack of responsiveness to driving cars. This has been an issue in my opinion that have plagued all of the forza titles. They focus on having so many cars and so much variety that much fewer attention is put into place for making them feel unique to drive. The best way for me to really truly explain this issue, is if whom ever reads this, that they should go and play "Dirt 4" with realism settings on. That game has much fewer cars and its clear that every single one of those cars drive differently, sound differently, and behave differently on multi-terrain. In that game, one particular car might feel better and drive better to one person than another. I wish this were the case to forza. Other racing titles, such as wreckfest and need for speed heat even have better driving controls than forza. That's because there are much fewer cars. So more attention was put into making them feel different. The sad truth to this game is: Yes at some point i may have 600+ different cars in my garage like the last two games, I may only end up driving a dozen of them, depending on the type of event and their effectiveness. But Hey, there's more tire smoke and the cars sound better.

author: gw
review: ORIGINAL POST, NOV 9th:Performance issues after around an hour of gameplay, collision glitches when jumping from high places in Baja races on some specific vehicles, extremely short LOD distances on foliage, and an exploit that allows you to use an X class car on lower class races by selecting a car of any class and then picking a tune of a way higher class in the pre-race tuning menu. These are some of the issues I've encountered so far. The one where the performance tanks after a while and the foliage LOD being extremely short are very serious issues which require IMMEDIATE attention.Other than these issues, this game is very good, so definitely recommend as long as Playground keep themselves busy solving these issues.EDIT, NOV 15th:Today it's been a week since the official release of the game. The """""hotfix""""" which Playground has been promising since Day 1 of the early access has no "hotfix" in it unless the definition has changed, as I far as I know, a hotfix does not take 2 weeks, since these patches aim to fix urgent issues in a fittingly urgent manner. Playground games has proven how little they care about this game by allowing gamebreaking issues repeatedly reported by the community to remain there untouched for what seems to be at least 2 weeks until the "hotfix" release. Allow me to note the glitches which affect this game, in addition to the ones I already mentioned, which have obviously not been fixed.-Constant crashes.-Performance tanking inevitably after about an hour of uninterrupted gameplay (if you're lucky enough for the game to not crash at least twice in this period of time).-Car automatically resetting itself out of nowhere.-Constant disconnections from the game servers.-The suspension of certain vehicles may glitch through the ground after a hard jump (particularly the GMC truck in my case).-The rocks on the sides of the cliffs near Hotel Mirador Balderrama have missing textures and can be seen through.-Some accolades simply do not drop, this wouldn't be such a big deal if it was just a few, but some of them are related to achievements or bigger accolades, breaking those as well. For example, I can't get the achievement "A Royal Affair" because 1: it simply won't drop when I meet the requirements, 2: the butterflies literally just don't spawn in Horizon Life lobbies, just races and Super7 challenges. So far I've experienced this kind of issues with 15+ accolades.-Related to the connection issues, the game might forget you belong to a Club every now and then.-Issues that make the game's graphics glitch out when some specific GPU settings are present in NVIDIA GPUs.-Ground textures glitching out and being replaced with some bizarre black water looking texture, and the infamous low LOD distance issues.-The pothole textures in the Cara Este drift zone interrupt your point build-up, this can be perceived in game as suddenly ceasing to receive point when driving over them (I'm not sure of whether this is a glitch or a feature, either way it should be removed as it is nothing more than annoying and limiting when going for high scoring runs).-Some VIP benefits simply don't work, for example I had to pay in credits for some houses that the VIP thing is supposed to cover, with this even displaying in-game, but for some reason the game simply forced me to buy it anyway, so there go 1,5 mil Credits. I'm also not sure if I'm getting double credits, I should check this as other people have reported it.There are many more glitches which others have been reporting, but these are the most notable that I've encountered so far. It's unacceptable for a triple A game to not only release a game in this state but also refuse to fix it in any way, other than hiding behind the "there's a hotfix coming" argument when a hotfix is supposed to be a QUICK patch.NOV 19th:The hotfix finally came out, but as expected, it barely fixed anything. The level of incompetence is so unimpressive that it depresses me to think that this is the current state of game development. The only issue that was fixed seems to be the connection issues, everything is still the same.NOV 24th:Please fix this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ alreadyDEC 4th:A patch launched today. Horizon Arcade has been rebalanced and improved in a few ways so now it is possible to complete, even while alone. Some accolades have been fixed. Like 24 new cars. The game performance seems to be a bit more stable now. Connection seems more stable as well. Game is now more recommendable, but still more stuff to fix.DEC 11th:New series has already begun, I could not get the Min, Meet Max achievement because it was literally impossible due to glitches. First thing after new series starts? There's already a new glitched challenge. By this point the developer's incompetence is astonishing, honestly this game couldn't be any less recommendable.### EDIT, switched to LinuxIf you have an NVIDIA GPU on Linux, good luck getting past the first loading screen.

author: 26B
review: Wide as an ocean, shallow as a pond; Forza Horizon 5 offers a beautiful map and tons of cars. The catch? There's nothing to do! I just dont find myself enjoying this game anymore.There are so many issues with this game I don't know where to start really-Incredibly dated car models, some are from a game so old the model is approaching age of consent, and look awful with their Xbox era proportions, badly hidden by what I assume was spamming the subdivision modifier in blender.-Devs outright lied about "upgrading models" of cars-Devs hyped up their dedication to actual proper engine sounds, definitely an improvement over FH4 but still terrible, still tons of reused sounds-Missing tons of BASIC QOL features-Devs have gone out and outright acknowledged the dozens of convertible cars that did not have the feature as advertised, and said they WILL NOT be fixing it-Series and seasonal rewards are as lackluster as you could imagine, including but not limited to: Cars you get at the start of the game, cars that cost 50k credits on the autoshow, the same car from last week!-The recent "World Cup" series has been nothing but a slap in the face, forcing you to use ONE SPECIFIC CAR from each country, creating horrible balance. Even worse? The prize cars can all be bought on the autoshow, nothing unique or exciting to work for!-Numerous occasions where a seasonal challenge (TREASURE CHESTS COUGH) were outright broken, devs couldnt be bothered to fix themTo summarize: This game is nothing but a cash grab, it feels like FH4 with better graphics and a new map. The devs have been lazy, outright disrespectful, and have shown 0 interest in fixing this mess of a game. The devs have 0 passion or interest for cars or car culture, the dialogue in this game is utterly horrible, the injection of random spanish words in english speaking feels cringy and almost racist!I feel I've rambled here, but hopefully you get what im saying; this game sucks, the devs are disrespectful, don't know anything about car culture, and have interpreted it as this weird millionaire influencer playground. I can't stand this gameDont buy this game, Don't support these devs

The menu is pretty confusing at first, and the whole "festival" theme and point.  But overall it's a really fun game.  It reminds me of a mix between GTA5, Red Dead Redemption 2, Far Cry, and Grand Turismo, all in one game.

author: UniquePlayer12
review: You remember what Mister Smith explains to Neo in the first Matrix-movie? The first Matrix was a perfect world, without any form of evil, jealousy or greed, but people just went nuts, because humans apparently need an imperfect world. Forza Horizon 5 is that first Matrix-simulation and it drives me completely mad. From the get go you're this automobile-superhero that the world's been waiting for. Hordes of 24-year old (practically no exceptions) British people (after leaving the EU they decided to invade Mexico for no obvious reason), cheer you on in your overpowered vehicle. From the first second the game presents you some of the top cars. This might make some people jealous in the real world, but not in this game. Everybody is all smiles and giggles. Even the poor Mexican farmers who own the lands you thoroughly destroy with your plethora of luxury cars will never protest because: They love the races so much! Let me get this straight: The game is wonderfully made, visuals are top notch, sound is great and it works like a charm, but there is absolutely NO reason to play it. You don't need to race for better cars or better gear, because it doesn't get much better then your starting-kit, just more of the same. There's no antagonist you want to beat, because everybody is happy and technically you're already the greatest hero that has ever moved itself on four wheels, so why bother? If this is your wet dream, then go for it, but i think this game is perfectly boring. And just like that first version of the Matrix, I can't be in it because it drives me utterly insane.

author: sekajcobra
review: Changing negative review now that I've figured it out and enjoyed it for a while.Enough hours pouring through obscure reddit threads and I collected a ritual to get it running pretty stable.  It was annoying since forza reddits tend to delete threads that complain about instability so I had to dig up older ones where people gave advice.-set the game to run as admin.  This should only have to be done once.-validate files before every launch-go to C:\Users\(username)\AppData\Local\Temp-delete the folder Turn10Temp.scratch before every launch.  I do this while validating.  Creating a shortcut to the temp folder saves time.-launch game-open task manager-kill explorer.exe-change priority of forza.exe to High-go into in-game settings and change any setting.  I change the speedometer to digital and back to analog.After performing this ritual, the game runs fine.  I don't know which step(s) are the critical ones and I don't care to experiment to find out.  It's the collection of any and every little suggestion I've come across.  Crashes have become rare as long as I follow all the steps.

author: Scorpion
review: Being this is the only Forza Horizon that I have played I do not have much to go off of. That being said this game is my most favourite racing game I have in my possession and will still be one year+ from now.I have a few cons about this game however but let's start with the pros;-Pros        -The map is massive, the biggest I have seen on any racing game.        -It has the longest straight road that is the highway going from far left to far right and it is         perfect for testing out top speed, this game also has quite a few long roads that go all         around the map perfect for driving a getting in some practice around corners and braking         times and such.        -The vast amount of cars and races in Forza Horizon 5 and with many more to come         means that there will be many hours spent in this game without getting bored.        -With the Playlist being a thing there will always be more items to obtain whether it be         clothes, horns, money, cars or even wheel spins to get even more of those things adds to the         game even more.-Cons        -I have seen on quite a few occasions the graphics bug out, lately I have seen glitched         grass, trees and bushes as in they are rainbow pixels that turn into the correct item         once I get close enough. The roads have also been going either rainbow, no ground at         all or black with a metal type texture to it. Maybe it's PC issues only.        -Coming from Need for Speed where every car has mass amounts of customisation and         playing this game, in my opinion the cars lack that aspect. I think cars in this Forza Horizon         should have more customisation, although it will change to performance of the car some         people might want to have customised cars that look amazing outside of the performance         class cars that the game has already.But that being said I love this game and will always love it. I 100% recommend this game to any racing game fanatic it is fantastic.

author: Gromelon
review: Welcome to Forza Horizon 5, a huge pile of legacy code that can't and won't ever be fixed completely if previous installment is any indication. A great game and almost ideal balance between arcade and simcade that is utterly ruined by being in alpha state at best and that will try and kill your enjoyment at every turn.No matter how many patches they roll out, FH4 has shown us all a simple fact. The game is utterly broken in many aspects that devs are unable to fix, be it due to incompetence or new generation of coders inability to make sense of all the twists of legacy code put on top of itself in a huge, ugly Frankenstein's monster. When they fix one thing, two more things break. They fix one of those two things - old thing they fixed breaks again. Etc, etc. It goes, and goes, until they arbitralily decide it will have to do, when in fact it won't do at all. Some bugs and crashes in FH5 go as far as FH4 release, and they are still here, and they are here to stay.That said, you won't get a better overall racing experience outside of actual simulators than from FH5. The game is just this big, racing feels just this good, and it gets better and better as you learn how to tune and drive. Sadly, there's just no competition. Not on PC. Forza Motorsport roots made sure modern NFS and Driveclub racing feels like junior karting in comparison, and Gran Turismo is kept as Play Station exclusive title.I can't recommend buying it. Not on Steam and not for full price. Technical state of the game is just this bad. If you want to try it, use Game Pass, in there base version is free and if you want to pay for upcoming expansions, car pass etc - your MS account will save all progress if you then decide to either upgade base version by either buying premium bundle in MS store or premium edition here on Steam.

review: Most of the issues I had with Forza Horizon 4 were fixed in this game including the AI pathing and teleporting. Because of that I wish I could give it a positive review but they took so many steps back as well.Reduced the timer to join an event to a few seconds.Constant matchmaking bugs cause you to have to wait 3 minutes for the race to load for you to leave and re-create your party to get your friends who were left behind.Took away the ability for party members to borrow the leader's car for many events.I'll change my review when the devs start to use their brains and put basic quality of life into the game but they probably never will because microsoft.

Horizon 4 feels larger than Horizon 5. The map as been poorly put together. I hope that next time they create a map this large that the creators will attempt to make it more complex.

author: ThreeLineRifle
review: FH5 is just more FH4 so if 4 was ok or so-so move along.Whats 5 get right?The biomes are actually pretty varied with openish desert in the center, mountains North, jungle South and beaches East and West with the East side being tourist infested and the West side pretty barren.More tire types with the snow type not locked until winter.Now the bad.The menus are worse than 4. The buttons feel like someone who liked the 90's web design thought that style should come back. It should not.The car list is.... awful to look at. I swear I've seen this weird angle in a railroad themed game 20 years ago and was meh then.Physics have changed from 4 and others. I use a Datsun 510 with a "Squishy Tune" which I've had in the car since Forza 3. AWD, 2.6L TT engine, ride height max, all rebound soft. It handles odd as it can corner on just 3 wheels and bunny hop. In FH4 if it rained this tune would cause "extra traction" and roll overs were easy to do. Here in FH5 it rolls over pretty easy as is. Havent been able to bunny hop reliably like games passed.Game modes dont get much explanation.The car to music volume was done poorly. I would spend the time to properly balance it so I can hear the music but the music choices in the game are not worth the time. FH4 had 1 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, 1 bleh and the rest ok on the rock station. FH5's list are not â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ but they dont make me want to race. Top Gear, Cruisin' USA, NFS Underground, Wreckfest and others have at least 1 song to get you in a racing mood. Hell, Surfin Bird is less repetitive than some in this game.The AI has not changed from FH4 which is BAD. Do not touch them and don't let them touch you as you will lose unless its one of those floored into the corner crashes and even then they WILL be on track before you in most cases. The AI will ride the "Fastest" line like their lives depend on it, they probably do, so use that to your advantage. What I race is anything like 1985 and older so if you do too make sure you go for engine, AWD and tires before ANY handling mods as the AI goes for those style of upgrades. This has been an issue since FM 4, released in 2011, where acceleration is king vs handling in more cases than the other way around.Going to keep updating as I find new good or bad:The online  racing was so bad in 4 races in a row. Cars ping off into the wilds, popping into existence, not drifting but literally sideways, bouncing off players as things bounce around. The 510 Squishy Tuned Datsun got dragged into 3 races. HOO BOY it was AWFUL. The Forza Motorsports games with this tune on the 510 was pretty predicable, FH4 I had to avoid rain and this game it has too much side grip so it rolls too easy. Now instead of just 3 variants of the same tune its now FIVE. Took out a non racing car as I was just there for the points as I needed 1 so I did the Online event. This tune handles drastically different in these 3 races than just bumming around in free roam or the Arcade or AI races. The suspension would make these weird little jumps for no reason which made it hard to drive smoothly. As another player got closer these weird ticks got worse and worse. I didn't expect to finish well but this was nearly undrivable trying to corner.

author: jermike
review: The Windows 10 version of Forza 5 is absolutely unplayable on my computer that has an AMD Ryzen 9 3900X twelve-core processor, 64gb memory, and MSI Gaming Radeon RX 5500 XT video card in it.  My internet connection is fiber-optic and the "Speedtest by Ookla" test I just ran on it says my connection speed is: Download - 94.81 Mbps / Upload - 65.90 Mbps.  My computer and my internet connection are not the issue.Regardless of how low (or high) I set the graphics and video quality in the game, it is so choppy, it can't be played.  Each time you make a settings change, you have to restart the game and "enjoy" the opening 2 or 3 minute video scene (after the 1 or 2 minute load time).  I suppose you eventually get past this opening scene; if you make it that far in the game.  I never did.  In spite of doing my own online searches, updating drivers, looking on Steam for help, and trying setting change after setting change, I could never get the game to play satisfactorily.  It was always so choppy the car was essentially uncontrollable.  After â€œresearching, updating, restarting, and watching the 2 or 3 minute opening videoâ€ over and over (and over and over, and over and overâ€¦), I am not sure how many hours I spent (unsuccessfully) trying to get the game to work acceptably.  But, I do know Steam considered it â€œgaming timeâ€, because they denied my request for a refund because I was logged into the game for over two hours.  I was really logged in for 4+ hours over several days after I purchased Forza 5, but none of them were actually spent playing the game - only trying to get it to work.  Forza 5 is the first game I purchased through Steam.  Between the game and Steamâ€™s response, Iâ€™m not sure which one Iâ€™m impressed with least.

author: Debo
review: Updated Review: This is still a AAA full price game which requires you to "group up" with other racers to do any type of race vs other people. This is absolutely unacceptable and ruins the game. If you could figure out how to actually get player versus player races to populate I will change the review. I'm okay with setting the radio issues to rest if you just make the game actually competitive and playable. Don't worry about the scoreboards being full past the 100th percentile with hacked scores, just fix the lackluster networking for the LOVE OF GOD.This AAA game has serious problems. Networking issues to the extent that anyone you are trying to play with will vanish either appearing later or tossing you into a new session. Completion of events will also throw a DC notice. Any type of PVP race REQUIRES you to find a "convoy" using a total lack of communications technology to find drivers to join you and then drive to whatever event. They spent a LOT of time on programming COVID masks and making avatars for disabled female minorities and not ANY time improving the radio to at least the base standard of Forza 3. They need to patch to finish this game ASAP fixing networking most of all followed by making it much easier to find actual live players to race against. The fact that an extremely fun and graphically amazing game can have such massive and fundamental shortfalls is embarrassing and emblematic of the current state of AAA gaming. Everyone is using the same avatar because of the woke influence of the publisher and ignoring the people who actually purchase and play the game who are all forced to use the same avatar. They released a patch to address networking issues and now it's even worse.

author: DillyG101
review: This game is a significant step back from the masterpiece that was FH4.PROS:- Great selection of cars- Tuning is a lot of fun and feels rewarding for finding the right setup to tackle an event- The art and design is great, you can tell a lot of passion went into the assets.- Game feels pretty good to play on controller, the cars are challenging but not overly frustrating.CONS:-Online play has gotten significantly worse since FH4. Online worlds are sparsely populated, it's rare that you actually come across someone else while playing open world.- There is significant network issues when playing multiplayer races. For example, post-race leaderboards will display an entirely different order than what was observed, meaning you can finish ahead of another car but still be shown as having lost to them in the post-race leaderboard, which determines series points and rewards.- INSANELY long load times for singular multiplayer races. Not just a load time to get into online, but a wait time of multiple minutes before each race which are only 3-5 minutes long. It's entirely possible that, in a 3 race series, you spend more time in load screens than in races.- Optimization is extremely poor while not bringing any visual improvements from FH4. The graphics look worse and run choppier than the previous game, which I've tested on the same hardware on the same days. The difference in stable FPS is especially jarring.- Don't even bother playing this game with a wheel, the ffb is best described as "numb". Of course in an arcade racer we're not expecting AC levels of accuracy, but some sensation would be nice, and the game is incapable of delivering sensations like wheel spin and rough road to the wheel.I really want to like this game, but it's either a placeholder for whatever's next in the series, or a sign that this series has already reached it's peak and is now on the decline.

author: RuskieDoge1-17
review: This was amazing and very fun to play when it first came out, I grinded the game daily for a month or so then took a bit of a break from it.  Since taking a break from the game the game lost all of my cloud save data somehow so all of my progress everything gone, and now trying to load in is hit or miss game crashes quite a lot, and i cannot get passed the loading screen without disconnecting my wireless headset dongle, very dissapointing.  I expect a lot better out of a game that costed me and thousands of other people 60-100$, i hope they fix the bugs and random crashes soon because it really was a fun game to play.

author: Gray
review: Microsoft continues to deliver a terrible multiplayer system. Buy the game on Steam? Screw you, you have to have a Microsoft account, use the Microsoft XBOX app, join friends through the Microsoft XBOX Game Bar, only to get "Network Disconnected" every 30 seconds.Good luck actually trying to play in a convoy or with friends. I'm sure solo is fine, but my 29 hours of this game has been nothing but pulling my hair out at Microsoft's continued lack of basic programming ability - and not being able to play with friends.Yes, I did raise a ticket with their support. Their outsourced script-following robots told me to do silly things like "sfc /scannow" and reinstall windows. Yet every other multiplayer game I own works fine.Teredo networking is ancient and awful, it's time for MS to put their grownup pants on and implement a real and proper online multiplayer networking experience.

author: dhó ³â§â§eÌ‘Í†Ì‚lÌ¶Ì€ÌŒÌ€Ì€u
review: The game is in such a weird phase right now. Basic Horizon game: open world, all the cars you could ever want in a video game, fun gamemodes with a gorgeous map. However I tried playing with my mates, but they kept disappearing. This is a known bug but i suppose they could've tested this before release. The cutscenes are horrible, repetitive, you can't skip them and on top of that they pop up when you least want them to (no i dont care about unlocking your filthy ticket thingy). Arcade time limit has been reduced which pretty much means you can complete 1 out of 10. All in all an amazing game that has a tremendous amount of flaws. The worst part is that most of these could have been resolved by testing. Beta phase much?

author: ballsak
review: Its more Forza, but better.Forza Horizon has come such a long way, and I feel FH5 brings all of the best pieces of each of the previous games, all in one fat dinner plate of a game. It has its issues, such as lack of (quality) dlc content, pretty mediocre forzathon seasons with recycled prize cars, and some janky (but manageable) wheel support. But nevertheless, the base game has some of the most incredible visuals, the biggest car roster, the most superb car controls and sounds, and an incredible world with plenty, and i mean PLENTY, to do.I'd say wait for a sale and get the deluxe edition, you get the best bang for your buck, and youre not missing out with the mid dlc.I will say that the community management is absolute garbage. Some of the members of the crew that manages the online community and community events are some of the most corrupt pos people ever. This doesnt affect my view of the game however, its two different sides of the company. But i figured i throw it in here :)

author: Hexagonaldonut
review: Generally a very solid racing game, but unfortunately reliant on a Microsoft account, for which sign-in is historically very finicky. I have had multiple instances in the past where I outright haven't been able to play the game because authentication broke somehow. And despite being a full-price game that's , the game relies on this login AND is technically always online, despite multiplayer functionality absolutely not being critical to the core functionality of the game besides populating races with AIs that are literally just normal AIs but with other people's names on them.This game also has a tendency of leveraging FOMO, as limited availability vehicles make up a significant portion of the game's roster, with these vehicles only being available via either a rotating shop or challenges within the game's battle pass equivalent- you have no way of knowing when a particular vehicle is going to become available again. Or even  that vehicle will be available again.With these issues in mind, it's kind of hard to seriously recommend this game, even with me genuinely liking it.

author: Fish
review: I spent 40 minutes trying to get this game to work with my Fanatec wheel.  It won't.  Sorry but as a developer I can't stand this bad of a user experience.  Refunding.EDIT: Bought again and got wheel working.  The game itself is actually pretty good.  Would love to recommend it but I can't go 15 minutes without it crashing.  If I can resolve the issue I'll update my review but since it doesn't even throw an error it's impossible to debug the actual cause.EDIT #2:  Fixing the crashes is impossible.  They don't even throw a helpful error for you to debug it with and that's error handling 101.  They're not going to fix the game either so make sure it's stable on your machine before the refund period is up...

author: jameskanuch
review: This game is frustrating me so very much right now.  I have a 2 month-old high-end PC with a top notch graphics card, and more than ample memory, but the load times are just killing me.  I feel like I spend a LOT more time watching a blank "loading" screen than actually racing.  Only fun is just driving around and not entering events, because it is a certainty that when you do enter an event you will be loading several times (both going in and coming out from the event at the end).  I'm about to give up on it and go play something else because I am just not having fun.

Greed is massive issue and so is the lack of enjoyable non grindy content.edit: after playing another 20 hours it is still remarkable difficult to get credits, even with all the skill points in the world converting them is next to impossible, my review stands.

review: The wrestling bit is so painful I feel like puking every time I play it. Invest these resources in actual content.2. Unlock all cars from the start. People just exploit for credits any way. The entire level/credit system feels tacked on and outdated. I tried to enjoy the Forza Horizon corniness and cringyness for what it is, but it's gone too far. This â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ is painfully dumb.

author: Racecar Johnny
review: Played on game pass, can't use the save I had there because no cross-save, event though it exists for Microsoft Store and Xbox. Not changing this review until this is changed.Update:Eventlab Creation does not allow you to edit a route after saving it, so if the checkpoints are bugged, kiss that route goodbye, because you have to start over instead of just editing the track you made, a feature missing for some inane reason I'm sure. Online play also still lacks options, allowing you to pick ranked versus unranked and so on, but not what performance class nor car type nor even race type. These should be basic options that aren't relegated to sparsely populated custom lobbies. A personal gripe as well there is no "stock" racing option. Content wise, the game is fine and I'm aware the game will be regularly updated, but among the sea of accessibility options, the game severely lacks some quality of life changes that Horizon would have really benefited from.Update2: There has been an update regarding the ability to edit map creations. Improvements on memory leaks, but will often find the game begin to lag for no reason on occasion still.Update3: For those running into the aforementioned FPS degradation, turn off overlays for applications such as Discord or GeForce experience. The developers have cited this as contributing to the memory leak that causes performance degradation. That being said, I do believe as these are commonly used applications, the developer's should really dedicate themselves to addressing this issue such that a normal user experience isn't impacted.Update4: Horizon Open is bereft with ramming, and your only method of recourse, reporting, is located on the Forza website rather than inside the game. Furthermore, if you didn't take a screenshot or have a video using an overlay program, even though they cause FPS degradation, your report will not be processed, so good â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ luck because the developers made such a stupid decision on handling reporting.

review: Everyone is trash. I wish to be Grand Champ again every season again.

author: beardisweirdd
review: I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: DEMONVIA
review: Found the whole festival vibe to be incredibly cringe, the constant dialog you are bombarded with by the most lamest of characters is excruciating on the ears and brain.Every single little thing you do there's about 10 different stupid pop ups and chimes that occur for achievements, you cannot drive in silence for 30 seconds before being raped by said events. I really could not give a fk about any of these, I don't understand why the modern gamer must be rewarded constantly for doing the most basic of functions, incredibly patronising and annoying. Game really is for kids with 0 attention span and need the constant validation they they are doing something. It's just straight up lame and kills any sort of immersion. Cars are way more arcadey now and soulless, all feel the same, most online races with other payers are just maxxed out supercars crashing into the side railings and poles. Actually better off playing against AI for a proper challenge. Not a very social game either, no one want's to go on cruises or anything,More gamers than actual car guys playing this is probably why. Forza 5 is not a game for car enthusiasts.
