author: Snarky
review: Unfortunately I cannot recommend Forza Horizon 5. I absolutely loved Forza Horizon 4, so when 5 released I was super eager to buy It. I had my credit card ready the second it released. Unfortunately this has to be the worst $60 I've ever spent. They've removed so many good features from 4. The game is extremely boring race wise. Pretty much every race is the same. Don't waste your money on this game!

author: Seth-Rah
review: Note: This game is included in Xbox Game Pass for PC. If you want to play it affordably, then that's your better option.The game is just Forza Horizon 4 again with a new map.The minor additions / alterations made to the game aren't really enough to make the game feel different. But Forza Horizon 4 was pretty great so it's not a bad thing, just don't come in expecting it to re-invent the wheel.My complaint about the game is that the protagonist stopped being silent. Now you're cringe with everyone around you as well.Something worth noting is the adjustments to car sounds are pretty great.

author: tricky T
review: I would have loved to upvote this game - but for a billion dollar revenue game it just doesn't deliver - online still doesn't work smoothly - random bans for legit livery creators, while you have anime titties everywhere. Edit: I almost forgot a shedload of cheaters plus online shameless ramming and no ranked system to avoid aggressive ramming kids.If you can get it for less than $40 take it, otherwise leave itEdit: I play it about 10h/week, because the weekly challenges make me return. They are fun. Most of the critique above is still acurate - sad as it is. I'm below 1$/hour now, so I can't really say anything. Playing online still sucks - I had a lot of rage quits. just because it didn't work properly...Edit: Now - 5 months after release - it has improved minimally, but the original review is still valid. There is some kind of custom online racing but not the way ranked would work.Edit: Now, after almost a year, some things get fixed, but it's still too buggy for a billion dollar revenue game. Game crashes all over, disconnects, ...don't buy it for full priceEdit: Not I'm at almost 400h and I don't think I will play much more. I did the weeklies, that's how the hours came together. Now in early december 2022 after a year of recycling I don't see the game improve much over the future. Do not buy. Play FH4, I'll go back to FH4 as well I guess. Also I can't get any more cars without gifting cars, because the garage is limited to a thousend cars. Fair enough. But today I had to delete paint on my cars to have paint on a new car which really sucks ass.Edit: Uninstalled it. There's so much better stuff you can do with 130GB. If I come back to FH, it will be FH4 and not FH5. Don't pay more than $25, content gets recycled and all the above criticism

author: FF-speed
review: good

author: GriZzy
review: Every time I play Forza Horizon, it makes me sad to drive cars that I can't have for the rest of my life...

author: bijinius
review: When this game works, it's a 10. when it works. when it's still, quiet, not screaming lamely desperate "Gen-Z by Gen-X" hip-talk at you, when it's not speaking FOR you, when it just ... shuts ... up. and the still of the Mexican shore sunrise is suddenly torn by the screeching of your tires, the roar of your engine, going wherever you feel like going. it's an amazing thing. when it works. when it IS screeching at you, and the NPCs are endlessly yammering away in their endlessly-positive / endlessly-cloying trite nonsense, it's REALLY aggravating. I mean more than usual, even. this game is clearly desperate to be liked, and that's a shame, since it's so much better than that at its peaks. it's the last game, only in Mexico, and looks better, map's QUITE a bit more drab and samey, though it's no slouch. there's certainly a lot of SAND and ROCKS. none of the great seasonal changes of Britain, but that's expectable. aaaanyway. get it on sale and you won't go too wrong. WARNING - WARNING - WARNING DO ***NOT*** PURCHASE THE HOT WHEELS DLC. IT'S HORRIBLE, IN MY OPINION.

author: Twist28712
review: It's pretty great when it works.  Unfortunately, that's not often.When it works, I'd say it is a great game.  As it is now, after the game being in my inventory for more than 30 hours, I still have not had it work for more than 2 hours.  It constantly crashes to desktop while driving around, using menus, or sometimes just fails to start in the first place.  I'm running on an I9-9900k 3.6GHz, 11Gb RTX 2080 Ti, and 64Gb DDR4, more than enough power for this game, it's their servers that have the issue.At this time, I cannot recommend this game due to it's status of being mostly non-working.  They should have an update soon, hopefully that fixes these problems.  Until then, be forewarned that this game has severe connectivity issues.*Edit:  I've refunded the game for now, I'll try again when they have a working game.

author: Cr4ft3il
review: Doesnt Launch when trying to play the Game. Splash screen appears for a few seconds and then the game closes. This problem persists since the last Hot Wheels Update. Paid 60EUR for a game I can't play anymore. Waste of money. Don't buy in the Current state. I'm not the only one with this problem, just google "Fh5 doesn't launch" and you will find thousands of people with the same problem (especially Reddit)...I tried almost every workaround and nothing worked. And I'm not going to reinstall Windows for a single game (which apparently doesn't work for lots of people) What a shame. WORKAROUND FOUND:What i did:- Deactivate Antivirus- Deactivate Automatic OC and XMP in BIOS- Launch ForzaHorizon5.exe as administrator and without Fullscreen optimization- Deactivate any other GPU's you might have instead of your main one

author: Kelvier
review: A decent racing game, if you liked burn-out paradise this isn't bad and worth a try.The good.-Driving feels tight. (In manual w/clutch there is a delay with switching gears can be annoying at times. )-Music is Pretty good. -Tons of challenges to enjoy even offline.-Fun / annoying collectibles.-Leaderboards. ( Best enjoyed trying to beat friends times. )-Big map.-Community challenges-La familia (This game could be a Vin Diesel game.)The Bad.-Ai scaling is a bit scuffed.-Odd music censorship. ("Tear drops" being an example.)-Minor bugs. (Physics, Invisible props, Double props, etc)-Seems to crash from time to time. (start up getting out of garage menu.)-Voice acting can be hit or miss. (Very stiff and awkward deliveries.) -Asking price is a bit high. (However there is a-lot here if you like challenges and racing.) -issues with Wheel controllers.I love the game personally and played with a Xbox controller. Honestly worth a try at the very least.

author: KiraManaka
review: Honestly, this was the last Forza Horizon Title that I bought on launch.Starting with FH2, I always noticed a steady increase in quality. The games just got better and better.Sadly the Series seems to have peaked in FH4.FH5 has some glaring issues that were always present in the Forza series, but haven't been fixed.- The AI cheats like hell. Even worse than in FH4. i.e. when driving a Vulcan through a Corner at its limit with max Downforce, a random Silvia overtakes you with a 200km/h difference.- The AI cant handle higher performance classes. Try driving the Goliath with X cars on unbeatable, and you have to try to lose to be able to do so. The AI cars just rocket into every available Wall.- Graphics Bugs are quite common.- The Auction House is filled with bots (well I guess its realistic nowadays)- Rallye Stages are Street races with a bit of dirt in between. You cant do a proper Rallye Race only on Dirt Tracks.- The Map is just Boring. I don't need a huge map for the sake of being huge. Only the Outskirts of the map are visually stimulating, while the middle is just plain boring and empty.-Lower performance classes are neglected. Every part of the map seems to be tailored towards the high-performance classes with wide roads and sweeping corners, making lower classes boring to race.-The whole Festival thing is getting old now. Seriously.After all this nagging i still think its an okay game. Too bad this game has no real competition (The Crew 2 does not count). I still play this every now and then due to a lack of better options. I just wish microsoft and Playground games weren't this happy with the mediocracy they create.

author: Emiikee
review: I wish I could play this game without seeing just the dumbest glitches imaginable. On top of that, this game crashes so easily. Playing music in another program? Crash. Have a chrome tab open? Crash. Discord open and not even doing anything? Crash. Have no other programs open but try to paint a car in game? Crash. I shouldn't be having issues like that when I'm running a 3070 and 64gb ram. I even checked my usage and it's not even close to maxing out anything on my system. I really like the Forza series and this has been a massive let down for me.

author: A Smol Wuffer
review: Prior to the update w/ the Rocket Bunny wide body kit, I probably would've given this a light recommend. BUT, ever since the update, the game has become such a resource hog, performance plummets when trying to do any sort of streaming on it, even when decreasing the graphics quality to low since it likes to hog ALL OF THE VRAM. There's also instances where making custom blueprints would refuse to load when you're in a convoy and the game would boot you out of the race and bug out for everyone else in the convoy, AND if you get the unfortunate instance of the game unloading the whole map and reloading, you end up falling through the void, effectively softlocked and have to reset the game itself.That being said, when it works, it works...okayish. But PGG and Turn10 not taking the time fix the game breaking bugs and the club tags STILL bugging out, along with certain people effectively not being able to launch Forza anymore ever since the RB wide body kit update has soured my whole experience in thinking PGG/Turn10 doesn't want to fix the game up aside from "You mean you want more cars?" is quite disappointing because I did enjoy this game to a degree and love the Horizon 5 community that I have come across on Twitch but...it feels like the devs don't care enough to polish the game and stumble back multiple steps after going forward 2 steps.

author: Kevkong aka sQk :-*
review: So far this must be one of the worst racing games I have ever played.The menu is utterly crap. No one who has remotely any idea about UX design would ever approve this holy mess of an UI.Every single car I have tested so far is controlled like a brick. If this is supposed to be anywhere near what is considered realistic then the car manufacturers out there must all be stupid like hell. The only purpose of a car is to be driven, how can something be this bad at its main purpose? A â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ wheelchair is faster while better controllable than those cars.Do not even try to master a car, because not only takes it forever to get from one race to another for some â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ reason, pretty much every event given you different cars to drive. You wanna change the car for the current event? Guess what, you will have to quit the event and we will put you in the middle of nowhere because it is so much fun to drive to the event again, right? right? RIGHT? Only worse than the time you need to get from one event to the next are those unreasonable loading times out of nowhere. Everything works fine, but suddenly the game decides "Hey I wanna show you a black screen and a spinning wheel for like forever, well just because â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ YOU that is why".And do not get me started on those "world activities" like XP boards and such crap. Who in their right mind would ever say: "Well this is a racing game, why not place some board on a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ roof and let the player figure out how to get there with a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ car. This sure sounds like fun, right, right? RIGHT?". Whoever considers those elements fun a racing game sure must love some prostate cancer, for some extra fun.If you think a colonoscopy sounds like fun, you should buy this game.

author: ColdCarnage
review: Game is fun early on but becomes incredibly boring not too long in, with the only thing making you come back is the fear of missing out on new cars which are just cars that have already been in the previous games for the most part, once that subsides you won't be playing this game again. For some reason the developers think that adding more cars is an excuse for making a lackluster and boring story with no depth to progression. The games don't change from one another, if you want to try it get it on game pass or on a huge discount otherwise it's simply not worth the money.The multiplayer in the game is horrible and not fun, in the open world people disappear constantly and convoy system doesn't work properly. Map sucks and isn't fun to drive around with only one decent drift mountain that barely passes as a good drift area. AI cheats at higher difficulties breaking the laws of physics in front of you and having infinite grip allowing it to accelerate through corners.Cars all pretty much feel the same. If I want to make an older car capable of s1 class I have to add a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ looking front splitter and rear wing that every single other car will have with no variety being added even to this day. In regards to meta tuning there are upgrades that are more PI effiecient than others making you never want to pick those upgrades, as a result of this only a couple engines should ever be used because all the other ones just suck.

author: Indie
review: If you loved Forza Horizon 4, don't wait! Just buy this game!Almost everything you loved from the previous titles got better here. Beautiful visual, tons of contents, banger soundtracks.That said however, there are some downsides :- Online experience is still wonky, friends invisible even when already in convoy, and there's a frequent disconnection issue- Some annoying bugs, both gameplay and visual bugs (no, it's not your GPU artifacting, it's the game)- Game requires heavy computer power, if you're running max settings (extreme), 8GB of VRAM isn't enough. And it eats through 98% of your GPU power. Do not run any other applications in the background, even Youtube video gets heavy if being run at the same time with FH5. Also, if you've played for like over 2-3 hours, you'll notice stutterings which indicates something like a memory leak.

author: King0fgames ãƒ„
review: Game is gorgeous, cars are great, but the absolutely horrible AI completely ruins the game. They all stick to the racing line like they're on a disneyland ride, completely ignore physics, and you have to rewind or restart the race over and over until the 1 AI that's always far ahead of every other car in the race decides to be slightly less insane. Once you pass that AI it becomes completely worthless like the rest of them, and never even tries to pass you. It isn't a race with 15 other cars, it's a race against 1 with 14 obstacles you either pass in the first turn to have a chance at winning, or have to restart the race until you do.

author: jdesousa105
review: The best racing game I've played in years. The environments are beautiful and impressive, the car list/customization is great, and the gameplay is honestly addicting. AND, whether you have a disability, whether you have a lot or a little experience, whether you have a nice or garbage PC, the game is designed so that you can still enjoy it. It's easy to see that they gave a lot of consideration to their fans/customers and put a lot of effort into this product.It does have a memory leak issue that needs to get patched. I still give the game 10/10.
